that business be free from governmental supervision and notions of morality which might clog the automatic adjustments of the free market ; ;	CS NN BE JJ IN JJ NN CC NNS IN NN WDT MD VB AT JJ NNS IN AT JJ NN . .
that obligations of status that were inconsistent with the new politics and the new economics be done away with .	CS NNS IN NN WPS BED JJ IN AT JJ NN CC AT JJ NN BE VBN RB IN .
Contract -- conceived as the free bargain of formal equals -- replaced the implied obligations of a more static and status-conscious society .	NN -- VBN CS AT JJ NN IN JJ NNS -- VBD AT VBN NNS IN AT QL JJ CC JJ NN .
Indeed , contract was the dominant legal theme of the century , the touchstone of the free society .	RB , NN BEDZ AT JJ JJ NN IN AT NN , AT NN IN AT JJ NN .
Government itself was based upon contract ; ;	NN PPL BEDZ VBN IN NN . .
business organization -- the corporation -- was analyzed in contractual terms ; ;	NN NN -- AT NN -- BEDZ VBN IN JJ NNS . .
trade was based on freedom of contract , and money was lent and borrowed on contractual terms ; ;	NN BEDZ VBN IN NN IN NN , CC NN BEDZ VBN CC VBN IN JJ NNS . .
even marriage and the family was seen as a contractual arrangement .	RB NN CC AT NN BEDZ VBN CS AT JJ NN .
It is not surprising that the international obligations of states were also viewed in terms of contract .	PPS BEZ * JJ CS AT JJ NNS IN NNS BED RB VBN IN NNS IN NN .
In fact , some -- Anzilotti is the principle example -- went so far as to say that all international law could be traced to the single legal norm , Pacta sunt Servanda .	IN NN , DTI -- NP BEZ AT JJS NN -- VBD QL RB CS TO VB CS ABN JJ NN MD BE VBN IN AT AP JJ NN , FW-NNS FW-BER FW-VBG .
The displacement ( at least to a considerable extent ) of the ethical jurisprudence of the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries by positivism reshaped both international law theory and doctrine .	AT NN ( IN AP IN AT JJ NN ) IN AT JJ NN IN AT OD CC OD NNS IN NN VBD ABX JJ NN NN CC NN .
In the first place the new doctrine brought a formal separation of international from municipal law , rejecting the earlier view that both were parts of a universal legal system .	IN AT OD NN AT JJ NN VBD AT JJ NN IN JJ IN JJ NN , VBG AT JJR NN CS ABX BED NNS IN AT JJ JJ NN .
One result was to nationalize much that had been regarded as the law of nations .	CD NN BEDZ TO VB AP WPS HVD BEN VBN CS AT NN IN NNS .
Admiralty law , the law merchant , and the host of problems which arise in private litigation because of some contact with a foreign country were all severed from the older Law of Nations and made dependent on the several national laws .	NN NN , AT NN NN , CC AT NN IN NNS WDT VB IN JJ NN RB IN DTI NN IN AT JJ NN BED ABN VBN IN AT JJR NN-TL IN-TL NNS-TL CC VBN JJ IN AT AP JJ NNS .
Private international law ( which Americans call the `` conflict of laws '' ) was thus segregated from international law proper , or , as it is often called , public international law .	JJ JJ NN ( WDT NPS VB AT `` NN IN NNS '' ) BEDZ RB VBN IN JJ NN JJ , CC , CS PPS BEZ RB VBN , JJ JJ NN .
States were free to enact , within broad , though ( perhaps ) determinate limits , their own rules as to the application of foreign law by their courts , to vary the law merchant , and to enact legislation with regard to many claims arising on the high seas .	NNS BED JJ TO VB , IN JJ , CS ( RB ) JJ NNS , PP$ JJ NNS IN IN AT NN IN JJ NN IN PP$ NNS , TO VB AT NN NN , CC TO VB NN IN NN IN AP NNS VBG IN AT JJ NNS .
The change was not quite so dramatic as it sounds because in fact common norms continued to be invoked by municipal courts and were only gradually changed by legislation , and then largely in marginal situations .	AT NN BEDZ * QL QL JJ CS PPS VBZ CS IN NN JJ NNS VBD TO BE VBN IN JJ NNS CC BED RB RB VBN IN NN , CC RB RB IN JJ NNS .
Mr. Justice Black was one of the minority that rested on the Article 1 , power .	NP NP NP BEDZ CD IN AT NN WPS VBD IN AT NN-TL CD-TL , NN .
In this view , supported by only three members of the Court , a power denied by the specific provisions of Article 3 , was granted by the generality of Article 1 .	IN DT NN , VBN IN RB CD NNS IN AT NN-TL , AT NN VBN IN AT JJ NNS IN NN-TL CD-TL , BEDZ VBN IN AT NN IN NN-TL CD-TL .
If this seems arbitrary , its effect was to treat citizens of the District of Columbia equally with citizens of the states -- at the expense of expanding a troublesome jurisdiction .	CS DT VBZ JJ , PP$ NN BEDZ TO VB NNS IN AT NN-TL IN-TL NP-TL RB IN NNS IN AT NNS -- IN AT NN IN VBG AT JJ NN .
Federal question jurisdiction	JJ-HL NN-HL NN-HL
For almost a hundred years we relied upon state courts ( subject to review by the Supreme Court ) for the protection of most rights arising under national law .	IN RB AT CD NNS PPSS VBD IN NN NNS ( JJ IN NN IN AT JJ-TL NN-TL ) IN AT NN IN AP NNS VBG IN JJ NN .
Then in 1875 , apparently in response to the nationalizing influence of the Civil War , Congress first gave the lower federal courts general authority -- concurrently with state tribunals -- to decide cases involving federal-right questions .	RB IN CD , RB IN NN IN AT VBG NN IN AT JJ-TL NN-TL , NP RB VBD AT JJR JJ NNS JJ NN -- RB IN NN NNS -- TO VB NNS VBG NN NNS .
One purpose of the change was to attain sympathetic enforcement of rights insured by the Civil War amendments against state interference .	CD NN IN AT NN BEDZ TO VB JJ NN IN NNS VBN IN AT JJ-TL NN-TL NNS IN NN NN .
Serious difficulty arose with the advent of Substantive Due Process .	JJ NN VBD IN AT NN IN JJ-TL JJ-TL NN-TL .
An amendment , presumably designed to deal with the problems of newly freed slaves , became a `` laissez-faire '' limitation upon state economic policy .	AT NN , RB VBN TO VB IN AT NNS IN RB VBN NNS , VBD AT `` JJ '' NN IN NN JJ NN .
A flood of federal lower court injunctions seriously impeded the processes of local government .	AT NN IN JJ JJR NN NNS RB VBD AT NNS IN JJ NN .
Congress reacted with a series of measures modifying in various ways what it had granted in 1875 .	NP VBD IN AT NN IN NNS VBG IN AP NNS WDT PPS HVD VBN IN CD .
In 1910 it required the convening of a special three-judge court for the issuance of certain injunctions and allowed direct appeals to the Supreme Court .	IN CD PPS VBD AT NN IN AT JJ JJ NN IN AT NN IN AP NNS CC VBD JJ NNS IN AT JJ-TL NN-TL .
Such legislation was clarified and extended from time to time thereafter .	JJ NN BEDZ VBN CC VBN IN NN IN NN RB .
In 1913 an abortive provision was made for the stay of federal injunction proceedings upon institution of state court test cases .	IN CD AT JJ NN BEDZ VBN IN AT NN IN JJ NN NNS IN NN IN NN NN NN NNS .
The essential ineffectiveness of these measures resulted in 1934 in substantial elimination of federal jurisdiction to enjoin state public utility rate orders .	AT JJ NN IN DTS NNS VBD IN CD IN JJ NN IN JJ NN TO VB NN JJ NN NN NNS .
Three years later similar restraints were imposed upon injunctions against collection of state taxes .	CD NNS RBR JJ NNS BED VBN IN NNS IN NN IN NN NNS .
This saved for state adjudication , in the first instance , the two major areas where federal injunctions had been most obnoxious , but other areas remained vulnerable .	DT VBD IN NN NN , IN AT OD NN , AT CD JJ NNS WRB JJ NNS HVD BEN QL JJ , CC AP NNS VBD JJ .
Meanwhile , the Supreme Court , like Congress , showed misgivings concerning this aspect of government by injunction .	RB , AT JJ-TL NN-TL , CS NP , VBD NNS IN DT NN IN NN IN NN .
Drawing upon the traditional discretion of the chancellor , Mr. Justice Holmes introduced a series of self-imposed judicial restraints that culminated in Mr. Justice Frankfurter's famous doctrine of abstention .	VBG IN AT JJ NN IN AT NN , NP NP NP VBD AT NN IN JJ JJ NNS WPS VBD IN NP NP NP$ JJ NN IN NN .
Whereas the earlier cases turned rather narrowly upon the availability of adequate state remedies , the new emphasis is upon the nature of the state policy at issue .	CS AT JJR NNS VBD QL RB IN AT NN IN JJ NN NNS , AT JJ NN BEZ IN AT NN IN AT NN NN IN NN .
The classic case is Railroad Commission v. Pullman .	AT JJ NN BEZ NN-TL NN-TL IN-TL NP-TL .
The commission had issued an administrative order which was challenged as discriminatory against Negroes .	AT NN HVD VBN AT JJ NN WDT BEDZ VBN CS JJ IN NPS .
Its enforcement was enjoined by a federal trial court .	PP$ NN BEDZ VBN IN AT JJ NN NN .
On review the Supreme Court , via Mr. Justice Frankfurter , found southern racial problems `` a sensitive area of social policy on which the federal courts ought not to enter unless no alternative to adjudication is open '' .	IN NN AT JJ-TL NN-TL , IN NP NP NP , VBD JJ JJ NNS `` AT JJ NN IN JJ NN IN WDT AT JJ NNS MD * TO VB CS AT NN IN NN BEZ JJ '' .
An alternative was found in the vagueness of state law as to whether the offending order had in fact been authorized .	AT NN BEDZ VBN IN AT NN IN NN NN IN IN CS AT VBG NN HVD IN NN BEN VBN .
Reluctant , as usual , to interpret state legislation -- such interpretation can only be a `` forecast rather than a determination '' -- Mr. Justice Frankfurter led a unanimous Court to vacate the injunction .	JJ , CS JJ , TO VB NN NN -- JJ NN MD RB BE AT `` NN RB CS AT NN '' -- NP NP NP VBD AT JJ NN-TL TO VB AT NN .
But it is crucial that here , unlike Burford , the trial court was ordered to retain the case until the state courts had had a reasonable opportunity to settle the state-law question .	CC PPS BEZ JJ CS RB , IN NP , AT NN NN BEDZ VBN TO VB AT NN CS AT NN NNS HVD HVN AT JJ NN TO VB AT NN NN .
`` The resources of equity are equal to an adjustment that will avoid the waste of a tentative decision as well as the friction of a premature constitutional adjudication '' .	`` AT NNS IN NN BER JJ IN AT NN WPS MD VB AT NN IN AT JJ NN QL RB CS AT NN IN AT JJ JJ NN '' .
Temporary abstention , i.e. , postponement , is one thing ; ;	JJ NN , RB , NN , BEZ CD NN . .
refusal to adjudicate is another .	NN TO VB BEZ DT .
To the extent that the jurisdictional principle of 1875 stands unmodified by subsequent legislation , federal equitable relief against state action must be available -- or so it seems to Mr. Justice Frankfurter .	IN AT NN CS AT JJ NN IN CD VBZ JJ IN JJ NN , JJ JJ NN IN NN NN MD BE JJ -- CC RB PPS VBZ IN NP NP NP .
In Alabama Public Service Commission v. Southern Ry. Co. , the commission had refused to permit abandonment of certain `` uneconomic '' train facilities .	IN NP-TL JJ-TL NN-TL NN-TL IN-TL JJ-TL NN-TL NN-TL , AT NN HVD VBN TO VB NN IN AP `` JJ '' NN NNS .
The railroad , claiming deprivation of property without due process of law , sought injunctive relief .	AT NN , VBG NN IN NN IN JJ NN IN NN , VBD JJ NN .
The Court held that federal jurisdiction should not be exercised lest the domestic policy of the state be obstructed ; ;	AT NN-TL VBD CS JJ NN MD * BE VBN CS AT JJ NN IN AT NN BE VBN . .
this in the name of equitable discretion .	DT IN AT NN IN JJ NN .
Justices Frankfurter and Jackson concurred in the Court's result , for they found no merit in the railroad's claim .	NNS-TL NP CC NP VBD IN AT NN$-TL NN , CS PPSS VBD AT NN IN AT NN$ NN .
But they objected vigorously to the proposition that federal courts may refuse to exercise jurisdiction conferred in a valid act of Congress :	CC PPSS VBD RB IN AT NN CS JJ NNS MD VB TO VB NN VBN IN AT JJ NN IN NP :
`` By one fell swoop the Court now finds that Congress indulged in needless legislation in the acts of 1910 , 1913 , 1925 , 1934 and 1937 .	`` IN CD JJ NN AT NN-TL RB VBZ CS NP VBD IN JJ NN IN AT NNS IN CD , CD , CD , CD CC CD .
By these measures , Congress , so the Court ( in effect ) now decides , gave not only needless but inadequate relief , since it now appears that the federal courts have inherent power to sterilize the Act of 1875 against all proceedings challenging local regulation '' .	IN DTS NNS , NP , CS AT NN-TL ( IN NN ) RB VBZ , VBD * RB JJ CC JJ NN , CS PPS RB VBZ CS AT JJ NNS HV JJ NN TO VB AT NN-TL IN CD IN ABN NNS VBG JJ NN '' .
A most revealing recent case is Textile Workers Union v. Lincoln Mills .	AT QL JJ JJ NN BEZ NN-TL NNS-TL NN-TL IN-TL NP-TL NNS-TL .
The Taft-Hartley Act gave the federal courts jurisdiction over `` suits for violation of contracts between an employer and a labor organization representing employees in an industry affecting commerce '' .	AT NP-TL NN-TL VBD AT JJ NNS NN IN `` NNS IN NN IN NNS IN AT NN CC AT NN NN VBG NNS IN AT NN VBG NN '' .
On its face this merely provides a federal forum ; ;	IN PP$ NN DT RB VBZ AT JJ NN . .
it does not establish any law ( rights ) for the federal judges to enforce .	PPS DOZ * VB DTI NN ( NNS ) IN AT JJ NNS TO VB .
How can judges exercise jurisdiction to enforce national rights when Congress has created none ? ?	WRB MD NNS VB NN TO VB JJ NNS WRB NP HVZ VBN PN . .
The Court held that Congress had intended the federal judiciary to `` fashion '' an appropriate law of labor-management contracts .	AT NN-TL VBD CS NP HVD VBN AT JJ NN TO `` VB '' AT JJ NN IN NN NNS .
In short , congressional power to grant federal-question authority to federal courts is now apparently so broad that Congress need not create , or specify , the right to be enforced .	IN JJ , JJ NN TO VB NN NN IN JJ NNS BEZ RB RB QL JJ CS NP MD * VB , CC VB , AT NN TO BE VBN .
The Lincoln Mills decision authorizes a whole new body of federal `` common law '' which , as Mr. Justice Frankfurter pointed out in dissent , leads to one of the following `` incongruities '' : `` ( ( 1 ) conflict in federal and state court interpretations of collective bargaining agreements ; ;	AT NP-TL NNS-TL NN VBZ AT JJ JJ NN IN JJ `` JJ NN '' WDT , CS NP NP NP VBD RP IN NN , VBZ IN CD IN AT VBG `` NNS '' : `` ( ( CD ) NN IN JJ CC NN NN NNS IN JJ NN NNS . .
( 2 ) displacement of state law by federal law in state courts in all actions regarding collective bargaining agreements ; ;	( CD ) NN IN NN NN IN JJ NN IN NN NNS IN ABN NNS IN JJ NN NNS . .
or ( 3 ) exclusion of state court jurisdiction over these matters '' .	CC ( CD ) NN IN NN NN NN IN DTS NNS '' .
The Justice's elaborate examination of the legislative history of the provision in question suggests that Congress' purpose was merely to make unions suable .	AT NN$-TL JJ NN IN AT JJ NN IN AT NN IN NN VBZ CS NP$ NN BEDZ RB TO VB NNS JJ .
With a few exceptions , the lawmakers seemed unaware of the technical problems of federal jurisdiction involved -- to say nothing of the delegation of lawmaking power to judges .	IN AT AP NNS , AT NNS VBD JJ IN AT JJ NNS IN JJ NN VBN -- TO VB PN IN AT NN IN JJ NN IN NNS .
To avoid these constitutional difficulties , Mr. Justice Frankfurter was prepared to read the Taft-Hartley provision as concerned with diversity , rather than federal question , jurisdiction .	TO VB DTS JJ NNS , NP NP NP BEDZ VBN TO VB AT NP NN CS VBN IN NN , RB CS JJ NN , NN .
This would satisfy what presumably was Congress' major purpose -- the suability of unions .	DT MD VB WDT RB BEDZ NP$ JJ NN -- AT NN IN NNS .
It would also leave intact the states' traditional authority in the realm of contract law .	PPS MD RB VB JJ AT NNS$ JJ NN IN AT NN IN NN NN .
( As we have seen , the Erie and York decisions require federal courts in diversity cases to follow state decisional rules .	( CS PPSS HV VBN , AT NP CC NP NNS VB JJ NNS IN NN NNS TO VB NN JJ NNS .
) Here again Mr. Justice Frankfurter could not lightly accept the principle of wholesale judicial legislation .	) RB RB NP NP NP MD * RB VB AT NN IN JJ JJ NN .
If Congress wants to displace the states from areas which they have customarily occupied , let it do so knowingly and explicitly .	CS NP VBZ TO VB AT NNS IN NNS WDT PPSS HV RB VBN , VB PPS DO RB RB CC RB .
And let it do its own lawmaking and not leave that to federal judges .	CC VB PPS DO PP$ JJ NN CC * VB DT IN JJ NNS .
Does Lincoln Mills suggest that if Congress granted jurisdiction over interstate divorce cases , the federal courts would be authorized to fashion a national law for the dissolution of marriages ? ?	DOZ NP-TL NNS-TL VB CS CS NP VBD NN IN JJ NN NNS , AT JJ NNS MD BE VBN TO VB AT JJ NN IN AT NN IN NNS . .
There is a common problem behind most of these federal question and diversity cases .	EX BEZ AT JJ NN IN AP IN DTS JJ NN CC NN NNS .
Congress has not clearly defined the bounds between state and federal court competence .	NP HVZ * RB VBN AT NNS IN NN CC JJ NN NN .
It has the power to do so but for the most part has left the matter for solution by judges on a case-by-case basis .	PPS HVZ AT NN TO DO RB CC IN AT AP NN HVZ VBN AT NN IN NN IN NNS IN AT JJ NN .
A careful student has suggested that `` In any new revision ( of the Judicial Code ) the legislators would do well to remember that the allocation of power to the federal courts should be limited to those matters in which their expertise in federal law might be used , leaving to the state judiciaries the primary obligation of pronouncing state law '' .	AT JJ NN HVZ VBN CS `` IN DTI JJ NN ( IN AT JJ-TL NN-TL ) AT NNS MD DO RB TO VB CS AT NN IN NN IN AT JJ NNS MD BE VBN IN DTS NNS IN WDT PP$ NN IN JJ NN MD BE VBN , VBG IN AT NN NNS AT JJ NN IN VBG NN NN '' .
Obviously , the goal here proposed is the guiding principle in Mr. Justice Frankfurter's opinions -- to the extent that Congress leaves the problem to judicial discretion .	RB , AT NN RB VBN BEZ AT VBG NN IN NP NP NP$ NNS -- IN AT NN CS NP VBZ AT NN IN JJ NN .
The same rule of specialization and division of labor guides him in the FELA certiorari cases , in the administrative law area , and indeed in the whole realm of judicial review .	AT AP NN IN NN CC NN IN NN VBZ PPO IN AT NN NN NNS , IN AT JJ NN NN , CC RB IN AT JJ NN IN JJ NN .
Mr. Justice Black no doubt concurs in principle but is more apt to make exceptions to achieve a generous and `` just '' result .	NP NP NP AT NN VBZ IN NN CC BEZ QL JJ TO VB NNS TO VB AT JJ CC `` JJ '' NN .
He will not be `` fooled by technicalities '' .	PPS MD * BE `` VBN IN NNS '' .
Federal review of state decisions	JJ-HL NN-HL IN-HL NN-HL NNS-HL
With few exceptions , Congress has not given federal courts exclusive authority to enforce rights arising under federal law .	IN AP NNS , NP HVZ * VBN JJ NNS JJ NN TO VB NNS VBG IN JJ NN .
To put it differently , state and federal courts have concurrent jurisdiction with respect to most claims of federal right .	TO VB PPO RB , NN CC JJ NNS HV JJ NN IN NN IN AP NNS IN JJ NN .
To insure uniformity in the meaning of national law , however , state interpretations are subject to Supreme Court review .	TO VB NN IN AT NN IN JJ NN , RB , NN NNS BER JJ IN JJ-TL NN-TL NN .
It may be noted , parenthetically , that to evade `` desegregation '' an ex-Justice and former southern governor has urged Congress to abolish this reviewing authority .	PPS MD BE VBN , RB , CS TO VB `` NN '' AT NN CC AP JJ NN HVZ VBN NP TO VB DT VBG NN .
The result , of course , would be that federal law inevitably would mean different things in different states .	AT NN , IN NN , MD BE CS JJ NN RB MD VB JJ NNS IN JJ NNS .
It would also probably mean different things within the same state -- depending upon what court ( state or federal ) rendered decision .	PPS MD RB RB VB JJ NNS IN AT AP NN -- IN IN WDT NN ( NN CC JJ ) VBD NN .
We consider here only a few of many problems involved in this crucial federal-state relationship .	PPSS VB RB RB AT AP IN AP NNS VBN IN DT JJ NN NN .
The first is that enforcement of national law in state litigation raises in reverse the old diversity puzzle of the relation of procedure to substance .	AT OD BEZ CS NN IN JJ NN IN NN NN VBZ IN JJ AT JJ NN NN IN AT NN IN NN IN NN .
Subject to certain constitutional restraints in favor of fair trials , each level of government is free to devise its own judicial procedures .	JJ IN AP JJ NNS IN NN IN JJ NNS , DT NN IN NN BEZ JJ TO VB PP$ JJ JJ NNS .
Litigants who choose to assert federal claims in a state court go into that court subject to its rules of procedure .	NNS WPS VB TO VB JJ NNS IN AT NN NN VB IN DT NN JJ IN PP$ NNS IN NN .
A similar canon applies to those who press state claims in federal tribunals , e.g. , in diversity cases .	AT JJ NN VBZ IN DTS WPS VB NN NNS IN JJ NNS , RB , IN NN NNS .
In an FELA controversy the state court followed established state procedure by construing a vague complaint `` most strongly against '' the complainant .	IN AT NN NN AT NN NN VBD VBN NN NN IN VBG AT JJ NN `` QL RB IN '' AT NN .
In other words the burden of pleading clearly rested upon the pleader by state law .	IN AP NNS AT NN IN VBG RB VBD IN AT NN IN NN NN .
The result was that the plaintiff's case was dismissed .	AT NN BEDZ CS AT NN$ NN BEDZ VBN .
Mr. Justice Black led a reversing majority : `` Strict local rules of pleading cannot be used to impose unnecessary burdens upon rights of recovery authorized by federal law '' .	NP NP NP VBD AT VBG NN : `` JJ JJ NNS IN VBG MD* BE VBN TO VB JJ NNS IN NNS IN NN VBN IN JJ NN '' .
Here , as in the Byrd case , another element of state procedure was subsumed to federal judge-made law .	RB , CS IN AT NP NN , DT NN IN NN NN BEDZ VBN IN JJ JJ NN .
Justices Frankfurter and Jackson dissented : `` One State may cherish formalities more than another , one State may be more responsive than another to procedural reforms .	NNS-TL NP CC NP VBD : `` CD NN-TL MD VB NNS RBR CS DT , CD NN-TL MD BE QL JJ CS DT IN JJ NNS .
If a litigant chooses to enforce a Federal right in a State court , he cannot be heard to object if he is treated exactly as are plaintiffs who press like claims arising under State law with regard to the form in which the claim must be stated -- the particularity , for instance , with which a cause of action must be described .	CS AT NN VBZ TO VB AT JJ-TL NN IN AT NN-TL NN , PPS MD* BE VBN TO VB CS PPS BEZ VBN RB CS BER NNS WPS VB JJ NNS VBG IN NN-TL NN IN NN IN AT NN IN WDT AT NN MD BE VBN -- AT NN , IN NN , IN WDT AT NN IN NN MD BE VBN .
Federal law , though invoked in a State court , delimits the Federal claim -- defines what gives a right to recovery and what goes to prove it .	JJ NN , CS VBN IN AT NN-TL NN , VBZ AT JJ-TL NN -- VBZ WDT VBZ AT NN IN NN CC WDT VBZ TO VB PPO .
But the form in which the claim must be stated need not be different from what the State exacts in the enforcement of like obligations created by it , so long as a requirement does not add to , or diminish , the right as defined by Federal law , nor burden the realization of this right in the actualities of litigation '' .	CC AT NN IN WDT AT NN MD BE VBN MD * BE JJ IN WDT AT NN-TL VBZ IN AT NN IN JJ NNS VBN IN PPO , QL RB CS AT NN DOZ * VB IN , CC VB , AT NN CS VBN IN JJ-TL NN , CC VB AT NN IN DT NN IN AT NNS IN NN '' .
Another problem in the area of federal-state relationships is this : what constitutes reversible error in a state decision ? ?	DT NN IN AT NN IN NN NNS BEZ DT : WDT VBZ JJ NN IN AT NN NN . .
Terminiello v. Chicago involved a conviction for disorderly conduct under a local ordinance .	NP-TL IN-TL NP-TL VBD AT NN IN JJ NN IN AT JJ NN .
The conduct in question was a speech .	AT NN IN NN BEDZ AT NN .
The accused did not object to the trial court's charge to the jury that discourse `` may constitute a breach of the peace if it stirs the public to anger , invites dispute , brings about a condition of unrest .	AT VBN DOD * VB IN AT NN NN$ NN IN AT NN CS NN `` MD VB AT NN IN AT NN CS PPS VBZ AT NN IN NN , VBZ NN , VBZ RP AT NN IN NN .
'' For present purposes it may be assumed that this charge so narrowly limited speech as to violate the federal Constitution .	'' IN JJ NNS PPS MD BE VBN CS DT NN QL RB VBD NN CS TO VB AT JJ NN-TL .
Though the accused raised many other objections , he did not object on this crucial point at any stage of the proceedings .	CS AT VBN VBD AP AP NNS , PPS DOD * VB IN DT JJ NN IN DTI NN IN AT NNS .
That is , he did not claim in any of the four courts through which his case progressed that the jury charge had denied him any federal right .	DT BEZ , PPS DOD * VB IN DTI IN AT CD NNS IN WDT PP$ NN VBD CS AT NN NN HVD VBN PPO DTI JJ NN .
How else can one explain , for example , allowing the survival of the right to amortize bond discount and premium ( section 381(c)(9) ) , but not the right to amortize bond issue expenses ; ;	WRB RB MD PN VB , IN NN , VBG AT NN IN AT NN TO VB NN NN CC NN ( NN CD ) , CC * AT NN TO VB NN NN NNS . .
or allowing a deduction for payment of certain obligations of a transferor assumed in the reorganization ( section 381(c)(16) ) , but not a deduction for theft losses sustained by a transferor prior to a reorganization but discovered after it ; ;	CC VBG AT NN IN NN IN AP NNS IN AT NN VBN IN AT NN ( NN CD ) , CC * AT NN IN NN NNS VBN IN AT NN RB IN AT NN CC VBN IN PPO . .
or requiring a transferor to carry over its method of depreciation ( section 381(c)(6) ) , but not allowing rapid amortization of emergency facilities transferred in a reorganization ; ;	CC VBG AT NN TO VB RP PP$ NN IN NN ( NN CD ) , CC * VBG JJ NN IN NN NNS VBN IN AT NN . .
or allowing survival of a dividend carryover to a personal holding company ( section 381(c)(14) ) , but not carryover of excess tax credits for foreign taxes ? ?	CC VBG NN IN AT NN NN IN AT JJ VBG NN ( NN CD ) , CC * NN IN JJ NN NNS IN JJ NNS . .
These items , and most of the others listed above , seem quite comparable to items whose right of survival is provided for in section 381 .	DTS NNS , CC AP IN AT NNS VBN RB , VB QL JJ IN NNS WP$ NN IN NN BEZ VBN IN IN NN CD .
There does not seem to be any reasonable basis for distinction either in terms of the nature of the tax attribute or in terms of tax-avoidance possibilities .	EX DOZ * VB TO BE DTI JJ NN IN NN CC IN NNS IN AT NN IN AT NN NN CC IN NNS IN NN NNS .
With respect to items such as these the provisions of section 381(c) , viewed in historical perspective , suggest a rule requiring survival , whether the items are beneficial or detrimental to the surviving corporation .	IN NN IN NNS JJ CS DTS AT NNS IN NN CD , VBN IN JJ NN , VB AT NN VBG NN , CS AT NNS BER JJ CC JJ IN AT VBG NN .
To this extent some stretching of the literal meaning of the Committee Report seems justified , since the literal meaning conflicts with the clear implication , if not the language , of the statute .	IN DT NN DTI VBG IN AT JJ NN IN AT NN-TL NN-TL VBZ VBN , CS AT JJ NN VBZ IN AT JJ NN , CS * AT NN , IN AT NN .
It is not contended that section 381 should prescribe the survival of all of the transferor's tax attributes .	PPS BEZ * VBN CS NN CD MD VB AT NN IN ABN IN AT NN$ NN NNS .
Such an interpretation could not be justified by a construction of the statute alone ; ;	ABL AT NN MD * BE VBN IN AT NN IN AT NN JJ . .
it would certainly violate the intention of Congress as expressed in the Committee Report ; ;	PPS MD RB VB AT NN IN NP CS VBN IN AT NN-TL NN-TL . .
and in at least one instance , involving refund claims , it might be contrary to another provision of the United States Code .	CC IN IN AP CD NN , VBG NN-HL NNS-HL , PPS MD BE JJ IN DT NN IN AT VBN-TL NNS-TL NN-TL .
Refund claims	NN NNS
Section 203 of the United States Code voids an assignment of a claim against the Government unless made after it has been allowed , the amount due has been ascertained , and a warrant for its payment has been issued .	NN CD IN AT VBN-TL NNS-TL NN-TL VBZ AT NN IN AT NN IN AT NN-TL CS VBN CS PPS HVZ BEN VBN , AT NN JJ HVZ BEN VBN , CC AT NN IN PP$ NN HVZ BEN VBN .
If it were not for judicial development of certain exceptions , this section would prohibit a suit for refund by an acquiring corporation for taxes paid by a transferor corporation , even though the reorganization meets the requirements of section 381(a) .	CS PPS BED * IN JJ NN IN AP NNS , DT NN MD VB AT NN IN NN IN AT VBG NN IN NNS VBN IN AT NN NN , RB CS AT NN VBZ AT NNS IN NN CD .
A clearly recognized exception is a statutory merger or consolidation .	AT RB VBN NN BEZ AT JJ NN CC NN .
The leading case , Seaboard Air Line Railway v. United States , held that the transferee could sue for a refund of taxes paid by the transferor , and it has been consistently followed .	AT VBG NN , NN-TL NN-TL NN-TL NN-TL IN-TL VBN-TL NNS-TL , VBD CS AT NN MD VB IN AT NN IN NNS VBN IN AT NN , CC PPS HVZ BEN RB VBN .
The Court said the purpose of the section was principally to spare the Government the embarrassment and trouble of dealing with several parties , one of them a stranger to the claim , and to prevent traffic in claims , particularly tenuous claims , against the Government .	AT NN-TL VBD AT NN IN AT NN BEDZ RB TO VB AT NN-TL AT NN CC NN IN VBG IN AP NNS , CD IN PPO AT NN IN AT NN , CC TO VB NN IN NNS , RB JJ NNS , IN AT NN-TL .
Neither reason , said the Court , applied to the case at hand ; ;	DTX NN , VBD AT NN-TL , VBD IN AT NN IN NN . .
furthermore , Congress could not be presumed to have intended to obstruct mergers approved by the states .	RB , NP MD * BE VBN TO HV VBN TO VB NNS VBN IN AT NNS .
Other exceptions are assignments for the benefit of creditors , corporate dissolutions , transfers by descent , or transfers by subrogation .	AP NNS BER NNS IN AT NN IN NNS , JJ NNS , NNS IN NN , CC NNS IN NN .
Exceptions are often classified as transfers by `` operation of law '' .	NNS BER RB VBN CS NNS IN `` NN IN NN '' .
A tax-free reorganization not complying with the merger or consolidation statutes of the states involved is difficult to fit into an `` operation of law '' mold .	AT JJ NN * VBG IN AT NN CC NN NNS IN AT NNS VBN BEZ JJ TO VB IN AT `` NN IN NN '' NN .
Although it is in some ways comparable to a voluntary sale of assets for cash , to which section 203 quite clearly applies , the courts and Treasury have held that acquiring corporations in several types of non-taxable reorganizations may sue for refund of taxes paid by transferors .	CS PPS BEZ IN DTI NNS JJ IN AT JJ NN IN NNS IN NN , IN WDT NN CD QL RB VBZ , AT NNS CC NN-TL HV VBN CS VBG NNS IN AP NNS IN JJ NNS MD VB IN NN IN NNS VBN IN NNS .
A recent case in point is Mitchell Canneries v. United States , in which a claim against the Government was transferred first from a corporation to a partnership , whose partners were former stockholders , and then to another corporation formed by the partners .	AT JJ NN IN NN BEZ NP-TL NNS-TL IN-TL VBN-TL NNS-TL , IN WDT AT NN IN AT NN-TL BEDZ VBN RB IN AT NN IN AT NN , WP$ NNS BED AP NNS , CC RB IN DT NN VBN IN AT NNS .
Holding the final corporation entitled to sue on the claim , the Court cited the Seaboard , Novo Trading , and Roomberg cases for the proposition that `` transfers by operation of law or in conjunction with changes of corporate structure are not assignments prohibited by the statute '' .	VBG AT JJ NN VBN TO VB IN AT NN , AT NN-TL VBD AT NN-TL , NP-TL VBG-TL , CC NP NNS IN AT NN CS `` NNS IN NN IN NN CC IN NN IN NNS IN JJ NN BER * NNS VBN IN AT NN '' .
In an earlier case , Kingan & Co. v. United States , an American corporation was formed for the purpose of acquiring the stock of a British corporation in exchange for its own stock and then liquidating the British corporation .	IN AT JJR NN , NP-TL CC-TL NN-TL IN-TL VBN-TL NNS-TL , AT JJ NN BEDZ VBN IN AT NN IN VBG AT NN IN AT JJ NN IN NN IN PP$ JJ NN CC RB VBG AT JJ NN .
The anti-assignment statute was held not to prevent the American corporation from suing for a refund of taxes paid by the British corporation .	AT JJ NN BEDZ VBN * TO VB AT JJ NN IN VBG IN AT NN IN NNS VBN IN AT JJ NN .
The transaction presumably would have qualified under section 368(a)(1) as a contractual reorganization , followed by a section 332 liquidation , but not under section 368(a)(1) as a statutory merger of consolidation .	AT NN RB MD HV VBN IN NN CD CS AT JJ NN , VBN IN AT NN CD NN , CC * IN NN CD CS AT JJ NN IN NN .
The Court , nevertheless , relied on the Seaboard case and also mentioned that the shareholders of the two corporations were the same .	AT NN-TL , RB , VBD IN AT NN-TL NN CC RB VBD CS AT NNS IN AT CD NNS BED AT AP .
In substance , said the Court , there was no transfer of equitable title .	IN NN , VBD AT NN-TL , EX BEDZ AT NN IN JJ NN .
The Treasury arrives at substantially the same conclusion , but skirts the problem of section 203 of the United States Code .	AT NN-TL VBZ IN RB AT AP NN , CC VBZ AT NN IN NN CD IN AT VBN-TL NNS-TL NN-TL .
Revenue Ruling 54-17 provides that if the corporation against which a tax was assessed has since been liquidated by merger with a successor corporation , a claim for refund should be filed by the successor in the name and on behalf of the corporation which paid the tax , followed by the name of the successor corporation .	NN-TL NN-TL CD VBZ CS CS AT NN IN WDT AT NN BEDZ VBN HVZ RB BEN VBN IN NN IN AT NN NN , AT NN IN NN MD BE VBN IN AT NN IN AT NN CC IN NN IN AT NN WDT VBD AT NN , VBN IN AT NN IN AT NN NN .
Proper evidence of the liquidation and succession must also be filed .	JJ NN IN AT NN CC NN MD RB BE VBN .
If the succession is a matter of public record , certificates of the Secretaries of State or other public officials having custody of the documents will suffice ; ;	CS AT NN BEZ AT NN IN JJ NN , NNS IN AT NNS-TL IN-TL NN-TL CC AP JJ NNS HVG NN IN AT NNS MD VB . .
if the succession is not of record , all documents relating to such succession , properly certified , are required .	CS AT NN BEZ * IN NN , ABN NNS VBG IN JJ NN , RB VBN , BER VBN .
The former proof seems applicable to a statutory merger or consolidation , the latter to a contractual acquisition .	AT AP NN VBZ JJ IN AT JJ NN CC NN , AT AP IN AT JJ NN .
The Ruling would not , however , apply to an acquisition of assets for cash .	AT NN-TL MD * , RB , VB IN AT NN IN NNS IN NN .
A recent Ruling , although rather confusing , cites and follows Rev. Rul. 54-17 .	AT JJ NN-TL , CS QL VBG , VBZ CC VBZ NP NN-TL CD-TL .
The Ruling suggests also that it applies to either a statutory or contractual reorganization .	AT NN-TL VBZ RB CS PPS VBZ IN CC AT JJ CC JJ NN .
Hence , a successor corporation in a C reorganization appears entitled to sue for a refund of taxes paid by the merged corporation despite section 203 .	RB , AT NN NN IN AT NN NN VBZ VBN TO VB IN AT NN IN NNS VBN IN AT VBN NN IN NN CD .
In a B reorganization , followed by a section 332 liquidation , those cases which hold that section 203 is inapplicable to transfers in liquidation appear to permit the successor corporation to sue for refund of taxes paid by the transferor .	IN AT NN NN , VBN IN AT NN CD NN , DTS NNS WDT VB CS NN CD BEZ JJ IN NNS IN NN VB TO VB AT NN NN TO VB IN NN IN NNS VBN IN AT NN .
In fact , a cash purchase of a corporation's stock followed by liquidation might also be an effective way to transfer a claim for refund if the Kimbell-Diamond doctrine is not applied to eliminate the intermediate step .	IN NN , AT NN NN IN AT NN$ NN VBN IN NN MD RB BE AT JJ NN TO VB AT NN IN NN CS AT NP NN BEZ * VBN TO VB AT JJ NN .
These results appear sound .	DTS NNS VB JJ .
As stated in Seaboard and numerous other cases , the two primary reasons for the enactment of section 203 of the United States Code were to prevent the Government from having to deal with more than one claimant and to prevent the assignment of meretricious claims on a contingent-fee basis .	CS VBN IN NN-TL CC JJ AP NNS , AT CD JJ NNS IN AT NN IN NN CD IN AT VBN-TL NNS-TL NN-TL BED TO VB AT NN-TL IN HVG TO VB IN AP IN CD NN CC TO VB AT NN IN JJ NNS IN AT NN NN .
The cases have allowed transfer of claims if beneficial ownership is not changed .	AT NNS HV VBN NN IN NNS CS JJ NN BEZ * VBN .
The first reason would never apply to a reorganization transfer which meets the conditions of section 381(a) , which is the only type presently under discussion .	AT OD NN MD RB VB IN AT NN NN WDT VBZ AT NNS IN NN CD , WDT BEZ AT AP NN RB IN NN .
Section 381(a) applies only to a transfer by liquidation of a subsidiary owned to the extent of at least 80 per cent , a statutory merger or consolidation , an acquisition of substantially all a corporation's assets solely in exchange for voting stock , or a change of identity , form , or place of organization .	NN CD VBZ RB IN AT NN IN NN IN AT NN VBN IN AT NN IN IN AP CD IN NN , AT JJ NN CC NN , AT NN IN RB ABN AT NN$ NNS RB IN NN IN VBG NN , CC AT NN IN NN , NN , CC NN IN NN .
In virtually every case the transferor corporation is liquidated , and its former stockholders either own outright , or have a continuing stock interest in , the assets which gave rise to the tax .	IN RB AT NN AT NN NN BEZ VBN , CC PP$ AP NNS CC VB RB , CC HV AT VBG NN NN IN , AT NNS WDT VBD NN IN AT NN .
In these circumstances the possibility of multiple or conflicting claims is exceedingly remote .	IN DTS NNS AT NN IN JJ CC VBG NNS BEZ QL JJ .
Furthermore , in a C reorganization the continuing interest of stockholders of the corporation which paid the tax must be greater than is necessary in a statutory merger , to which the statute is clearly inapplicable .	RB , IN AT NN NN AT VBG NN IN NNS IN AT NN WDT VBD AT NN MD BE JJR CS BEZ JJ IN AT JJ NN , IN WDT AT NN BEZ RB JJ .
Nor is it at all likely that a `` desperate '' claim against the Government will be assigned on a contingent-fee basis in the guise of a tax-free reorganization .	CC BEZ PPS IN ABN JJ CS AT `` JJ '' NN IN AT NN-TL MD BE VBN IN AT NN NN IN AT NN IN AT JJ NN .
If the transferor has substantial assets other than the claim , it seems reasonable to assume no corporation would be willing to acquire all of its properties in the dim hope of collecting a claim for refund of taxes .	CS AT NN HVZ JJ NNS AP CS AT NN , PPS VBZ JJ TO VB AT NN MD BE JJ TO VB ABN IN PP$ NNS IN AT JJ NN IN VBG AT NN IN NN IN NNS .
If such an unlikely transaction were to take place , it would more logically be accomplished by a stock purchase , followed by the prosecution of the claim by the wholly-owned subsidiary , followed by liquidation .	CS ABL AT JJ NN BED TO VB NN , PPS MD QL RB BE VBN IN AT NN NN , VBN IN AT NN IN AT NN IN AT JJ NN , VBN IN NN .
In the rare case where a corporation's only substantial asset , or its most important one , is a claim for refund , perhaps its transfer should not be permitted , whether the reorganization takes the form of a statutory merger or of the acquisition of assets for stock .	IN AT JJ NN WRB AT NN$ AP JJ NN , CC PP$ QL JJ CD , BEZ AT NN IN NN , RB PP$ NN MD * BE VBN , CS AT NN VBZ AT NN IN AT JJ NN CC IN AT NN IN NNS IN NN .
It appears , then , that although the matter is not dealt with in section 381(c) , a successor corporation in a reorganization of a type specified in section 381(a) is entitled to sue for refund of taxes paid by a transferor corporation .	PPS VBZ , RB , CS CS AT NN BEZ * VBN IN IN NN CD , AT NN NN IN AT NN IN AT NN VBN IN NN CD BEZ VBN TO VB IN NN IN NNS VBN IN AT NN NN .
Section 203 of the United States Code has been interpreted as not applying to claims against the Government transferred in tax-free reorganizations .	NN CD IN AT VBN-TL NNS-TL NN-TL HVZ BEN VBN CS * VBG IN NNS IN AT NN-TL VBN IN JJ NNS .
The successor corporations have been held entitled to sue on such claims .	AT NN NNS HV BEN VBN VBN TO VB IN JJ NNS .
Other tax attributes of the transferor	AP-HL NN-HL NNS-HL IN-HL AT-HL NN-HL
There are certain tax attributes of a corporation whose nature and effect might depend on the facts of the particular reorganization involved .	EX BER AP NN NNS IN AT NN WP$ NN CC NN MD VB IN AT NNS IN AT JJ NN VBN .
For example , property `` used in the trade or business '' of a transferor corporation , as defined in section 1231 , presumably would not retain its special status following a non-taxable reorganization if it is not so used in the business of the acquiring corporation .	IN NN , NN `` VBN IN AT NN CC NN '' IN AT NN NN , CS VBN IN NN CD , RB MD * VB PP$ JJ NN IN AT JJ NN CS PPS BEZ * RB VBN IN AT NN IN AT VBG NN .
The parent of a group filing consolidated returns might be treated as the same corporation following a reorganization defined in section 368(a)(1) , but as a different corporation for this purpose after a tax-free acquisition by another corporation which had not , for example , elected to file consolidated returns with its own subsidiaries .	AT NN IN AT NN VBG VBN NNS MD BE VBN CS AT AP NN IN AT NN VBN IN NN CD , CC CS AT JJ NN IN DT NN IN AT JJ NN IN DT NN WDT HVD * , IN NN , VBN TO VB VBN NNS IN PP$ JJ NNS .
Similar considerations presumably made it difficult to prescribe a general rule where the acquired and acquiring corporations have different methods of accounting ( section 381(c)(4) ) or depreciation ( section 381(c)(6) ) .	JJ NNS RB VBD PPO JJ TO VB AT JJ NN WRB AT VBN CC VBG NNS HV JJ NNS IN VBG ( NN CD ) CC NN ( NN CD ) .
Other sections of the 1954 Internal Revenue Code provide for survival of certain of a transferor's tax attributes following a tax-free reorganization .	AP NNS IN AT CD JJ-TL NN-TL NN-TL VB IN NN IN AP IN AT NN$ NN NNS IN AT JJ NN .
Section 362 requires carryover of the transferor corporation's basis for property transferred , and section 1223 provides for tacking on the transferor's holding period for such property to that of the transferee .	NN CD VBZ NN IN AT NN NN$ NN IN NN VBN , CC NN CD VBZ IN VBG RP AT NN$ VBG NN IN JJ NN IN DT IN AT NN .
Section 169 permits a person acquiring grain-storage facilities to elect to continue amortization over a 60-month period .	NN CD VBZ AT NN VBG NN NNS TO VB TO VB NN IN AT JJ NN .
However , a similar privilege was not specifically provided in section 168 for a person acquiring emergency facilities .	RB , AT JJ NN BEDZ * RB VBN IN NN CD IN AT NN VBG NN NNS .
Attributes similar to a loss carryover .	NNS-HL JJ-HL IN-HL AT-HL NN-HL NN-HL .-HL
There may be certain items which are quite similar to a net operating loss carryover or operating deficit and whose right to survive a reorganization should perhaps be subject to the conditions applicable to those items .	EX MD BE AP NNS WDT BER QL JJ IN AT JJ VBG NN NN CC VBG NN CC WP$ NN TO VB AT NN MD RB BE JJ IN AT NNS JJ IN DTS NNS .
For example , suppose another excess profits tax similar to prior laws is enacted , providing for carryover of excess profits credits .	IN NN , VB DT JJ NNS NN JJ IN JJ NNS BEZ VBN , VBG IN NN IN JJ NNS NNS .
This carryover right has a number of things in common with a net operating loss carryover .	DT NN NN HVZ AT NN IN NNS IN JJ IN AT JJ VBG NN NN .
It is an averaging device intended to ease the tax burden of fluctuating income ; ;	PPS BEZ AT VBG NN VBN TO VB AT NN NN IN VBG NN . .
it is a tax benefit which might be of substantial value to a corporation which expects to have a high excess profits tax .	PPS BEZ AT NN NN WDT MD BE IN JJ NN IN AT NN WDT VBZ TO HV AT JJ JJ NNS NN .
Under the 1939 Code this item was permitted to survive a tax-free reorganization in the Stanton Brewery case , but only over the dissent of Judge Learned Hand , who wrote the majority opinion in the Sansome case , a leading case requiring carryover of earnings and profits in a non-taxable reorganization .	IN AT CD NN-TL DT NN BEDZ VBN TO VB AT JJ NN IN AT NP-TL NN-TL NN , CC RB IN AT NN IN NN-TL NP NP , WPS VBD AT NN NN IN AT NP NN , AT VBG NN VBG NN IN NNS CC NNS IN AT JJ NN .
Since this type of item was not in the statute when section 381 was enacted in 1954 , one cannot say with certainty what effect the enactment of that section should have .	CS DT NN IN NN BEDZ * IN AT NN WRB NN CD BEDZ VBN IN CD , PN MD* VB IN NN WDT NN AT NN IN DT NN MD HV .
With respect to this type of item , one might properly apply the language of the Committee Report , quoted above , which cautions against using section 381 as a basis for treating other tax attributes not mentioned therein .	IN NN IN DT NN IN NN , PN MD RB VB AT NN IN AT NN-TL NN-TL , VBN RB , WDT VBZ IN VBG NN CD CS AT NN IN VBG AP NN NNS * VBN RB .
Actually , there do not presently appear to be items in the statute comparable to a net operating loss carryover .	RB , EX DO * RB VB TO BE NNS IN AT NN JJ IN AT JJ VBG NN NN .
Probably the primary reason for special treatment of a net operating loss carryover is the unique opportunity it presents for tax avoidance .	RB AT JJ NN IN JJ NN IN AT JJ VBG NN NN BEZ AT JJ NN PPS VBZ IN NN NN .
A .	NP-HL .-HL
Reasons for selecting mail questionnaire method	NNS-HL IN-HL VBG-HL NN-HL NN-HL NN-HL
There were two methods that could have been used for conducting the study within the resources available : ( 1 ) interviews in depth with a few selected companies , and ( 2 ) the more limited interrogation of a large number of companies by means of a mail questionnaire .	EX BED CD NNS WPS MD HV BEN VBN IN VBG AT NN IN AT NNS JJ : ( CD ) NNS IN NN IN AT AP VBN NNS , CC ( CD ) AT QL VBN NN IN AT JJ NN IN NNS IN NNS IN AT NN NN .
While the method of interviewing a small number of companies was appealing because of the opportunity it might have furnished to probe fully the reasons and circumstances of a company's practices and opinions , it also involved the risk of paying undue attention to the unique and peculiar problems of just a few individual companies .	CS AT NN IN VBG AT JJ NN IN NNS BEDZ JJ RB IN AT NN PPS MD HV VBN TO VB RB AT NNS CC NNS IN AT NN$ NNS CC NNS , PPS RB VBD AT NN IN VBG JJ NN IN AT JJ CC JJ NNS IN RB AT AP JJ NNS .
As a result , it was decided that a mail questionnaire sent to a large number of companies would be more effective in determining the general practices and opinions of small firms and in highlighting some of the fundamental and recurring problems of defense procurement that concern both industry and government .	CS AT NN , PPS BEDZ VBN CS AT NN NN VBN IN AT JJ NN IN NNS MD BE QL JJ IN VBG AT JJ NNS CC NNS IN JJ NNS CC IN VBG DTI IN AT JJ CC VBG NNS IN NN NN WPS VB ABX NN CC NN .
It was also hoped that responses to a mail questionnaire would suggest fruitful inquiries that might be made in subsequent studies of a more detailed nature .	PPS BEDZ RB VBN CS NNS IN AT NN NN MD VB JJ NNS WPS MD BE VBN IN JJ NNS IN AT QL VBN NN .
It is recognized that a mail questionnaire has inherent limitations .	PPS BEZ VBN CS AT NN NN HVZ JJ NNS .
There is the danger that the questions will mean different things to different respondents .	EX BEZ AT NN CS AT NNS MD VB JJ NNS IN JJ NNS .
Simple `` yes '' or `` no '' answers do not reveal the different shades of opinion that the various respondents may have .	JJ `` RB '' CC `` RB-NC '' NNS DO * VB AT JJ NNS IN NN WPO AT JJ NNS MD HV .
A respondent may want to make alternative answers because he does not know the precise circumstances assumed in the question .	AT NN MD VB TO VB JJ NNS CS PPS DOZ * VB AT JJ NNS VBN IN AT NN .
There is also the problem of the respondent's frame of reference .	EX BEZ RB AT NN IN AT NN$ NN IN NN .
Is the respondent making a recommendation for his own benefit , for the benefit of his industry , for the benefit of a specific government department or service , for the benefit of the defense program , for the benefit of small business , or for the benefit of the taxpayers ? ?	BEZ AT NN VBG AT NN IN PP$ JJ NN , IN AT NN IN PP$ NN , IN AT NN IN AT JJ NN NN CC NN , IN AT NN IN AT NN NN , IN AT NN IN JJ NN , CC IN AT NN IN AT NNS . .
There is also the question of whether the respondent based his answers on factual information and carefully considered judgment , or whether his answers were casual guesses .	EX BEZ RB AT NN IN CS AT NN VBD PP$ NNS IN JJ NN CC RB VBN NN , CC CS PP$ NNS BED JJ NNS .
Finally , there is the question of how strongly an expressed opinion is held -- whether it is a firm opinion or one that the respondent favors only slightly over the alternatives .	RB , EX BEZ AT NN IN WQL RB AT VBN NN BEZ VBN -- CS PPS BEZ AT JJ NN CC CD WPO AT NN VBZ QL RB IN AT NNS .
The research team was very mindful of these dangers and limitations of a mail questionnaire .	AT NN NN BEDZ QL JJ IN DTS NNS CC NNS IN AT NN NN .
Under the circumstances , however , the team considered it would provide the most useful information at this point .	IN AT NNS , RB , AT NN VBD PPS MD VB AT QL JJ NN IN DT NN .
In the preparation of the questionnaire the problems noted above were carefully considered , and the structure and phraseology used were designed to minimize the effects of these limitations .	IN AT NN IN AT NN AT NNS VBN RB BED RB VBN , CC AT NN CC NN VBN BED VBN TO VB AT NNS IN DTS NNS .
B .	NP-HL .-HL
Design of the questionnaire	NN-HL IN-HL AT-HL NN-HL
The questionnaire was designed to elicit three types of information : ( 1 ) the facts regarding certain characteristics of the respondents , including their experience with , and interest in , securing defense business ; ;	AT NN BEDZ VBN TO VB CD NNS IN NN : ( CD ) AT NNS IN AP NNS IN AT NNS , IN PP$ NN IN , CC NN IN , VBG NN NN . .
( 2 ) the actual selling and buying practices of the respondents ; ;	( CD ) AT JJ VBG CC VBG NNS IN AT NNS . .
and ( 3 ) the attitudes and opinions of the respondents concerning bidding procedures and the methods of awarding defense contracts .	CC ( CD ) AT NNS CC NNS IN AT NNS IN NN NNS CC AT NNS IN VBG NN NNS .
It was hoped that the facts concerning the characteristics and practices of the respondents would offer clues to the reasons why they took the positions and made the recommendations which they did .	PPS BEDZ VBN CS AT NNS IN AT NNS CC NNS IN AT NNS MD VB NNS IN AT NNS WRB PPSS VBD AT NNS CC VBD AT NNS WDT PPSS DOD .
The major sections of the questionnaire ( see Appendix B ) are devoted to the following : 1 .	AT JJ NNS IN AT NN ( VB NN-TL NP-TL ) BER VBN IN AT NN : CD-HL .-HL
Information for classifying respondents ( Part A of the questionnaire ) 2 .	NN IN VBG NNS ( NN-TL NP-TL IN AT NN ) CD-HL .-HL
Characteristics of defense sales activities ( Part B of the questionnaire ) 3 .	NNS IN NN NNS NNS ( NN-TL NP-TL IN AT NN ) CD-HL .-HL
Respondents' practices in participating in advertised bidding for defense business ( Part C of the questionnaire ) 4 .	NNS$ NNS IN VBG IN VBN NN IN NN NN ( NN-TL NP-TL IN AT NN ) CD-HL .-HL
Respondents' practices in participating in negotiated bidding for defense purposes ( Part D of the questionnaire ) 5 .	NNS$ NNS IN VBG IN VBN NN IN NN NNS ( NN-TL NP-TL IN AT NN ) CD-HL .-HL
Respondents' opinions regarding advertised bidding ( Part E of the questionnaire ) 6 .	NNS$ NNS IN VBN NN ( NN-TL NP-TL IN AT NN ) CD-HL .-HL
Respondents' opinions regarding negotiated bidding ( Part F of the questionnaire ) 7 .	NNS$ NNS IN VBN NN ( NN-TL NP-TL IN AT NN ) CD-HL .-HL
Respondents' preferences regarding the methods of awarding defense contracts ( Part G of the questionnaire )	NNS$ NNS IN AT NNS IN VBG NN NNS ( NN-TL NP-TL IN AT NN )
The questionnaire provided a place for the name of the respondent but stated that identification of the respondent was optional .	AT NN VBD AT NN IN AT NN IN AT NN CC VBD DT NN IN AT NN BEDZ JJ .
The questionnaire also stated that , in any event , all replies would be treated confidentially .	AT NN RB VBD CS , IN DTI NN , ABN NNS MD BE VBN RB .
It is interesting to note that 75 per cent of those who returned the questionnaire identified themselves .	PPS BEZ JJ TO VB CS CD IN NN IN DTS WPS VBD AT NN VBD PPLS .
C .	NP-HL .-HL
Preparation and pretest of the questionnaire	NN-HL CC-HL NN-HL IN-HL AT-HL NN-HL
The research team prepared and then revised the questionnaire over a period of six months .	AT NN NN VBD CC RB VBD AT NN IN AT NN IN CD NNS .
In June , 1960 , an early draft of the questionnaire , along with a cover letter , was mailed to fourteen companies in the state of Washington .	IN NP , CD , AT JJ NN IN AT NN , RB IN AT NN NN , BEDZ VBN IN CD NNS IN AT NN IN NP .
Several days after the companies had received the questionnaire , members of the research team contacted the presidents of eleven of these companies in person or by phone to discuss any ambiguities or difficulties the addressees might have experienced in completing the questionnaire .	AP NNS CS AT NNS HVD VBN AT NN , NNS IN AT NN NN VBD AT NNS IN CD IN DTS NNS IN NN CC IN NN TO VB DTI NNS CC NNS AT NNS MD HV VBN IN VBG AT NN .
This test resulted in further revisions of the questionnaire .	DT NN VBD IN JJR NNS IN AT NN .
The research team was concerned that responses from firms in the state of Washington might not be typical of those throughout the country , or that the results might be different when no phone or personal follow-up was made .	AT NN NN BEDZ VBN CS NNS IN NNS IN AT NN IN NP MD * BE JJ IN DTS IN AT NN , CC CS AT NNS MD BE JJ WRB AT NN CC JJ NN BEDZ VBN .
Accordingly , another test of the questionaire was made .	RB , DT NN IN AT NN BEDZ VBN .
The revised draft was mailed in July , 1960 , to 100 firms throughout the United States .	AT VBN NN BEDZ VBN IN NP , CD , IN CD NNS IN AT VBN-TL NNS-TL .
Fifty of the 100 firms were selected on a random basis from 3,500 names submitted by member companies of the Aerospace Industries Association ( AIA list ) and fifty were selected in a similar manner from a list of 1,500 names compiled by the research team from the Thomas Register ( TR list ) .	CD IN AT CD NNS BED VBN IN AT JJ NN IN CD NNS VBN IN NN NNS IN AT NP-TL NNS-TL NN-TL ( NP NN ) CC CD BED VBN IN AT JJ NN IN AT NN IN CD NNS VBN IN AT NN NN IN AT NP-TL NN-TL ( NP NN ) .
The method of compiling the AIA and TR lists will be described later .	AT NN IN VBG AT NN CC NN NNS MD BE VBN RBR .
Ten days after the questionnaires were mailed , follow-up airmail postcards were sent urging those companies which had not yet returned their questionnaires to do so at once .	CD NNS CS AT NNS BED VBN , JJ NN NNS BED VBN VBG DTS NNS WDT HVD * RB VBN PP$ NNS TO DO RB IN RB .
Twenty-eight returns in all were received .	CD NNS IN ABN BED VBN .
The responses were carefully checked for obvious errors in the answers or for questions that were apparently not understood by the respondent .	AT NNS BED RB VBN IN JJ NNS IN AT NNS CC IN NNS WPS BED RB * VBN IN AT NN .
The cover letter , questionnaire , and follow-up postcard were then revised into final form ( see Appendixes A , B , and C ) .	AT NN NN , NN , CC JJ NN BED RB VBN IN JJ NN ( VB NNS-TL NP-TL , NP-TL , CC NN ) .
D .	NP-HL .-HL
Compilation of mailing lists	NN-HL IN-HL VBG-HL NNS-HL
The objective of the study was to determine the opinions and practices of small firms selling to defense programs .	AT NN IN AT NN BEDZ TO VB AT NNS CC NNS IN JJ NNS VBG IN NN NNS .
The firms to receive the questionnaires were selected with this objective in mind .	AT NNS TO VB AT NNS BED VBN IN DT NN IN NN .
Three lists of companies were made and used in the study .	CD NNS IN NNS BED VBN CC VBN IN AT NN .
The first was a list of fourteen manufacturing companies located in the state of Washington which were personally known to the research team to be active in defense work .	AT OD BEDZ AT NN IN CD VBG NNS VBN IN AT NN IN NP WDT BED RB VBN IN AT NN NN TO BE JJ IN NN NN .
The primary consideration in the compilation of this list was convenience in discussing the questionnaire with company officers .	AT JJ NN IN AT NN IN DT NN BEDZ NN IN VBG AT NN IN NN NNS .
The second list was derived from a group of approximately 8,000 names supplied to the research team by the Aerospace Industries Association .	AT OD NN BEDZ VBN IN AT NN IN RB CD NNS VBN IN AT NN NN IN AT NP-TL NNS-TL NN-TL .
These names were secured from member companies by the Association from the forty-four sources listed in Appendix Aj .	DTS NNS BED VBN IN NN NNS IN AT NN-TL IN AT CD NNS VBN IN NN-TL NP-TL .
Each source selected from its approved bidders list about 200 firms which it believed to be small businesses that participated in the production of weapons and weapon support systems .	DT NN VBD IN PP$ VBN NNS VB RB CD NNS WDT PPS VBD TO BE JJ NNS WPS VBD IN AT NN IN NNS CC NN NN NNS .
Where possible , the name of an executive was supplied along with the company name and address .	WRB JJ , AT NN IN AT NN BEDZ VBN RB IN AT NN NN CC NN .
The forty-four lists supplied by the AIA member companies were merged and duplicate names were eliminated .	AT CD NNS VBN IN AT NN NN NNS BED VBN CC JJ NNS BED VBN .
There was further elimination of all companies that were not accompanied by the name of a responsible company executive .	EX BEDZ JJR NN IN ABN NNS WPS BED * VBN IN AT NN IN AT JJ NN NN .
The remaining names were then checked against the Thomas Register list ( see below ) and duplicate names were removed from the AIA lists .	AT VBG NNS BED RB VBN IN AT NP-TL NN-TL NN ( VB RB ) CC JJ NNS BED VBN IN AT NN NNS .
By these steps the final AIA list was reduced from 8,000 to 3,500 .	IN DTS NNS AT JJ NN NN BEDZ VBN IN CD IN CD .
The third list was selected by the research team on a random basis from the Thomas Register .	AT OD NN BEDZ VBN IN AT NN NN IN AT JJ NN IN AT NP-TL NN-TL .
It was compiled as a control sample to determine if the opinions and practices of companies on the lists submitted by the members of the Aerospace Industries Association were materially different from those of other small firms selling to defense programs .	PPS BEDZ VBN CS AT NN NN TO VB CS AT NNS CC NNS IN NNS IN AT NNS VBN IN AT NNS IN AT NP-TL NNS-TL NN-TL BED QL JJ IN DTS IN AP JJ NNS VBG IN NN NNS .
Such a difference might have resulted from : 1 .	ABL AT NN MD HV VBN IN : CD-HL .-HL
The fact that the Aerospace Industries Association members whose lists were used did not comprise all firms engaged in defense programs .	AT NN CS AT NP-TL NNS-TL NN-TL NNS WP$ NNS BED VBN DOD * VB ABN NNS VBN IN NN NNS .
2 .	CD-HL .-HL
The fact that companies on the AIA lists were already participating in the defense program because of the manner of their selection .	AT NN CS NNS IN AT NN NNS BED RB VBG IN AT NN NN RB IN AT NN IN PP$ NN .
Accordingly , as `` in-group '' , they might have different opinions and practices than an `` out-group '' composed of those companies not so participating but interested in defense business .	RB , CS `` NN '' , PPSS MD HV JJ NNS CC NNS CS AT `` NN '' VBN IN DTS NNS * RB VBG CC VBN IN NN NN .
3 .	CD-HL .-HL
The fact that AIA lists might not have been selected on a random basis .	AT NN CS NN NNS MD * HV BEN VBN IN AT JJ NN .
The control sample was selected by taking the bottom name of each of the two columns of names on each page of the alphabetical listing of manufacturers in the Thomas Register .	AT NN NN BEDZ VBN IN VBG AT JJ NN IN DT IN AT CD NNS IN NNS IN DT NN IN AT JJ NN IN NNS IN AT NP-TL NN-TL .
If the bottom name in each column did not have a responsible executive identified , the next name above which identified such a responsible executive was substituted .	CS AT JJ NN IN DT NN DOD * HV AT JJ NN VBN , AT AP NN RB WDT VBD ABL AT JJ NN BEDZ VBN .
Fifteen hundred names were selected in this fashion .	CD CD NNS BED VBN IN DT NN .
E .	NP-HL .-HL
Mailing the questionnaire	VBG-HL AT-HL NN-HL
Each questionnaire was mailed with a cover letter addressed personally to the president or other executive of each firm .	DT NN BEDZ VBN IN AT NN NN VBN RB IN AT NN CC AP NN IN DT NN .
The questionnaires were mailed in Seattle , Washington , and sent by regular mail to addresses in the states of Idaho , Montana , Oregon , and Washington .	AT NNS BED VBN IN NP , NP , CC VBN IN JJ NN IN NNS IN AT NNS IN NP , NP , NP , CC NP .
Airmail was used for the addresses outside the Pacific Northwest .	NN BEDZ VBN IN AT NNS IN AT JJ-TL NN-TL .
Each letter contained a postage-prepaid return envelope by regular mail for addresses in the Pacific Northwest , and by airmail for those outside the Pacific Northwest .	DT NN VBD AT JJ NN NN IN JJ NN IN NNS IN AT JJ-TL NN-TL , CC IN NN IN DTS IN AT JJ-TL NN-TL .
Approximately ten days after the questionnaire was mailed , a follow-up airmail postcard was sent to each of the original names .	RB CD NNS CS AT NN BEDZ VBN , AT JJ NN NN BEDZ VBN IN DT IN AT JJ NNS .
The first test mailing ( to 14 companies ) was made in June , 1960 .	AT OD NN NN ( IN CD NNS ) BEDZ VBN IN NP , CD .
The second test mailing ( to 100 companies ) was made in July , 1960 .	AT OD NN NN ( IN CD NNS ) BEDZ VBN IN NP , CD .
The final mailing of the questionnaire was made late in August , 1960 , to 4,900 firms consisting of 3,450 from the AIA list and 1,450 from the TR list .	AT JJ NN IN AT NN BEDZ VBN RB IN NP , CD , IN CD NNS VBG IN CD IN AT NN NN CC CD IN AT NN NN .
F .	NP-HL .-HL
Returns received	NNS-HL VBN-HL
Over 1,000 returns were received within two weeks after the final mailing was made .	RP CD NNS BED VBN IN CD NNS CS AT JJ NN BEDZ VBN .
They continued to arrive until the end of December , 1960 , by which time a total of 1,343 returns were received representing 26.8 per cent of the 5,014 questionnaires sent out .	PPSS VBD TO VB IN AT NN IN NP , CD , IN WDT NN AT NN IN CD NNS BED VBN VBG CD IN NN IN AT CD NNS VBN RP .
Fifty-seven returns could not be used because they were incomplete or received too late to be processed .	CD NNS MD * BE VBN CS PPSS BED JJ CC VBN QL RB TO BE VBN .
The remaining 1,286 returns that were processed came from the categories in Table 2 .	AT VBG CD NNS WPS BED VBN VBD IN AT NNS IN NN-TL CD-TL .
G .	NP-HL .-HL
Processing the returns	VBG-HL AT-HL NNS-HL
Each questionnaire was audited for obvious mistakes and for comments , and was identified by a serial number , by the source list from which the company name was selected , and by the geographical location of the company as determined by the postmark on the return envelope .	DT NN BEDZ VBN IN JJ NNS CC IN NNS , CC BEDZ VBN IN AT NN NN , IN AT NN NN IN WDT AT NN NN BEDZ VBN , CC IN AT JJ NN IN AT NN CS VBN IN AT NN IN AT NN NN .
All responses , except comments , were numerically coded to permit use of data-processing equipment .	ABN NNS , IN NNS , BED RB VBN TO VB NN IN JJ NN .
The codes were key-punched into IBM punch cards and verified .	AT NNS BED VBN IN NN NN NNS CC VBN .
Each return required three cards and involved key punching 228 digital columns .	DT NN VBD CD NNS CC VBD NN NN CD JJ NNS .
In order to be able to properly relate the data for a single company each of the three cards comprising the set for each firm was identified with the appropriate serial number of the respondent .	IN NN TO BE JJ TO RB VB AT NN IN AT AP NN DT IN AT CD NNS VBG AT NN IN DT NN BEDZ VBN IN AT JJ NN NN IN AT NN .
The cards were then processed using standard IBM punch card equipment , including an IBM 650 computer .	AT NNS BED RB VBN VBG JJ NN NN NN NN , IN AT NN CD NN .
The first step in processing was to analyze the returns from Questions 1 , 2 , and 3 to determine whether the respondents were large businesses or small businesses , in accordance with the definitions contained in ASPR Section 1-701 .	AT OD NN IN VBG BEDZ TO VB AT NNS IN NNS-TL CD-TL , CD-TL , CC CD TO VB CS AT NNS BED JJ NNS CC JJ NNS , IN NN IN AT NNS VBN IN NN NN-TL CD-TL .
( see Chapter 2 .	( VB NN-TL CD-TL .
) The results are shown in Table 3 .	) AT NNS BER VBN IN NN-TL CD-TL .
The returns from companies classified as large businesses were set aside and not used because they were not relevant to a study of the opinions and practices of small firms .	AT NNS IN NNS VBN CS JJ NNS BED VBN RB CC * VBN CS PPSS BED * JJ IN AT NN IN AT NNS CC NNS IN JJ NNS .
The second step in processing was to compare the responses from companies on the AIA list with those from companies on the TR list in order to determine whether it would be appropriate to merge the responses for the purposes of the study .	AT OD NN IN VBG BEDZ TO VB AT NNS IN NNS IN AT NN NN IN DTS IN NNS IN AT NN NN IN NN TO VB CS PPS MD BE JJ TO VB AT NNS IN AT NNS IN AT NN .
The methods and results of this comparative analysis are described in Appendix Aj .	AT NNS CC NNS IN DT JJ NN BER VBN IN NN-TL NP-TL .
It was concluded that it would be appropriate to process the two groups of responses as a single sample of all small businesses engaged in , or wishing to sell to , defense programs .	PPS BEDZ VBN CS PPS MD BE JJ TO VB AT CD NNS IN NNS CS AT AP NN IN ABN JJ NNS VBN IN , CC VBG TO VB IN , NN NNS .
In the first place , the two groups of firms , when combined , had characteristics and practices that were more representative of companies that were the subject of this study than did the firms from the AIA list alone .	IN AT OD NN , AT CD NNS IN NNS , WRB VBN , HVD NNS CC NNS WPS BED QL JJ IN NNS WPS BED AT NN IN DT NN CS DOD AT NNS IN AT NN NN RB .
The vast Central Valley of California is one of the most productive agricultural areas in the world .	AT JJ JJ-TL NN-TL IN-TL NP-TL BEZ CD IN AT QL JJ JJ NNS IN AT NN .
During the summer of 1960 , it became the setting for a bitter and basic labor-management struggle .	IN AT NN IN CD , PPS VBD AT NN IN AT JJ CC JJ NN NN .
The contestants in this economic struggle are the Agricultural Workers Organizing Committee ( AWOC ) of the AFL-CIO and the agricultural employers of the State .	AT NNS IN DT JJ NN BER AT JJ-TL NNS-TL VBG-TL NN-TL ( NP ) IN AT NN CC AT JJ NNS IN AT NN-TL .
By virtue of the legal responsibilities of the Department of Employment in the farm placement program , we necessarily found ourselves in the middle between these two forces .	IN NN IN AT JJ NNS IN AT NN-TL IN-TL NN-TL IN AT NN NN NN , PPSS RB VBD PPLS IN AT NN IN DTS CD NNS .
It is not a pleasant or easy position , but one we have endeavored to maintain .	PPS BEZ * AT JJ CC JJ NN , CC CD PPSS HV VBN TO VB .
We have sought to be strictly neutral as between the parties , but at the same time we have been required frequently to rule on specific issues or situations as they arose .	PPSS HV VBN TO BE QL JJ CS IN AT NNS , CC IN AT AP NN PPSS HV BEN VBN RB TO VB IN JJ NNS CC NNS CS PPSS VBD .
Inevitably , one side was pleased and the other displeased , regardless of how we ruled .	RB , CD NN BEDZ VBN CC AT AP VBN , RB IN WRB PPSS VBD .
Often the displeased parties interpreted our decision as implying favoritism toward the other .	RB AT VBN NNS VBD PP$ NN CS VBG NN IN AT AP .
We have consoled ourselves with the thought that this is a normal human reaction and is one of the consequences of any decision in an adversary proceeding .	PPSS HV VBN PPLS IN AT NN CS DT BEZ AT JJ JJ NN CC BEZ CD IN AT NNS IN DTI NN IN AT NN NN .
It is disconcerting , nevertheless , to read in a labor weekly , `` Perluss knuckles down to growers '' , and then to be confronted with a growers' publication which states , `` Perluss recognizes obviously phony and trumped-up strikes as bona fide '' .	PPS BEZ JJ , RB , TO VB IN AT NN NN , `` NP VBZ RP IN NNS '' , CC RB TO BE VBN IN AT NNS$ NN WDT VBZ , `` NP VBZ RB JJ CC JJ NNS CS FW-JJ FW-NN '' .
For a number of years , there have been sporadic attempts in California to organize farm workers .	IN AT NN IN NNS , EX HV BEN JJ NNS IN NP TO VB NN NNS .
These attempts met with little sucess for a variety of reasons .	DTS NNS VBD IN AP NN IN AT NN IN NNS .
They were inadequately financed , without experienced leadership , and lacked the general support of organized labor as a whole .	PPSS BED RB VBN , IN VBN NN , CC VBD AT JJ NN IN VBN NN CS AT NN .
This past year the pattern has been different : The organizing program had the full support of the AFL-CIO , which supplied staff and money to the AWOC , as well as moral support .	DT JJ NN AT NN HVZ BEN JJ : AT VBG NN HVD AT JJ NN IN AT NN , WDT VBD NN CC NN IN AT NN , QL RB CS JJ NN .
Leadership was experienced and skillful , and financial resources were significant .	NN BEDZ VBN CC JJ , CC JJ NNS BED JJ .
Regardless of where personal sympathies may lie as between the parties , failure to recognize these changed conditions would be to ignore the facts of life .	RB IN WRB JJ NNS MD VB CS IN AT NNS , NN TO VB DTS VBN NNS MD BE TO VB AT NNS IN NN .
As a result of these changed conditions , the impact of the organizational effort on agricultural labor-management relations has been much greater than in the past .	CS AT NN IN DTS VBN NNS , AT NN IN AT JJ NN IN JJ NN NNS HVZ BEN QL JJR CS IN AT NN .
The AWOC has been able to employ the traditional weapons of labor -- the strike and the picket line -- with considerable success , particularly in the area of wages .	AT NN HVZ BEN JJ TO VB AT JJ NNS IN NN -- AT NN CC AT NN NN -- IN JJ NN , RB IN AT NN IN NNS .
By the very nature of the situation , it is the union which has been able to select the time and place to bring pressure upon management .	IN AT AP NN IN AT NN , PPS BEZ AT NN WDT HVZ BEN JJ TO VB AT NN CC NN TO VB NN IN NN .
To date , at least , the strategy of the AWOC has been selective ; ;	IN NN , IN AP , AT NN IN AT NN HVZ BEN JJ . .
that is to say , to concentrate on a particular crop or activity in a particular area at a strategic time , rather than any broadside engagement with management throughout an area or the State .	DT BEZ TO VB , TO VB IN AT AP NN CC NN IN AT AP NN IN AT JJ NN , RB CS DTI JJ NN IN NN IN AT NN CC AT NN-TL .
Primarily , we became involved in these disputes because of our referral obligations under our farm placement program .	RB , PPSS VBD VBN IN DTS NNS RB IN PP$ NN NNS IN PP$ NN NN NN .
Normally , because agricultural labor is not covered by unemployment insurance , we would not expect any issues to arise regarding benefit payments under the trade dispute provision of the Unemployment Insurance Code , although such a situation is quite within the realm of possibility .	RB , CS JJ NN BEZ * VBN IN NN NN , PPSS MD * VB DTI NNS TO VB IN NN NNS IN AT NN NN NN IN AT NN-TL NN-TL NN-TL , CS ABL AT NN BEZ QL IN AT NN IN NN .
But the current issues arose out of the Wagner-Peyser Act concerning referrals to an establishment where a labor dispute exists , and out of Public Law 78 and the Migrant Labor Agreement if Mexican nationals were employed at the ranch .	CC AT JJ NNS VBD RP IN AT NP-TL NN-TL IN NNS IN AT NN WRB AT NN NN VBZ , CC RP IN JJ-TL NN-TL CD-TL CC AT JJ-TL NN-TL NN-TL CS JJ NNS BED VBN IN AT NN .
Most of us remember and think of the Wagner-Peyser Act in its historical sense , as a major milestone in the development of public placement services .	AP IN PPO VB CC VB IN AT NP-TL NN-TL IN PP$ JJ NN , CS AT JJ NN IN AT NN IN JJ NN NNS .
Infrequently do we think of it as a living , continuing , operating control over the system .	RB DO PPSS VB IN PPO CS AT VBG , VBG , VBG NN IN AT NN .
However , when labor disputes arise , its provisions come clearly into play .	RB , WRB NN NNS VB , PP$ NNS VB RB IN NN .
California has accepted the provisions of that Act ( as have all other States ) by enacting into our Code ( Section 2051 ) a provision that	NP HVZ VBN AT NNS IN DT NN-TL ( CS HV ABN AP NNS-TL ) IN VBG IN PP$ NN-TL ( NN-TL CD ) AT NN CS
The State of California accepts the provisions of the Wagner-Peyser Act , and will observe and comply with the requirements of that act .	AT-TL NN-TL IN-TL NP-TL VBZ AT NNS IN AT NP-TL NN-TL , CC MD VB CC VB IN AT NNS IN DT NN .
With respect to labor disputes , the Wagner-Peyser Act states only ,	IN NN IN NN NNS , AT NP-TL NN-TL VBZ RB ,
In carrying out the provisions of this Act , the Secretary is authorized and directed to provide for the giving of notice of strikes or lock-outs to applicants before they are referred to employment .	IN VBG RP AT NNS IN DT NN-TL , AT NN-TL BEZ VBN CC VBN TO VB IN AT NN IN NN IN NNS CC NNS IN NNS CS PPSS BER VBN IN NN .
Other provisions of the Act empower the Secretary to adopt regulations necessary to carry out its provisions , and he has done so .	AP NNS IN AT NN-TL VB AT NN-TL TO VB NNS JJ TO VB RP PP$ NNS , CC PPS HVZ VBN RB .
The pertinent regulation for our purposes is Section 602.2 ( , ) , as follows :	AT JJ NN IN PP$ NNS BEZ NN-TL CD-TL ( , ) , CS VBZ :
Referrals in labor dispute situations .	NNS IN NN NN NNS .
No person shall be referred to a position the filling of which will aid directly or indirectly in filling a job which ( 1 ) is vacant because the former occupant is on strike or is being locked out in the course of a labor dispute , or ( 2 ) the filling of which is an issue in a labor dispute .	AT NN MD BE VBN IN AT NN AT NN IN WDT MD VB RB CC RB IN VBG AT NN WDT ( CD ) BEZ JJ CS AT AP NN BEZ IN NN CC BEZ BEG VBN RP IN AT NN IN AT NN NN , CC ( CD ) AT NN IN WDT BEZ AT NN IN AT NN NN .
With respect to positions not covered by subparagraph ( 1 ) or ( 2 ) of this paragraph , any individual may be referred to a place of employment in which a labor dispute exists , provided he is given written notice of such dispute prior to or at the time of his referral .	IN NN IN NNS * VBN IN NN ( CD ) CC ( CD ) IN DT NN , DTI NN MD BE VBN IN AT NN IN NN IN WDT AT NN NN VBZ , VBN PPS BEZ VBN VBN NN IN JJ NN RB IN CC IN AT NN IN PP$ NN .
In analyzing this regulation , let us take the last sentence first .	IN VBG DT NN , VB PPO VB AT AP NN RB .
It permits referrals under certain circumstances even when there is a labor dispute , provided the individual is given written notice of such a dispute .	PPS VBZ NNS IN AP NNS RB WRB EX BEZ AT NN NN , VBN AT NN BEZ VBN VBN NN IN ABL AT NN .
Assume , for example , a situation where a farm has a packing shed and fields .	VB , IN NN , AT NN WRB AT NN HVZ AT VBG NN CC NNS .
The packing shed workers go on strike .	AT VBG NN NNS VB IN NN .
There is no dispute involving fieldwork .	EX BEZ AT NN IN NN .
We concluded that we may refer workers to the fieldwork ( but not the packing shed work ) provided we give them written notice of the packing shed dispute .	PPSS VBD CS PPSS MD VB NNS IN AT NN ( CC * AT VBG NN NN ) VBN PPSS VB PPO VBN NN IN AT VBG NN NN .
So far , no troublesome cases have arisen under this provision .	QL RB , AT JJ NNS HV VBN IN DT NN .
It is the first part of the Regulation that is currently at issue .	PPS BEZ AT OD NN IN AT NN-TL WPS BEZ RB IN NN .
Note that it prohibits referrals under either condition ( 1 ) or condition ( 2 ) .	VB CS PPS VBZ NNS IN CC NN ( CD ) CC NN ( CD ) .
Employer representatives have contended that the Secretary has gone beyond his authority by such a prohibition , on the grounds that the Wagner-Peyser Act requires only written notice to the prospective worker that a dispute exists .	NN NNS HV VBN CS AT NN-TL HVZ VBN IN PP$ NN IN ABL AT NN , IN AT NNS CS AT NP-TL NN-TL VBZ AP VBN NN IN AT JJ NN CS AT NN VBZ .
Into court	IN-HL NN-HL
The matter got into the courts this way : One of the early strikes called by the AWOC was at the DiGiorgio pear orchards in Yuba County .	AT NN VBD IN AT NNS DT NN : CD IN AT JJ NNS VBN IN AT NN BEDZ IN AT NP NN NNS IN NP-TL NN-TL .
We found that a labor dispute existed , and that the workers had left their jobs , which were then vacant because of the dispute .	PPSS VBD CS AT NN NN VBD , CC CS AT NNS HVD VBN PP$ NNS , WDT BED RB JJ RB IN AT NN .
Accordingly , under clause ( 1 ) of the Secretary's Regulation , we suspended referrals to the employer .	RB , IN NN ( CD ) IN AT NN$-TL NN-TL , PPSS VBD NNS IN AT NN .
( Incidentally , no Mexican nationals were involved .	( RB , AT JJ NNS BED VBN .
) The employer , seeking to continue his harvest , challenged our right to cease referrals to him , and sought relief in the Superior Court of Yuba County .	) AT NN , VBG TO VB PP$ NN , VBD PP$ NN TO VB NNS IN PPO , CC VBD NN IN AT JJ-TL NN-TL IN-TL NP-TL NN-TL .
The court issued a temporary restraining order , directing us to resume referrals .	AT NN VBD AT JJ VBG NN , VBG PPO TO VB NNS .
We , of course , obeyed the court order .	PPSS , IN NN , VBD AT NN NN .
However , the Attorney General of California , at the request of the Secretary of Labor , sought to have the jurisdiction over the issue removed to the Federal District Court , on grounds that it was predominantly a Federal issue since the validity of the Secretary's Regulation was being challenged .	RB , AT NN-TL JJ-TL IN-TL NP-TL , IN AT NN IN AT NN-TL IN-TL NN-TL , VBD TO HV AT NN IN AT NN VBN IN AT JJ-TL NN-TL NN-TL , IN NNS CS PPS BEDZ RB AT JJ-TL NN CS AT NN IN AT NN$-TL NN-TL BEDZ BEG VBN .
However , the Federal Court held that since the State had accepted the provisions of the Wagner-Peyser Act into its own Code , and presumably therefore also the regulations , it was now a State matter .	RB , AT JJ-TL NN-TL VBD CS CS AT NN-TL HVD VBN AT NNS IN AT NP-TL NN-TL IN PP$ JJ NN-TL , CC RB RB RB AT NNS , PPS BEDZ RB AT NN-TL NN .
It accordingly refused to assume jurisdiction , whereupon the California Superior Court made the restraining order permanent .	PPS RB VBD TO VB NN , CS AT NP-TL JJ-TL NN-TL VBD AT VBG NN JJ .
Under that order , we have continued referring workers to the ranch .	IN DT NN , PPSS HV VBN VBG NNS IN AT NN .
A similar case arose at the Bowers ranch in Butte County , and the Superior Court of that county issued similar restraining orders .	AT JJ NN VBD IN AT NP NN IN NP-TL NN-TL , CC AT JJ-TL NN-TL IN DT NN VBD JJ VBG NNS .
The growers have strenuously argued that I should have accepted the Superior Court decisions as conclusive and issued statewide instructions to our staff to ignore this provision in the Secretary's Regulation .	AT NNS HV RB VBN CS PPSS MD HV VBN AT JJ-TL NN-TL NNS CS JJ CC VBN JJ NNS IN PP$ NN TO VB DT NN IN AT NN$-TL NN-TL .
I cannot accept that view , either as a lawyer or as an administrator .	PPSS MD* VB DT NN , CC CS AT NN CC CS AT NN .
Legal considerations	JJ-HL NNS-HL
First , let us examine briefly some of the legal considerations involved .	RB , VB PPO VB RB DTI IN AT JJ NNS VBN .
It is an accepted juridical principle in California that a Superior Court decision does not constitute a binding legal precedent .	PPS BEZ AT VBN JJ NN IN NP CS AT JJ-TL NN-TL NN DOZ * VB AT VBG JJ NN .
It is conclusive , unless appealed , only upon the particular parties to the particular action which was heard .	PPS BEZ JJ , CS VBN , RB IN AT AP NNS IN AT AP NN WDT BEDZ VBN .
It is not binding upon another Superior Court , which could rule to the contrary .	PPS BEZ * VBG IN DT JJ-TL NN-TL , WDT MD VB IN AT NN .
Only when a decision is rendered by the District Court of Appeal ( or , of course , the Supreme Court ) is a binding precedent established .	RB WRB AT NN BEZ VBN IN AT NN-TL NN-TL IN-TL NN-TL ( CC , IN NN , AT JJ-TL NN-TL ) BEZ AT VBG NN VBN .
In that event , we can correctly say that we have received an authoritative interpretation of the matter , and one which we can follow statewide with confidence that the policy will not be overthrown in other Superior Courts .	IN DT NN , PPSS MD RB VB CS PPSS HV VBN AT JJ NN IN AT NN , CC CD WDT PPSS MD VB RB IN NN CS AT NN MD * BE VBN IN AP JJ-TL NNS-TL .
But over and beyond the compelling need for a binding precedent decision , I am convinced that the decisions of the Superior Courts which in effect nullify the Secretary's Regulation are not a correct interpretation of the Secretary's power under the Federal law .	CC IN CC IN AT JJ NN IN AT VBG NN NN , PPSS BEM VBN CS AT NNS IN AT JJ-TL NNS-TL WDT IN NN VB AT NN$-TL NN-TL BER * AT JJ NN IN AT NN$-TL NN IN AT JJ-TL NN .
I believe I am in good company in this view .	PPSS VB PPSS BEM IN JJ NN IN DT NN .
The Attorney General of California concurs in this interpretation and has filed an appeal from these decisions to the District Court of Appeal .	AT NN-TL JJ-TL IN-TL NP-TL VBZ IN DT NN CC HVZ VBN AT NN IN DTS NNS IN AT NN-TL NN-TL IN-TL NN-TL .
The Attorney General of the United States , in considering the power of the Secretary to issue similar regulations under the Wagner-Peyser Act relating to the interstate recruitment of farm workers , has rendered an opinion sustaining his authority .	AT NN-TL JJ-TL IN-TL AT-TL VBN-TL NNS-TL , IN VBG AT NN IN AT NN-TL TO VB JJ NNS IN AT NP-TL NN-TL VBG IN AT JJ NN IN NN NNS , HVZ VBN AT NN VBG PP$ NN .
Further , and as an evidence of legislative intent only , the Senate of the United States recently defeated by a substantial majority the `` Holland Amendment '' to the Fair Labor Standards Act , which would have specifically limited the regulatory authority of the Secretary in these matters .
