Continuation cards	NN-HL NNS-HL
Certain Autocoder statements make provision for more parameters than may be contained in the operand ( columns 21 - 75 ) of a single line on the Autocoder coding sheet .	AP NP NNS VB NN IN AP NNS CS MD BE VBN IN AT NN ( NNS CD IN CD ) IN AT AP NN IN AT NP VBG NN .
When this is the case , the appropriate section of this manual will indicate that `` Continuation Cards '' may be used .	WRB DT BEZ AT NN , AT JJ NN IN DT NN MD VB CS `` NN-TL NNS-TL '' MD BE VBN .
Thus , when specifically permitted , the operand of a given line on the Autocoder coding sheet may be continued in the operand of from one to four additional lines which immediately follow .	RB , WRB RB VBN , AT NN IN AT VBN NN IN AT NP VBG NN MD BE VBN IN AT NN IN IN CD IN CD JJ NNS WDT RB VB .
The label and operation columns must be blank and the continuation of the operand must begin in column 21 ; ;	AT NN CC NN NNS MD BE JJ CC AT NN IN AT NN MD VB IN NN CD . .
i.e. , it must be left-justified in the operand column of the coding sheet .	RB , PPS MD BE VBN IN AT NN NN IN AT VBG NN .
The operand need not extend across the entire operand column of either the header card or continuation cards but may end with the comma following any parameter .	AT NN MD * VB IN AT JJ NN NN IN CC AT NN NN CC NN NNS CC MD VB IN AT NN VBG DTI NN .
Remarks may appear to the right of the last parameter on each card provided they are separated from the operand by at least two blank spaces .	NNS MD VB IN AT NR IN AT AP NN IN DT NN VBD PPSS BER VBN IN AT NN IN IN AP CD JJ NNS .
Illustrations of the use of continuation cards are included throughout the examples illustrating the various statements .	NNS IN AT NN IN NN NNS BER VBN IN AT NNS VBG AT AP NNS .
If a continuation card follows a statement that does not permit continuation cards , the compiler will generate a NOP and issue an error message .	CS AT NN NN VBZ AT NN WPS DOZ * VB NN NNS , AT NN MD VB AT NN CC VB AT NN NN .
Additional restrictions regarding the use of continuation cards with macro-instructions appear on page 106 .	JJ NNS IN AT NN IN NN NNS IN NNS VB IN NN CD .
Reservation of index words and electronic switches	NN-HL IN-HL NN-HL NNS-HL CC-HL JJ-HL NNS-HL
The assignment of actual addresses to symbolic index word and electronic switch names occurs in Phase 3 , of the Autocoder processor .	AT NN IN JJ NNS IN JJ NN NN CC JJ NN NNS VBZ IN NN-TL CD-TL , IN AT NP NN .
The initial availability of index words and electronic switches is determined by a table which is included in the Compiler Systems Tape .	AT JJ NN IN NN NNS CC JJ NNS BEZ VBN IN AT NN WDT BEZ VBN IN AT NN-TL NNS-TL NN-TL .
This table originally indicates that index words 1 through 96 and electronic switches 1 through 30 are available for assignment to symbolic references ; ;	DT NN RB VBZ CS NN NNS CD IN CD CC JJ NNS CD IN CD BER JJ IN NN IN JJ NNS . .
index words 97 through 99 are not available .	NN NNS CD IN CD BER * JJ .
The initial setting of this table may be altered , however , as described in the 7070/7074 Data Processing System Bulletin `` IBM 7070/7074 Compiler System : Operating Procedure '' , form Aj .	AT JJ NN IN DT NN MD BE VBN , RB , CS VBN IN AT CD NNS-TL VBG-TL NN-TL NN-TL `` NP-TL CD-TL NN-TL NN-TL : VBG-TL NN-TL '' , NN NN .
During the first pass of Phase 3 , , references to the actual addresses of index words and electronic switches are collected and the availability table is updated .	IN AT OD NN IN NN-TL CD-TL , , NNS IN AT JJ NNS IN NN NNS CC JJ NNS BER VBN CC AT NN NN BEZ VBN .
At the end of this pass , the table indicates which index words and electronic switches are not available for assignment to symbolic references .	IN AT NN IN DT NN , AT NN VBZ WDT NN NNS CC JJ NNS BER * JJ IN NN IN JJ NNS .
Both index words and electronic switches may have been made unavailable before the start of assignment in one of the following ways .	ABX NN NNS CC JJ NNS MD HV BEN VBN JJ IN AT NN IN NN IN CD IN AT VBG NNS .
1 .	CD-HL .-HL
The initial setting of the availability table indicated that the index word or electronic switch was not available for assignment .	AT JJ NN IN AT NN NN VBD CS AT NN NN CC JJ NN BEDZ * JJ IN NN .
2 .	CD-HL .-HL
The one- or two-digit number of the index word or electronic switch was used in the operand of a symbolic machine instruction to specify indexing or as a parameter which is always an index word or electronic switch , e.g. , 3 .	AT CD CC JJ NN IN AT NN NN CC JJ NN BEDZ VBN IN AT NN IN AT JJ NN NN TO VB VBG CC CS AT NN WDT BEZ RB AT NN NN CC JJ NN , RB , CD-HL .-HL
The one- or two-digit number of the index word or electronic switch was used in the operand of an EQU statement , e.g. ,	AT CD CC JJ NN IN AT NN NN CC JJ NN BEDZ VBN IN AT NN IN AT NN NN , RB ,
When the index words or electronic switches are reserved because of actual usage in the statements described above , the position or order of the statements within the program is not important ; ;	WRB AT NN NNS CC JJ NNS BER VBN RB IN JJ NN IN AT NNS VBN RB , AT NN CC NN IN AT NNS IN AT NN BEZ * JJ . .
any such reference will make the index word or electronic switch unavailable at the end of this pass .	DTI JJ NN MD VB AT NN NN CC JJ NN JJ IN AT NN IN DT NN .
During the assignment pass of Phase 3 , , index words and electronic switches are reserved as they are encountered during assignment .	IN AT NN NN IN NN-TL CD-TL , , NN NNS CC JJ NNS BER VBN CS PPSS BER VBN IN NN .
Index words and electronic switches may be reserved in the following ways .	NN NNS CC JJ NNS MD BE VBN IN AT VBG NNS .
The first two methods apply to both index words and electronic switches ; ;	AT OD CD NNS VB IN ABX NN NNS CC JJ NNS . .
the third applies only to index words .	AT OD VBZ RB IN NN NNS .
1 .	CD-HL .-HL
During the assignment pass , each instruction is examined for reference to the symbolic name of an index word or electronic switch .	IN AT NN NN , DT NN BEZ VBN IN NN IN AT JJ NN IN AT NN NN CC JJ NN .
When such a reference is found , an actual address is assigned and the availability table is changed so that the assigned index word or switch is no longer available for later assignment .	WRB ABL AT NN BEZ VBN , AT JJ NN BEZ VBN CC AT NN NN BEZ VBN CS CS AT VBN NN NN CC NN BEZ QL RBR JJ IN JJR NN .
2 .	CD-HL .-HL
If the one- or two-digit address of an index word or electronic switch is used or is included in the operand of an XRESERVE or SRESERVE statement ( see page 99 ) , the corresponding index word or electronic switch is reserved .	CS AT CD CC JJ NN IN AT NN NN CC JJ NN BEZ VBN CC BEZ VBN IN AT NN IN AT NN CC NN NN ( VB NN CD ) , AT JJ NN NN CC JJ NN BEZ VBN .
3 .	CD-HL .-HL
If a statement has been assigned an address in the index word area	CS AT NN HVZ BEN VBN AT NN IN AT NN NN NN
by means of an actual label or	IN NNS IN AT JJ NN CC
by means of an origin statement which refers to an actual address , the corresponding index word will be reserved .	IN NNS IN AT NN NN WDT VBZ IN AT JJ NN , AT JJ NN NN MD BE VBN .
These entries should normally appear at the beginning of the program or immediately following each LITORIGIN statement .	DTS NNS MD RB VB IN AT NN IN AT NN CC RB VBG DT NN NN .
Otherwise , symbolic names may have previously been assigned to these same index words .	RB , JJ NNS MD HV RB BEN VBN IN DTS AP NN NNS .
( This method does not apply to electronic switches .	( DT NN DOZ * VB IN JJ NNS .
)	)
The preceding methods allow efficient use of index words and electronic switches during a sectionalized or multi-phase program , particularly when used in conjunction with the LITORIGIN statement .	AT VBG NNS VB JJ NN IN NN NNS CC JJ NNS IN AT VBN CC JJ NN , RB WRB VBN IN NN IN AT NN NN .
Extreme caution should be used , however , to avoid the conflicting usage of an index word or electronic switch which may result from the assignment of more than one name or function to the same address .	JJ NN MD BE VBN , RB , TO VB AT VBG NN IN AT NN NN CC JJ NN WDT MD VB IN AT NN IN AP IN CD NN CC NN IN AT AP NN .
If the symbolic name or actual address of an index word or electronic switch appears or is included in the operand of an XRELEASE or SRELEASE statement ( see page 101 ) , the specified index word or electronic switch will again be made available , regardless of the method by which it was reserved .	CS AT JJ NN CC JJ NN IN AT NN NN CC JJ NN VBZ CC BEZ VBN IN AT NN IN AT NN CC NN NN ( VB NN CD ) , AT VBN NN NN CC JJ NN MD RB BE VBN JJ , RB IN AT NN IN WDT PPS BEDZ VBN .
It will not , however , be used for symbolic assignment until all other index words or electronic switches have been assigned for the first time .	PPS MD * , RB , BE VBN IN JJ NN CS ABN AP NN NNS CC JJ NNS HV BEN VBN IN AT OD NN .
If , at any time during the assignment pass , the compiler finds that there are no more index words available for assignment , the warning message `` No More Index Words Available '' will be placed in the object program listing , the table will be altered to show that index words 1 through 96 are available , and the assignment will continue as before .	CS , IN DTI NN IN AT NN NN , AT NN VBZ CS EX BER AT AP NN NNS JJ IN NN , AT VBG NN `` AT-TL AP-TL NN-TL NNS-TL JJ-TL '' MD BE VBN IN AT NN NN NN , AT NN MD BE VBN TO VB CS NN NNS CD IN CD BER JJ , CC AT NN MD VB CS RB .
If the compiler finds that there are no more electronic switches available for assignment , the warning message `` No More Electronic Switches Available '' will be placed in the object program listing , the table will be altered to show that electronic switches 1 through 30 are available , and assignment will continue as before .	CS AT NN VBZ CS EX BER AT AP JJ NNS JJ IN NN , AT VBG NN `` AT-TL AP-TL JJ-TL NNS JJ-TL '' MD BE VBN IN AT NN NN NN , AT NN MD BE VBN TO VB CS JJ NNS CD IN CD BER JJ , CC NN MD VB CS RB .
The resultant conflicting usage of index words or electronic switches may be avoided by reducing the number of symbolic names used , e.g. , through the proper use of the EQU , XRELEASE , or SRELEASE statements .	AT JJ VBG NN IN NN NNS CC JJ NNS MD BE VBN IN VBG AT NN IN JJ NNS VBN , RB , IN AT JJ NN IN AT NN , NN , CC NN NNS .
As noted in Appendix C , index words 97 through 99 are never available for assignment to symbolic names by the compiler ; ;	CS VBN IN NN-TL NP-TL , NN NNS CD IN CD BER RB JJ IN NN IN JJ NNS IN AT NN . .
also , index words 93 through 96 may have been made unavailable for assignment .	RB , NN NNS CD IN CD MD HV BEN VBN JJ IN NN .
Declarative statements	JJ-HL NNS-HL
Autocoder declarative statements provide the processor with the necessary information to complete the imperative operations properly .	NP JJ NNS VB AT NN IN AT JJ NN TO VB AT JJ NNS RB .
Declarative statements are never executed in the object program and should be separated from the program instruction area , placed preferably at its beginning or end .	JJ NNS BER RB VBN IN AT NN NN CC MD BE VBN IN AT NN NN NN , VBN RB IN PP$ NN CC NN .
Otherwise , special care must be taken to branch around them so that the program will not attempt to execute something in a data area as an instruction .	RB , JJ NN MD BE VBN TO VB IN PPO CS CS AT NN MD * VB TO VB PN IN AT NN NN CS AT NN .
If the compiler does encounter such statements , a warning message will be issued .	CS AT NN DOZ VB JJ NNS , AT VBG NN MD BE VBN .
7070/7074 Autocoder includes the following declarative statements : DA ( Define Area ) , DC ( Define Constant ) , DRDW ( Define Record Definition Word ) , DSW ( Define Switch ) , DLINE ( Define Line ) , EQU ( Equate ) , CODE,DTF ( Define Tape File ) , DIOCS ( Define Input/Output Control System ) , and DUF ( Descriptive Entry For Unit Records ) .	CD NP VBZ AT VBG JJ NNS : NN ( VB-TL NN-TL ) , NN ( VB-TL NN-TL ) , NN ( VB-TL NN-TL NN-TL NN-TL ) , NN ( VB-TL NN-TL ) , NN ( VB-TL NN-TL ) , NN ( VB-TL ) , NN ( VB-TL NN-TL NN-TL ) , NN ( VB-TL JJ-TL NN-TL NN-TL ) , CC NN ( JJ-TL NN-TL IN-TL NN-TL NNS-TL ) .
DA , DC , DTF , and DLINE require more than one entry .	NN , NN , NN , CC NN VB AP IN CD NN .
The DA statement is used to name and define the positions and length of fields within an area .	AT NN NN BEZ VBN TO VB CC VB AT NNS CC NN IN NNS IN AT NN .
The DC statement is used to name and enter constants into the object program .	AT NN NN BEZ VBN TO VB CC VB NNS IN AT NN NN .
Since the 7070 and 7074 make use of record definition words ( RDWS ) to read , write , move , and otherwise examine blocks of storage , the DA and DC statements provide the option of generating RDWS automatically .	CS AT CD CC CD VB NN IN NN NN NNS ( NP ) TO VB , VB , VB , CC RB VB NNS IN NN , AT NN CC NN NNS VB AT NN IN VBG NN RB .
When so instructed , Autocoder will generate one or more RDWS and assign them successive locations immediately preceding the area with which they are to be associated .	WRB RB VBN , NP MD VB CD CC AP NN CC VB PPO JJ NNS RB VBG AT NN IN WDT PPSS BER TO BE VBN .
An RDW will be of the form Af , where xxxx is the starting location of the area and yyyy is its ending location .	AT NN MD BE IN AT NN NN , WRB NN BEZ AT VBG NN IN AT NN CC NN BEZ PP$ VBG NN .
These addresses are calculated automatically by the processor .	DTS NNS BER VBN RB IN AT NN .
In some cases , it may be more advantageous to assign locations to RDWS associated with DA and DC areas in some other part of storage , i.e. , not immediately preceding the DA or DC areas .	IN DTI NNS , PPS MD BE QL JJ TO VB NNS IN NN VBN IN NN CC NN NNS IN DTI AP NN IN NN , RB , * RB VBG AT NN CC NN NNS .
The DRDW statement may be used for this purpose .	AT NN NN MD BE VBN IN DT NN .
The DRDW statement may also be used to generate an RDW defining any area specified by the programmer .	AT NN NN MD RB BE VBN TO VB AT NN VBG DTI NN VBN IN AT NN .
As many as ten digital switches may be named and provided by the DSW statement for consideration by the SETSW and logic macro-instructions .	QL AP CS CD JJ NNS MD BE VBN CC VBN IN AT NN NN IN NN IN AT NN CC NN NNS .
Each switch occupies one digit position in a word , can be set on or off , and is considered as logically equivalent to an electronic switch .	DT NN VBZ CD NN NN IN AT NN , MD BE VBN RP CC RP , CC BEZ VBN CS RB JJ IN AT JJ NN .
It cannot , however , be referred to by electronic switch commands , e.g. , ESN , BSN , etc. .	PPS MD* , RB , BE VBN IN IN JJ NN NNS , RB , NN , NN , RB .
An individual switch or the entire set of switches in a word may be tested or altered as desired .	AT AP NN CC AT JJ NN IN NNS IN AT NN MD BE VBN CC VBN CS VBN .
Through use of the DLINE statement , a means is provided for specifying both the editing of fields to be inserted in a print line area and the layout of the area itself .	IN NN IN AT NN NN , AT NN BEZ VBN IN VBG ABX AT NN IN NNS TO BE VBN IN AT NN NN NN CC AT NN IN AT NN PPL .
The area may include constant information supplied by the programmer .	AT NN MD VB JJ NN VBN IN AT NN .
The area may also be provided with additional data during the running of the object program by means of EDMOV or move macro-instructions .	AT NN MD RB BE VBN IN JJ NN IN AT NN IN AT NN NN IN NNS IN NN CC NN NNS .
The declarative statement EQU permits the programmer to equate symbolic names to actual index words , electronic switches , arm and file numbers , tape channel and unit numbers , alteration switches , etc. , and to equate a symbol to another symbol or to an actual address .	AT JJ NN NN VBZ AT NN TO VB JJ NNS IN JJ NN NNS , JJ NNS , NN CC NN NNS , NN NN CC NN NNS , NN NNS , RB , CC TO VB AT NN IN DT NN CC IN AT JJ NN .
The DIOCS , DTF , and DUF statements are used when required by the Input/Output Control System .	AT NN , NN , CC NN NNS BER VBN WRB VBN IN AT JJ-TL NN-TL NN-TL .
DIOCS is used to select the major methods of processing to be used , and to name the index words used by Aj .	NP BEZ VBN TO VB AT JJ NNS IN VBG TO BE VBN , CC TO VB AT NN NNS VBN IN NN .
Each tape file must be described by Tape File Specifications , produced by Aj .	DT NN NN MD BE VBN IN NN-TL NN-TL NNS-TL , VBN IN NN .
In addition to information related to the file and its records , the File Specifications contain subroutine locations and the location of tape label information .	IN NN IN NN VBN IN AT NN CC PP$ NNS , AT NN-TL NNS-TL VB NN NNS CC AT NN IN NN NN NN .
A DUF entry must be supplied for every unit record file describing the type of file and the unit record equipment to be used .	AT NN NN MD BE VBN IN AT NN NN NN VBG AT NN IN NN CC AT NN NN NN TO BE VBN .
The DUF also supplies the locations of subroutines written by the user that are unique to the file .	AT NN RB VBZ AT NNS IN NNS VBN IN AT NN WPS BER JJ IN AT NN .
A full description of the DIOCS , DTF , and DUF statements is contained in the 7070 Data Processing System Bulletin `` IBM 7070 Input/Output Control System '' , form Aj .	AT JJ NN IN AT NN , NN , CC NN NNS BEZ VBN IN AT CD-TL NNS-TL VBG-TL NN-TL NN-TL `` NP-TL CD-TL JJ-TL NN-TL NN-TL '' , NN NN .
Brief descriptions of these three declarative statements and detailed descriptions of the formats and functions of each of the other 7070/7074 Autocoder declarative statements follow below .	JJ NNS IN DTS CD JJ NNS CC VBN NNS IN AT NNS CC NNS IN DT IN AT AP CD NP JJ NNS VB RB .
diocs -- define input/output control system	NN-HL ---HL VB-HL NN-HL NN-HL NN-HL
When the Input/Output Control System is to be used in a program , a DIOCS statement must be used to select the major methods of processing to be used .	WRB AT JJ-TL NN-TL NN-TL BEZ TO BE VBN IN AT NN , AT NN NN MD BE VBN TO VB AT JJ NNS IN VBG TO BE VBN .
This statement also allows the naming of the index words used by Aj .	DT NN RB VBZ AT NN IN AT NN NNS VBN IN NN .
Source program format	NN-HL NN-HL NN-HL
The basic format of the DIOCS statement is as follows : anylabel is any symbolic label ; ;	AT JJ NN IN AT NN NN BEZ CS VBZ : NP BEZ DTI JJ NN . .
it may be omitted .	PPS MD BE VBN .
The entry DIOCS must be written exactly as shown .	AT NN NN MD BE VBN RB CS VBN .
The first item in the operand , IOCSIXF , is used to specify the first IOCS index word for programs using tape files .	AT OD NN IN AT NN , NN , BEZ VBN TO VB AT OD NN NN NN IN NNS VBG NN NNS .
This item may be a symbolic name or an actual one-digit or two-digit index word address in the range 3 - 94 .	DT NN MD BE AT JJ NN CC AT JJ NN CC JJ NN NN NN IN AT NN CD IN CD .
If the first item in the operand is omitted , the symbolic name IOCSIXF will be assigned .	CS AT OD NN IN AT NN BEZ VBN , AT JJ NN NN MD BE VBN .
When an actual index word or a symbolic address is specified , Autocoder will equate the name IOCSIXF to it .	WRB AT JJ NN NN CC AT JJ NN BEZ VBN , NP MD VB AT NN NN IN PPO .
The second item in the operand , IOCSIXG , is used to specify the second IOCS index word for programs using tape files .	AT OD NN IN AT NN , NN , BEZ VBN TO VB AT OD NN NN NN IN NNS VBG NN NNS .
This item may be a symbolic name or an actual one-digit or two-digit index word address in the range 3 - 94 .	DT NN MD BE AT JJ NN CC AT JJ NN CC JJ NN NN NN IN AT NN CD IN CD .
If the second item in the operand is omitted , the symbolic name IOCSIXG will be assigned .	CS AT OD NN IN AT NN BEZ VBN , AT JJ NN NN MD BE VBN .
When an actual index word or a symbolic address is specified , Autocoder will equate IOCSIXG to it .	WRB AT JJ NN NN CC AT JJ NN BEZ VBN , NP MD VB NN IN PPO .
In the Midwest , oxidation ponds are used extensively for the treatment of domestic sewage from suburban areas .	IN AT NP , NN NNS BER VBN RB IN AT NN IN JJ NN IN JJ NNS .
The high cost of land and a few operational problems resulting from excessive loadings have created the need for a wastewater treatment system with the operational characteristics of the oxidation pond but with the ability to treat more organic matter per unit volume .	AT JJ NN IN NN CC AT AP JJ NNS VBG IN JJ NNS HV VBN AT NN IN AT NN NN NN IN AT JJ NNS IN AT NN NN CC IN AT NN TO VB AP JJ NN IN NN NN .
Research at Fayette , Missouri on oxidation ponds has shown that the BOD in the treated effluent varied from 30 to 53 mg/l with loadings from 8 to 120 lb .	NN IN NP , NP IN NN NNS HVZ VBN CS AT NN IN AT VBN NN VBD IN CD IN CD NN IN NNS IN CD IN CD NN .
Since experience indicates that effluents from oxidation ponds do not create major problems at these BOD concentrations , the goal for the effluent quality of the accelerated treatment system was the same as from conventional oxidation ponds .	CS NN VBZ CS NNS IN NN NNS DO * VB JJ NNS IN DTS NN NNS , AT NN IN AT NN NN IN AT VBN NN NN BEDZ AT AP CS IN JJ NN NNS .
Recent studies by Weston and Stack had indicated that a turbine aerator could be added to an oxidation pond to increase the rate of oxygen transfer .	JJ NNS IN NP CC NP HVD VBN CS AT NN NN MD BE VBN IN AT NN NN TO VB AT NN IN NN NN .
Their study showed that it was possible to transfer 3 to 4 lb of oxygen / hr. / hp.	PP$ NN VBD CS PPS BEDZ JJ TO VB CD IN CD NN IN NN IN NN IN NN
.	.
O'Connor and Eckenfelder discussed the use of aerated lagoons for treating organic wastes .	NP CC NP VBD AT NN IN VBN NNS IN VBG JJ NNS .
They indicated that a 4-day retention , aerated lagoon would give 60 to 76 per cent BOD reduction .	PPSS VBD CS AT JJ NN , VBN NN MD VB CD IN CD IN NN NN NN .
Later , Eckenfelder increased the efficiency of treatment to between 75 and 85 per cent in the summer months .	RBR , NP VBD AT NN IN NN IN IN CD CC CD IN NN IN AT NN NNS .
It appeared from the limited information available that the aerated lagoon might offer a satisfactory means of increasing the capacity of existing oxidation ponds as well as providing the same degree of treatment in a smaller volume .	PPS VBD IN AT VBN NN JJ CS AT VBN NN MD VB AT JJ NN IN VBG AT NN IN VBG NN NNS QL RB CS VBG AT AP NN IN NN IN AT JJR NN .
Red Bridge Subdivision	JJ-TL-HL NN-TL-HL NN-TL-HL
With the development of the Red Bridge Subdivision south of Kansas City , Missouri , the developer was faced with the problem of providing adequate sewage disposal .	IN AT NN IN AT JJ-TL NN-TL NN-TL NR IN NP-TL NN-TL , NP , AT NN BEDZ VBN IN AT NN IN VBG JJ NN NN .
The sewage system from Kansas City was not expected to serve the Red Bridge area for several years .	AT NN NN IN NP-TL NN-TL BEDZ * VBN TO VB AT JJ-TL NN-TL NN IN AP NNS .
This necessitated the construction of temporary sewage treatment facilities with an expected life from 5 to 15 Aj .	DT VBD AT NN IN JJ NN NN NNS IN AT VBN NN IN CD IN CD NN .
For the initial development an oxidation pond was constructed as shown in Figure 1 .	IN AT JJ NN AT NN NN BEDZ VBN CS VBN IN NN-TL CD-TL .
The oxidation pond has a surface area of 4.77 acres and a depth of 4 Aj .	AT NN NN HVZ AT NN NN IN CD NNS CC AT NN IN CD NN .
The pond is currently serving 1,230 persons or 260 persons per acre .	AT NN BEZ RB VBG CD NNS CC CD NNS IN NN .
In the summer of 1960 the oxidation pond became completely septic and emitted obnoxious odors .	IN AT NN IN CD AT NN NN VBD RB JJ CC VBD JJ NNS .
It was possible to maintain aerobic conditions in the pond by regular additions of sodium nitrate until the temperature decreased and the algae population changed from blue-green to green algae .	PPS BEDZ JJ TO VB JJ NNS IN AT NN IN JJ NNS IN NN NN CS AT NN VBD CC AT NNS NN VBD IN JJ IN JJ NNS .
The anaerobic conditions in the existing oxidation pond necessitated examination of other methods for supplying additional oxygen than by sodium nitrate .	AT JJ NNS IN AT VBG NN NN VBD NN IN AP NNS IN VBG JJ NN CS IN NN NN .
At the same time further expansion in the Red Bridge Subdivision required the construction of additional sewage treatment facilities .	IN AT AP NN JJR NN IN AT JJ-TL NN-TL NN-TL VBD AT NN IN JJ NN NN NNS .
The large land areas required for oxidation ponds made this type of treatment financially unattractive to the developer .	AT JJ NN NNS VBN IN NN NNS VBD DT NN IN NN RB JJ IN AT NN .
It was proposed that aerated lagoons be used to eliminate the problem at the existing oxidation ponds and to provide the necessary treatment for the additional development .	PPS BEDZ VBN CS VBN NNS BE VBN TO VB AT NN IN AT VBG NN NNS CC TO VB AT JJ NN IN AT JJ NN .
Pilot lagoon	NN-HL NN-HL
The lack of adequate data on the aerated lagoon system prompted the developer to construct an aerated lagoon pilot plant to determine its feasibility for treating domestic sewage .	AT NN IN JJ NN IN AT VBN NN NN VBD AT NN TO VB AT VBN NN NN NN TO VB PP$ NN IN VBG JJ NN .
The pilot plant was a circular lagoon 81 ft in diam at the surface and 65 ft in diam at the bottom , 4 ft below the surface , with a volume of 121,000 Aj .	AT NN NN BEDZ AT JJ NN CD NN IN NN IN AT NN CC CD NN IN NN IN AT NN , CD NN IN AT NN , IN AT NN IN CD NN .
The side slopes were coated with fiberglas matting coated with asphalt to prevent erosion .	AT NN NNS BED VBN IN NN NN VBN IN NN TO VB NN .
The pilot lagoon was located as shown in Figure 1 to serve the area just south of the existing housing area .	AT NN NN BEDZ VBN CS VBN IN NN-TL CD-TL TO VB AT NN RB NR IN AT VBG NN NN .
The major contributor was a shopping center with houses being added to the system as the subdivision developed .	AT JJ NN BEDZ AT VBG NN IN NNS BEG VBN IN AT NN CS AT NN VBD .
The pilot lagoon was designed to handle the wastes from 314 persons with a 4-day aeration period .	AT NN NN BEDZ VBN TO VB AT NNS IN CD NNS IN AT JJ NN NN .
Initially , the wastewater would be entirely from the shopping center with the domestic sewage from the houses increasing over an 18-month period .	RB , AT NN MD BE RB IN AT VBG NN IN AT JJ NN IN AT NNS VBG IN AT JJ NN .
This operation would permit evaluation of the pilot plant , with a slowly increasing load , over a reasonable period of time .	DT NN MD VB NN IN AT NN NN , IN AT RB VBG NN , IN AT JJ NN IN NN .
The pilot plant was equipped with a 3-hp. turbine aerator ( Figure 2 ) .	AT NN NN BEDZ VBN IN AT JJ NN NN ( NN-TL CD-TL ) .
The aerator had a variable-speed drive to permit operation through a range of speeds .	AT NN HVD AT NN NN TO VB NN IN AT NN IN NNS .
The sewage flow into the treatment plant was metered and continuously recorded on 24-hr. charts .	AT NN NN IN AT NN NN BEDZ VBN CC RB VBN IN JJ NNS .
The raw sewage was introduced directly under the turbine aerator to insure maximum mixing of the raw sewage with the aeration tank contents .	AT JJ NN BEDZ VBN RB IN AT NN NN TO VB JJ NN IN AT JJ NN IN AT NN NN NNS .
The effluent was collected through two pipes and discharged to the Blue River through a surface drainage ditch .	AT NN BEDZ VBN IN CD NNS CC VBN IN AT JJ-TL NN-TL IN AT NN NN NN .
Analyses	NNS-HL
Composite samples were collected at weekly intervals .	JJ NNS BED VBN IN JJ NNS .
The long retention period and the complete mixing concept prevented rapid changes in either the mixed liquor or in the effluent .	AT JJ NN NN CC AT JJ VBG NN VBD JJ NNS IN CC AT VBN NN CC IN AT NN .
Weekly samples would make any changes more readily discernible than daily samples .	JJ NNS MD VB DTI NNS QL RB JJ CS JJ NNS .
The composite samples were normally collected over a 6-hr. period , but an occasional 24-hr. composite was made .	AT JJ NNS BED RB VBN IN AT JJ NN , CC AT JJ JJ NN BEDZ VBN .
Examination of the operations of the shopping center permitted correlation of the 6-hr. composite samples with 24-hr. operations .	NN IN AT NNS IN AT VBG NN VBD NN IN AT JJ JJ NNS IN JJ NNS .
The data indicated that the organic load during the 6-hr. composites was essentially 50 per cent of the 24-hr. organic load .	AT NN VBD CS AT JJ NN IN AT JJ NNS BEDZ RB CD IN NN IN AT JJ JJ NN .
Grab samples were collected from the existing oxidation pond to determine its operating conditions .	NN NNS BED VBN IN AT VBG NN NN TO VB PP$ VBG NNS .
Efforts were made to take the grab samples at random periods so that the mass of data could be treated as a 6-hr. composite sample .	NNS BED VBN TO VB AT NN NNS IN JJ NNS CS CS AT NN IN NN MD BE VBN CS AT JJ JJ NN .
A single 24-hr. composite sample indicated that the sewage flow pattern and characteristics were typical .	AT AP JJ JJ NN VBD CS AT NN NN NN CC NNS BED JJ .
Pilot plant operations	NN-HL NN-HL NNS-HL
The BOD of the influent to the pilot plant varied between 110 and 710 mg/l with an average of 350 Aj .	AT NN IN AT NN IN AT NN NN VBD IN CD CC CD NN IN AT NN IN CD NN .
This was equivalent to 240 mg/lBOD on a 24-hr. basis .	DT BEDZ JJ IN CD NN IN AT JJ NN .
The BOD of the raw sewage was typical of domestic sewage from a subdivision .	AT NN IN AT JJ NN BEDZ JJ IN JJ NN IN AT NN .
The BOD in the effluent averaged 58 mg/l , a 76-per-cent reduction over the 24-hr. period .	AT NN IN AT NN VBD CD NN , AT NN NN IN AT JJ NN .
Examination of the data in Table 1 , shows that a few samples contributed to raising the effluent Aj .	NN IN AT NN IN NN-TL CD-TL , VBZ CS AT AP NNS VBD IN VBG AT NN NN .
The periods of high effluent BOD occurred during cold periods when operational problems with the aerator resulted .	AT NNS IN JJ NN NN VBD IN JJ NNS WRB JJ NNS IN AT NN VBD .
Ice caused the aerator to overload , straining the drive belts .	NN VBD AT NN TO VB , VBG AT NN NNS .
The slippage of the drive belts caused the aerator to slow down and reduce oxygen transfer as well as the mixing of the raw sewage .	AT NN IN AT NN NNS VBD AT NN TO VB RP CC VB NN NN QL RB CS AT NN IN AT JJ NN .
The organic loading on the unit averaged 32 lb of BOD/day or about 2 lb BOD/day/1,000 cu ft aeration capacity .	AT JJ NN IN AT NN VBD CD NN IN NN CC RB CD NN NN NN NN NN NN .
Needless to say , the organic load was very low on a volumetric basis , but was 270 lb BOD/day/acre on a surface loading basis .	JJ TO VB , AT JJ NN BEDZ QL JJ IN AT JJ NN , CC BEDZ CD NN NN IN AT NN VBG NN .
It seems that the aerated lagoon was a very heavily loaded oxidation pond or a lightly loaded activated sludge system .	PPS VBZ CS AT VBN NN BEDZ AT QL RB VBN NN NN CC AT RB VBN VBN NN NN .
The flow rate remained relatively constant during the winter months as shown in Table 1 .	AT NN NN VBD QL JJ IN AT NN NNS CS VBN IN NN-TL CD-TL .
With the spring rains the flow rose rapidly due to infiltration in open sewers .	IN AT NN NNS AT NN VBD RB RB IN NN IN JJ NNS .
As construction progresses , the volume of storm drainage will be sharply reduced .	CS NN VBZ , AT NN IN NN NN MD BE RB VBN .
The retention period in the aerated lagoon ranged from 9.8 to 2.6 days , averaging 6.4 days .	AT NN NN IN AT VBN NN VBD IN CD IN CD NNS , VBG CD NNS .
The large amount of vegetable grindings from the grocery store in the shopping center created a suspended solids problem .	AT JJ NN IN NN NNS IN AT NN NN IN AT VBG NN VBD AT VBN NNS NN .
The vegetables were not readily metabolized by the bacteria in the aeration unit and tended to float on the surface .	AT NNS BED * RB VBN IN AT NNS IN AT NN NN CC VBD TO VB IN AT NN .
A skimming device at the effluent weir prevented loss of most of these light solids .	AT VBG NN IN AT NN NN VBD NN IN AP IN DTS JJ NNS .
The average volatile suspended solids in the effluent was 75 mg/l while MLSS averaged 170 mg/l volatile suspended solids .	AT JJ JJ VBN NNS IN AT NN BEDZ CD NN CS NN VBD CD NN JJ VBN NNS .
The average sludge age based on displacement of solids was calculated to be 14.5 days .	AT JJ NN NN VBN IN NN IN NNS BEDZ VBN TO BE CD NNS .
The oxygen uptake rate in the mixed liquor averaged 0.8 mg/l/hr during the first four months of this study .	AT NN NN NN IN AT VBN NN VBD CD NN IN AT OD CD NNS IN DT NN .
Variations in aerator speeds during the latter two months of this study caused increased mixing and increased oxygen demand .	NNS IN NN NNS IN AT AP CD NNS IN DT NN VBD VBN VBG CC VBN NN NN .
The increase in oxygen uptake rates from 1.2 to 2.6 mg/l/hr which followed an increase in rotor speed was believed to be related to resuspension of solids which had settled at the lower rotor speeds .	AT NN IN NN NN NNS IN CD IN CD NN WDT VBD AT NN IN NN NN BEDZ VBN TO BE VBN IN NN IN NNS WDT HVD VBN IN AT JJR NN NNS .
It appeared that most of the mixed liquor suspended solids were active microbial solids with the heavier , less active solids settling out .	PPS VBD CS AP IN AT VBN NN VBN NNS BED JJ JJ NNS IN AT JJR , QL JJ NNS VBG RP .
The suspended solids discharged in the effluent were found to be the major source of the Aj .	AT VBN NNS VBN IN AT NN BED VBN TO BE AT JJ NN IN AT NN .
Removal of the suspended solids by a membrane filter yielded an average effluent containing only 20 mg/l Aj .	NN IN AT VBN NNS IN AT NN NN VBD AT JJ NN VBG RB CD NN NN .
The BOD in the drainage ditch receiving the pilot plant effluent averaged 12 Aj .	AT NN IN AT NN NN VBG AT NN NN NN VBD CD NN .
This low BOD was due to removal of the excess suspended solids by sedimentation since the only dilution was surface runoff which was very low during this study .	DT NN NN BEDZ JJ IN NN IN AT JJ VBN NNS IN NN CS AT AP NN BEDZ NN NN WDT BEDZ QL JJ IN DT NN .
Microscopic examination	JJ-HL NN-HL
Routine microscopic examinations were made of the mixed liquor as indicated by McKinney and Gram for the various types of protozoa .	JJ JJ NNS BED VBN IN AT VBN NN CS VBN IN NP CC NP IN AT AP NNS IN NNS .
It was found that the aerated lagoon was an activated sludge system rather than an oxidation pond .	PPS BEDZ VBN CS AT VBN NN BEDZ AT VBN NN NN RB CS AT NN NN .
At no time were algae found in the mixed liquor .	IN AT NN BED NNS VBN IN AT VBN NN .
The bacteria formed typical activated sludge floc .	AT NNS VBD JJ VBN NN NN .
The floc particles were all small as the heavier floc settled out .	AT NN NNS BED ABN JJ CS AT JJR NN VBD RP .
Initially , the flagellated protozoa predominated , but they soon gave way to the free swimming ciliated protozoa .	RB , AT VBN NNS VBD , CC PPSS RB VBD NN IN AT RB VBG JJ NNS .
As the temperature decreased , the number of free swimming ciliated protozoa decreased .	CS AT NN VBD , AT NN IN RB VBG JJ NNS VBD .
Very little protozoa activity existed below 40-degrees-F .	QL AP NNS NN VBD IN NNS .
When the temperature reached 32-degrees-F all protozoan activity ceased ; ;	WRB AT NN VBD NNS ABN JJ NN VBD . .
but as the temperature rose , the numbers of protozoa increased rapidly .	CC CS AT NN VBD , AT NNS IN NNS VBD RB .
Only once were stalked ciliates found in the mixed liquor .	RB RB BED VBN NNS VBN IN AT VBN NN .
The predomination of free swimming ciliated protozoa is indicative of a high bacterial population .	AT NN IN RB VBG JJ NNS BEZ JJ IN AT JJ JJ NN .
Oxygen transfer	NN-HL NN-HL
One of the important aspects of this study was to determine the oxygen transfer relationships of the mechanical aerator .	CD IN AT JJ NNS IN DT NN BEDZ TO VB AT NN NN NNS IN AT JJ NN .
Routine determinations were made for dissolved oxygen in the mixed liquor and for oxygen uptake rates .	JJ NNS BED VBN IN VBN NN IN AT VBN NN CC IN NN NN NNS .
The data given in Table 2 , show the routine operation of the aerator .	AT NNS VBN IN NN-TL CD-TL , VB AT JJ NN IN AT NN .
The dissolved oxygen in the aeration unit was consistently high until January 29 , 1961 .	AT VBN NN IN AT NN NN BEDZ RB JJ IN NP CD , CD .
An extended cold spell caused ice to build up on the aerator which was mounted on a floating platform and caused the entire platform to sink lower in the water .	AT VBN JJ NN VBD NN TO VB RP IN AT NN WDT BEDZ VBN IN AT VBG NN CC VBD AT JJ NN TO VB RBR IN AT NN .
The added resistance to the rotor damaged the drive belts and reduced the oxygen transfer capacity .	AT VBN NN IN AT NN VBD AT NN NNS CC VBD AT NN NN NN .
It was approximately one month before the belt problem was noticed and corrected , but at no time was there a deficiency of dissolved oxygen .	PPS BEDZ RB CD NN CS AT NN NN BEDZ VBN CC VBN , CC IN AT NN BEDZ EX AT NN IN VBN NN .
A series of eight special tests were conducted at different rotor speeds to determine the oxygen transfer rate .	AT NNS IN CD JJ NNS BED VBN IN JJ NN NNS TO VB AT NN NN NN .
Five of the tests were conducted with a polyethylene cover to simulate an ice cover .	CD IN AT NNS BED VBN IN AT NN NN TO VB AT NN NN .
The rate of oxygen transfer at 1.0-mg. / l. dissolved oxygen concentration and 10-degrees-C for various rotor speeds is given in Table 3 .	AT NN IN NN NN IN NN IN NN VBN NN NN CC NNS IN AP NN NNS BEZ VBN IN NN-TL CD-TL .
The maximum rate of oxygen transfer at 1.0 mg/l dissolved oxygen was calculated as 220 lb/day at a maximum rate of 9.3 Aj .	AT JJ NN IN NN NN IN CD NN VBN NN BEDZ VBN CS CD NN IN AT JJ NN IN CD NN .
The actual power requirements indicated 2 lb. oxygen transfer / hr. / hp. .	AT JJ NN NNS VBD CD NN NN NN IN NN IN NN .
The polyethylene cover reduced the oxygen transfer rate by 10 per cent , indicating that the maximum oxygen transfer is at the rotor rather than through the surface .	AT NN NN VBD AT NN NN NN IN CD IN NN , VBG CS AT JJ NN NN BEZ IN AT NN RB CS IN AT NN .
Oxidation pond	NN-HL NN-HL
During this study septic conditions developed in the oxidation pond in the spring when the ice melted .	IN DT NN JJ NNS VBD IN AT NN NN IN AT NN WRB AT NN VBD .
Shortly after this study ended septic conditions resulted which required the addition of sodium nitrate .	RB CS DT NN VBD JJ NNS VBD WDT VBD AT NN IN NN NN .
The location of the oxidation pond in a high-value residential area makes odor nuisances a sensitive problem for the developer .	AT NN IN AT NN NN IN AT NN JJ NN VBZ NN NNS AT JJ NN IN AT NN .
The organic concentration in the influent raw sewage ranged from 160 to 270 mg/l of BOD with an average of 230 Aj .	AT JJ NN IN AT JJ JJ NN VBD IN CD IN CD NN IN NN IN AT NN IN CD NN .
The BOD data are given in Table 4 .	AT NN NNS BER VBN IN NN-TL CD-TL .
A single 24-hr. composite sample had a BOD of 260 mg/l , indicating a typical domestic sewage .	AT AP JJ JJ NN HVD AT NN IN CD NN , VBG AT JJ JJ NN .
The daily sewage volume to the oxidation pond averaged 147,000 gpd , giving a retention period of 42 days .	AT JJ NN NN IN AT NN NN VBD CD NN , VBG AT NN NN IN CD NNS .
The organic loading on the pond was slightly under 60 lb. BOD / day / acre .	AT JJ NN IN AT NN BEDZ RB IN CD NN NP IN NN IN NN .
The effluent BOD averaged 34 mg/l , a little lower than that of the study at Fayette indicated for a loading of 60 lb. Aj .	AT NN NN VBD CD NN , AT QL JJR CS DT IN AT NN IN NP VBD IN AT NN IN CD NN NN .
The BOD of the effluent ranged from a minimum of 13 to a maximum of 47 mg. / l. .	AT NN IN AT NN VBD IN AT NN IN CD IN AT JJ IN CD NN IN NN .
Microscopic examination of the effluent showed that minimum BOD occurred when the algae began to decrease with cold weather .	JJ NN IN AT NN VBD CS JJ NN VBD WRB AT NNS VBD TO VB IN JJ NN .
When the algae began to build up again , the effluent BOD rose .	WRB AT NNS VBD TO VB RP RB , AT NN NN VBD .
During the two weeks when the algae disappeared from the effluent BOD's in the effluent were 18 and 16 Aj .	IN AT CD NNS WRB AT NNS VBD IN AT NN NN IN AT NN BED CD CC CD NN .
Thus , the three main categories of antisubmarine warfare operations are defense of shipping , defense of naval forces , and area defense .	RB , AT CD JJS NNS IN JJ NN NNS BER NN IN NN , NN IN JJ NNS , CC NN NN .
The last category overlaps the others in amphibious operations and near terminals and bases .	AT AP NN VBZ AT NNS IN JJ NNS CC IN NNS CC NNS .
To effect these operations , five elements exist ( 1 ) surface , ( 2 ) air , ( 3 ) mines , ( 4 ) submarine , and ( 5 ) fixed installations .	TO VB DTS NNS , CD NNS VB ( CD ) NN , ( CD ) NN , ( CD ) NNS , ( CD ) NN , CC ( CD ) VBN NNS .
Surface forces have been used to provide defense zones around naval and merchant ship formations , air to furnish area surveillance , and mines for protection of limited areas .	NN NNS HV BEN VBN TO VB NN NNS IN JJ CC NN NN NNS , NN TO VB NN NN , CC NNS IN NN IN VBN NNS .
Submarines and shore installations are new elements .	NNS CC NN NNS BER JJ NNS .
The submarine now has a definite place in submarine defense particularly in denying enemy access to ocean areas .	AT NN RB HVZ AT JJ NN IN JJ NN RB IN VBG NN NN IN NN NNS .
Fixed installations offer possibilities for area detection .	VBN NNS VB NNS IN NN NN .
Mine warfare is being reoriented against submarine targets .	NN NN BEZ BEG VBN IN JJ NNS .
A sixth element , not always considered , is intelligence .	AT OD NN , * RB VBN , BEZ NN .
It includes operational intelligence of the enemy and knowledge of the environment .	PPS VBZ JJ NN IN AT NN CC NN IN AT NN .
Operational intelligence presumably will be available from our national intelligence agencies ; ;	JJ NN RB MD BE JJ IN PP$ JJ NN NNS . .
intelligence on the environment will come from the recently augmented program in oceanography .	NN IN AT NN MD VB IN AT RB VBN NN IN NN .
The major postwar development is the certainty that these elements should not be considered singly but in combination and as being mutually supporting .	AT JJ JJ NN BEZ AT NN CS DTS NNS MD * BE VBN RB CC IN NN CC CS BEG RB VBG .
Necessity for an over-all concept	NN-HL IN-HL AT-HL JJ-HL NN-HL
Thinking on submarine defense has not always been clear-cut .	NN IN JJ NN HVZ * RB BEN JJ .
Proponents of single elements tend to ensure predominance of that element without determining if it is justified , and the element with the most enthusiastic and vociferous proponents has assumed the greatest importance .	NNS IN AP NNS VB TO VB NN IN DT NN IN VBG CS PPS BEZ VBN , CC AT NN IN AT QL JJ CC JJ NNS HVZ VBN AT JJT NN .
Consequently , air , surface , and submarine elements overshadow the mine , fixed installations , and intelligence .	RB , NN , NN , CC JJ NNS VB AT NN , VBN NNS , CC NN .
These have sought more and more of what they have .	DTS HV VBN AP CC AP IN WDT PPSS HV .
Each seems to strive for elimination of the necessity for the others .	DT VBZ TO VB IN NN IN AT NN IN AT NNS .
This , despite postwar experience demonstrating that all elements are necessarily mutually supporting .	DT , IN JJ NN VBG CS ABN NNS BER RB RB VBG .
Thus , the most productive areas are not necessarily the most stressed .	RB , AT QL JJ NNS BER * RB AT QL VBN .
This is stated to emphasize the necessity for an over-all concept of submarine defense , one which would provide positions of relative importance to ASW elements based on projected potentialities .	DT BEZ VBN TO VB AT NN IN AT JJ NN IN JJ NN , CD WDT MD VB NNS IN JJ NN IN NN NNS VBN IN VBN NNS .
Then the enthusiasm and energy of all elements can be channeled to produce cumulative progress toward a common objective .	RB AT NN CC NN IN ABN NNS MD BE VBN TO VB JJ NN IN AT JJ NN .
An over-all concept would have other advantages .	AT JJ NN MD HV AP NNS .
It would allow presentation to the public of a unified approach .	PPS MD VB NN IN AT NN IN AT VBN NN .
Now the problem is presented piecemeal and sometimes contradictorily .	RB AT NN BEZ VBN RB CC RB RB .
While one element is announcing progress , another is delineating its problems .	CS CD NN BEZ VBG NN , DT BEZ VBG PP$ NNS .
The result can only be confusion in the public mind .	AT NN MD RB BE NN IN AT NN NN .
A unified concept can serve as a guide to budgeting and , if public support is gained , will command Congressional support .	AT VBN NN MD VB CS AT NN IN VBG CC , CS NN NN BEZ VBN , MD VB JJ-TL NN .
Industry's main criticism of the Navy's antisubmarine effort is that it cannot determine where any one company or industry can apply its skills and know-how .	NN$ JJS NN IN AT NN$-TL JJ NN BEZ CS PPS MD* VB WRB DTI CD NN CC NN MD VB PP$ NNS CC NN .
Lacking guidance , industry picks its own areas .	VBG NN , NN VBZ PP$ JJ NNS .
The result , coupled with the salesmanship for which American industry is famous , is considerable expenditure of funds and efforts in marginal areas .	AT NN , VBN IN AT NN IN WDT JJ NN BEZ JJ , BEZ JJ NN IN NNS CC NNS IN JJ NNS .
An over-all concept will guide industry where available talents and facilities will yield greatest dividends .	AT JJ NN MD VB NN WRB JJ NNS CC NNS MD VB JJT NNS .
Therefore , a broad concept of over-all submarine defense is needed for co-ordination of the Navy's efforts , for a logical presentation to the public , for industry's guidance , and as a basis for a program to the Congress .	RB , AT JJ NN IN JJ JJ NN BEZ VBN IN NN IN AT NN$-TL NNS , IN AT JJ NN IN AT NN , IN NN$ NN , CC CS AT NN IN AT NN IN AT NP .
Principles involved in an over-all concept	NNS-HL VBN-HL IN-HL AT-HL JJ-HL NN-HL
That which follows will be a discussion of principles and possible content for an over-all concept of antisubmarine warfare .	DT WDT VBZ MD BE AT NN IN NNS CC JJ NN IN AT JJ NN IN JJ NN .
Russia possesses the preponderance of submarines in the world , divided between her various fleets .	NP VBZ AT NN IN NNS IN AT NN , VBN IN PP$ AP NNS .
Some are also in Albania and others are on loan to Egypt .	DTI BER RB IN NP CC NNS BER IN NN IN NP .
Other countries which may willingly or unwillingly become Communist can furnish bases .	AP NNS WDT MD RB CC RB VB JJ MD VB NNS .
Communist target areas can be assumed , but there is no certainty that such assumptions coincide with Soviet intentions .	JJ NN NNS MD BE VBN , CC EX BEZ AT NN CS JJ NNS VB IN NP NNS .
Attack can come from almost any direction against many locations .	NN MD VB IN RB DTI NN IN AP NNS .
Logically , then , the first principle of the plan must be that it is not rigidly oriented toward any geographical area .	RB , RB , AT OD NN IN AT NN MD BE CS PPS BEZ * RB VBN IN DTI JJ NN .
It is often stated that the submarine can be destroyed while building , at bases , in transit , and on station .	PPS BEZ RB VBN CS AT NN MD BE VBN CS VBG , IN NNS , IN NN , CC IN NN .
Destruction of the enemy's building and base complex , however , requires attacks on enemy territory , which is possible only in event of all-out hostilities .	NN IN AT NN$ NN CC NN NN , RB , VBZ NNS IN NN NN , WDT BEZ JJ RB IN NN IN JJ NNS .
In transit or on station , it may not be possible to attack the submarines until commission of an overt act .	IN NN CC IN NN , PPS MD * BE JJ TO VB AT NNS CS NN IN AT JJ NN .
The Communists are adept at utilizing hostilities short of general war and will do so whenever it is to their advantage .	AT NNS-TL BER JJ IN VBG NNS JJ IN JJ NN CC MD DO RB WRB PPS BEZ IN PP$ NN .
Therefore the second principle of the plan must be that , while providing for all-out hostilities , its effectiveness is not dependent on general war .	RB AT OD NN IN AT NN MD BE CS , CS VBG IN JJ NNS , PP$ NN BEZ * JJ IN JJ NN .
Antisubmarine warfare does not involve clashes between large opposing forces , with the decision a result of a single battle .	JJ NN DOZ * VB NNS IN JJ VBG NNS , IN AT NN AT NN IN AT AP NN .
It is a war of attrition , of single actions , of an exchange of losses .	PPS BEZ AT NN IN NN , IN AP NNS , IN AT NN IN NNS .
This exchange must result in our ending up with some effective units .	DT NN MD VB IN PP$ VBG RP IN DTI JJ NNS .
Initially , having fewer units of some elements -- especially submarines -- than the opponent , our capabilities need to be sufficiently greater than theirs , so that the exchange will be in our favor .	RB , HVG AP NNS IN DTI NNS -- RB NNS -- CS AT NN , PP$ NNS VB TO BE QL JJR CS PP$$ , CS CS AT NN MD BE IN PP$ NN .
Therefore , the third principle of the plan must be that it does not depend for effectiveness on engagement by the same types , unless at an assured favorable exchange rate .	RB , AT OD NN IN AT NN MD BE CS PPS DOZ * VB IN NN IN NN IN AT AP NNS , CS IN AT VBN JJ NN NN .
The submarine has increased its effectiveness by several orders of magnitude since World War 2 .	AT NN HVZ VBN PP$ NN IN AP NNS IN NN IN NN-TL NN-TL CD-TL .
Its speed has increased , it operates at increasingly greater depths , its submerged endurance is becoming unlimited , and it will become even more silent .	PP$ NN HVZ VBN , PPS VBZ IN RB JJR NNS , PP$ VBN NN BEZ VBG JJ , CC PPS MD VB QL QL JJ .
The next developments will probably be in weaponry .	AT AP NNS MD RB BE IN NN .
The missile can gradually be expected to replace the torpedo .	AT NN MD RB BE VBN TO VB AT NN .
As detection ranges increase , weapons will be developed to attack other submarines and surface craft at these ranges .	CS NN NNS VB , NNS MD BE VBN TO VB AP NNS CC NN NN IN DTS NNS .
Therefore , the fourth principle of the plan must be that it provide for continuously increasing capabilities in the opponent .	RB , AT OD NN IN AT NN MD BE CS PPS VB IN RB VBG NNS IN AT NN .
No element can accomplish the total objective of submarine defense .	AT NN MD VB AT JJ NN IN JJ NN .
Some elements support the others , but all have limitations .	DTI NNS VB AT NNS , CC ABN HV NNS .
Some limitations of one element can be compensated for by a capability of another .	DTI NNS IN CD NN MD BE VBN IN IN AT NN IN DT .
Elements used in combination will increase the over-all capability more than the sum of the capabilities of the individual elements .	NNS VBN IN NN MD VB AT JJ NN RBR CS AT NN IN AT NNS IN AT AP NNS .
Therefore , the plan's fifth principle must be that it capitalize on the capabilities of all elements in combination .	RB , AT NN$ OD NN MD BE CS PPS VB IN AT NNS IN ABN NNS IN NN .
Conceivably the submarine defense problem can be solved by sufficient forces .	RB AT JJ NN NN MD BE VBN IN JJ NNS .
Numbers would be astronomical and current fiscal policies make this an impractical solution .	NNS MD BE JJ CC JJ JJ NNS VB DT AT JJ NN .
Shipbuilding , aircraft procurement , and weapon programs indicate that there will not be enough of anything .	NN , NN NN , CC NN NNS VB CS EX MD * BE AP IN PN .
Therefore , any measures taken in peacetime which will decrease force requirements in war will contribute greatly to success when hostilities occur .	RB , DTI NNS VBN IN NN WDT MD VB NN NNS IN NN MD VB RB IN NN WRB NNS VB .
Therefore , the sixth principle of the plan must be that it concentrate on current measures which will reduce future force requirements .	RB , AT OD NN IN AT NN MD BE CS PPS VB IN JJ NNS WDT MD VB JJ NN NNS .
The world is constantly changing ; ;	AT NN BEZ RB VBG . .
what was new yesterday is obsolescent today .	WDT BEDZ JJ NR BEZ JJ NR .
The seventh principle of the plan is self-evident ; ;	AT OD NN IN AT NN BEZ JJ . .
it must be flexible enough to allow for technological breakthroughs , scientific progress , and changes in world conditions .	PPS MD BE JJ QLP TO VB IN JJ NNS , JJ NN , CC NNS IN NN NNS .
Supporting elements in asw operations	VBG-HL NNS-HL IN-HL NN-HL NNS-HL
To this point the need for an over-all plan for submarine defense has been demonstrated , the mission has been stated , broad principles delineating its content laid down , and the supporting elements listed .	IN DT NN AT NN IN AT JJ NN IN JJ NN HVZ BEN VBN , AT NN HVZ BEN VBN , JJ NNS VBG PP$ NN VBN RP , CC AT VBG NNS VBN .
Before considering these elements in more detail , an additional requirement should be stated .	CS VBG DTS NNS IN AP NN , AT JJ NN MD BE VBN .
Large area coverage will accomplish all other tasks .	JJ NN NN MD VB ABN AP NNS .
Therefore , because reduction in tasks results in reduction of forces required , the plan should provide for expanding area coverage .	RB , CS NN IN NNS NNS IN NN IN NNS VBN , AT NN MD VB IN VBG NN NN .
But it must be remembered that the plan should not be oriented geographically .	CC PPS MD BE VBN CS AT NN MD * BE VBN RB .
Consequently , the system giving area coverage ( if such coverage is less than world wide ) must be flexible and hence at least partially mobile .	RB , AT NN VBG NN NN ( CS JJ NN BEZ AP CS NN JJ ) MD BE JJ CC RB IN AP RB JJ .
Since effective area coverage appears fairly remote , the requirement can be borne in mind while considering the elements : air , surface , sub-surface , fixed installations , mines , and intelligence .	CS JJ NN NN VBZ QL JJ , AT NN MD BE VBN IN NN CS IN AT NNS : NN , NN , JJ , VBN NNS , NNS , CC NN .
These are arranged approximately in the order of the vociferousness of their proponents but will be discussed in the reverse order in the hope that the true order of importance will result .	DTS BER VBN RB IN AT NN IN AT NN IN PP$ NNS CC MD BE VBN IN AT JJ NN IN AT NN CS AT JJ NN IN NN MD VB .
Intelligence , as used herein , will include information on possible opponents and on the environment which can affect operations .	NN , CS VBN RB , MD VB NN IN JJ NNS CC IN AT NN WDT MD VB NNS .
These can be referred to as operational intelligence and environmental intelligence .	DTS MD BE VBN IN CS JJ NN CC JJ NN .
In submarine defense these must have maximum stress .	IN JJ NN DTS MD HV JJ NN .
Good operational intelligence can ensure sound planning , greatly reduce force requirements , and increase tactical effectiveness .	JJ JJ NN MD VB JJ NN , RB VB NN NNS , CC VB JJ NN .
Environmental intelligence is just as important .	JJ NN BEZ RB QL JJ .
The ocean presently co-operates with the target .	AT NN RB VBZ IN AT NN .
Full knowledge of the science of oceanography can bring the environment to our side , resulting in an increase in effectiveness of equipment and tactics , a decrease in enemy capabilities , and the development of methods of capitalizing on the environment .	JJ NN IN AT NN IN NN MD VB AT NN IN PP$ NN , VBG IN AT NN IN NN IN NN CC NNS , AT NN IN NN NNS , CC AT NN IN NNS IN VBG IN AT NN .
Therefore , improved intelligence will result in reduced force requirements and , as it supports all other elements , rates a top priority .	RB , VBN NN MD VB IN VBN NN NNS CC , CS PPS VBZ ABN AP NNS , VBZ AT JJS NN .
Gathering intelligence is important , but of equal importance is its translation into usable form .	VBG NN BEZ JJ , CC IN JJ NN BEZ PP$ NN IN JJ NN .
A program is needed to translate the results of oceanographic research into tactical and operating instructions .	AT NN BEZ VBN TO VB AT NNS IN JJ NN IN JJ CC VBG NNS .
Approaching this problem on a statistical basis is invalid , because the opponent has the same sources available and will be encountered not under average conditions , but under the conditions most advantageous to him .	VBG DT NN IN AT JJ NN BEZ JJ , CS AT NN HVZ AT AP NNS JJ CC MD BE VBN * IN JJ NNS , CC IN AT NNS QL JJ IN PPO .
Therefore , the on-the-scene commander must have detailed operating instructions based on measurement of conditions , in the area , at the time of encounter .	RB , AT JJ NN MD HV VBN VBG NNS VBN IN NN IN NNS , IN AT NN , IN AT NN IN NN .
All capabilities must be used to maximum advantage then .	ABN NNS MD BE VBN IN JJ NN RB .
Temperature , wind , oxygen content , depth , bottom character , and animal life are the chief environmental variables .	NN , NN , NN NN , NN , NN NN , CC NN NN BER AT JJS JJ NNS .
There may be others .	EX MD BE NNS .
Variations in sound velocity should be measured rather than temperature , because more of the variables would be encompassed .	NNS IN NN NN MD BE VBN RB CS NN , CS AP IN AT NNS MD BE VBN .
These variations must eventually be measured horizontally as well as vertically .	DTS NNS MD RB BE VBN RB QL RB CS RB .
Progress in predicting water conditions is encouraging , but little guidance is available to the man at sea on the use of such information .	NN IN VBG NN NNS BEZ JJ , CC AP NN BEZ JJ IN AT NN IN NN IN AT NN IN JJ NN .
A concurrent effort is needed to make oceanographic data useful on the spot .	AT JJ NN BEZ VBN TO VB JJ NN JJ IN AT NN .
Mine warfare has in the past been directed against surface targets .	NN NN HVZ IN AT NN BEN VBN IN NN NNS .
By its nature it has always been of great psychological advantage and small efforts have required considerably greater counter-efforts .	IN PP$ NN PPS HVZ RB BEN IN JJ JJ NN CC JJ NNS HV VBN QL JJR NNS .
Mines are being increasingly oriented against submarine targets .	NNS BER BEG RB VBN IN JJ NNS .
They are still considered to be for use in restricted waters , however , and targets must come within a few yards of them .	PPSS BER RB VBN TO BE IN NN IN VBN NNS , RB , CC NNS MD VB IN AT AP NNS IN PPO .
Mines need to be recognized as a major element in anti-submarine warfare employment , extended to deep water , and have their effective area per unit increased .	NNS VB TO BE VBN CS AT JJ NN IN JJ NN NN , VBN IN JJ NN , CC HV PP$ JJ NN IN NN VBN .
Mines can be used to deny access to great areas ; ;	NNS MD BE VBN TO VB NN IN JJ NNS . .
they are difficult to counter , cost little to maintain until required , and can be put into place quickly .	PPSS BER JJ TO VB , VB AP TO VB CS VBN , CC MD BE VBN IN NN RB .
A most attractive feature is that detection and attack are combined in a single package .	AT QL JJ NN BEZ CS NN CC NN BER VBN IN AT AP NN .
Effective employment will reduce force requirements .	JJ NN MD VB NN NNS .
For example , effective mine barriers from Florida to Cuba and across the Yucatan Channel from Cuba to Mexico would remove all requirements for harbor defense , inshore patrol , convoy escort , shipping control , and mine defense for the entire Gulf of Mexico .	IN NN , JJ NN NNS IN NP IN NP CC IN AT NP-TL NN-TL IN NP IN NP MD VB ABN NNS IN NN NN , JJ NN , NN NN , VBG NN , CC NN NN IN AT JJ NN-TL IN-TL NP-TL .
More extended systems , covering all passage into the Caribbean , would free the Caribbean and the Gulf of Mexico from the previously listed requirements .	QL VBN NNS , VBG ABN NN IN AT NP , MD VB AT NP CC AT NN-TL IN-TL NP-TL IN AT RB VBN NNS .
Systems covering the Gulf of St. Lawrence and possibly the entire coasts of the United States are not impossible .	NNS VBG AT NN-TL IN-TL NP-TL NP-TL CC RB AT JJ NNS IN AT VBN-TL NNS-TL BER * JJ .
Such mine defense systems could permit concentration of mobile forces in the open oceans with consequent increase in the probability of success .	JJ NN NN NNS MD VB NN IN JJ NNS IN AT JJ NNS IN JJ NN IN AT NN IN NN .
The advantages inherent in mine warfare justify as great an importance for this element as is accorded any of the other elements .	AT NNS JJ IN NN NN VB QL JJ AT NN IN DT NN CS BEZ VBN DTI IN AT AP NNS .
Fixed installations are increasingly advocated as the problem of area defense emerges .	VBN NNS BER RB VBN CS AT NN IN NN NN VBZ .
The proponents are scientific and technical men who exercise considerable influence on their military counterparts .	AT NNS BER JJ CC JJ NNS WPS VB JJ NN IN PP$ JJ NNS .
Systems which detect submarines over wide areas are attractive , although they can be only `` burglar alarms '' .	NNS WDT VB NNS IN JJ NNS BER JJ , CS PPSS MD BE AP `` NN NNS '' .
Mobile forces are required to localize and attack detected targets , since the systems are not capable of pinpointing a target .	JJ NNS BER VBN TO VB CC VB VBN NNS , CS AT NNS BER * JJ IN VBG AT NN .
Such systems are expensive and are oriented geographically .	JJ NNS BER JJ CC BER VBN RB .
In an over-all ASW concept , dependence on and effort expended for such systems should be limited to those with proven capabilities .	IN AT JJ NN NN , NN IN CC NN VBN IN JJ NNS MD BE VBN IN DTS IN VBN NNS .
No general installation should be made until a model installation has been proved and its maximum capability determined .	AT JJ NN MD BE VBN CS AT NN NN HVZ BEN VBN CC PP$ JJ NN VBN .
In addition , proposals for fixed installations should be carefully weighed against a counterpart mobile system .	IN NN , NNS IN VBN NNS MD BE RB VBN IN AT NN JJ NN .
Fixed installations will always lack the flexibility that should be inherent in naval systems .	VBN NNS MD RB VB AT NN WPS MD BE JJ IN JJ NNS .
The submarine has become increasingly attractive as an antisubmarine weapon system .	AT NN HVZ VBN QL JJ CS AT JJ NN NN .
It operates in its target's environment , and any advantage gained therefrom by the target is shared by the attacker .	PPS VBZ IN PP$ NN$ NN , CC DTI NN VBN RB IN AT NN BEZ VBN IN AT NN .
But the submarine is a weapon of ambush and therefore always in danger of being ambushed .	CC AT NN BEZ AT NN IN NN CC RB RB IN NN IN BEG VBN .
Two metabolites ( 1 , and 2 ) ) of p-aminobenzoic acid ( PABA ) which act as cofactors for the hydroxylation of aniline by acid-fast bacteria are biosynthesized from Aj .	CD NNS ( CD , CC CD ) ) IN NN NN ( NP ) WDT VB CS NNS IN AT NN IN NN IN JJ NNS BER VBN IN NN .
The 7 carbons of PABA are incorporated directly into metabolite 2 ( ( as shown with both ring-labeled and carboxy-labeled Af ) .	AT CD NNS IN NN BER VBN RB IN NN CD ( ( CS VBN IN ABX JJ CC JJ NN ) .
Thirty-five of the 36 carbon atoms arise from Aj .	CD IN AT CD NN NNS VB IN NN .
All 28 carbons of metabolite 1 ( ( a product of mild acid hydrolysis of 2 ) arise from Aj .	ABN CD NNS IN NN CD ( ( AT NN IN JJ NN NN IN CD ) VB IN NN .
Metabolite 1 , isolated from the medium , however , showed a lower specific activity , which indicates endogenous synthesis of this metabolite .	NN CD , VBN IN AT NN , RB , VBD AT JJR JJ NN , WDT VBZ JJ NN IN DT NN .
Vigorous acid hydrolysis of metabolite 1 , destroyed the biological activity of the compound and liberated two aryl amines .	JJ NN NN IN NN CD , VBD AT JJ NN IN AT NN CC VBD CD NN NNS .
Fragment A has been obtained in crystalline form as a dioxalate salt and free base .	NN NN HVZ BEN VBN IN JJ NN CS AT NN NN CC JJ NN .
Preliminary evidence tentatively indicates that the molecule ( metabolite 1 ) ) is cleaved at a secondary amide bond .	JJ NN RB VBZ CS AT NN ( NN CD ) ) BEZ VBN IN AT JJ NN NN .

chemical studies are being pursued with the cooperation of K.G. Untch .	NN NNS BER BEG VBN IN AT NN IN NP NP .

-- Research on esterases in mammalian sera was continued .	-- NN IN NNS IN JJ NNS BEDZ VBN .
One of the most interesting findings was the extreme sensitivity of plasma arylesterases to rare earth ions .	CD IN AT QL JJ NNS BEDZ AT JJ NN IN NN NNS IN JJ NN NNS .
The inhibition of the enzyme by very low concentrations of lanthanum ion is probably the strongest known biological effect of rare earth salts .	AT NN IN AT NN IN QL JJ NNS IN NN NN BEZ RB AT JJT VBN JJ NN IN JJ NN NNS .
Various metal ions have been found to protect plasma arylesterase against inactivation by urea and guanidine .	AP NN NNS HV BEN VBN TO VB NN NN IN NN IN NN CC NN .
The effects can be related to the structure of this enzyme .	AT NNS MD BE VBN IN AT NN IN DT NN .
The non-identity of serum and red blood cell arylesterase was also established .	AT NN IN NN CC JJ NN NN NN BEDZ RB VBN .
Furthermore , the hydrolysis of paraoxon was studied in mammalian sera , and it was found that it is hydrolyzed by albumin ( or a factor attached to it ) in addition to arylesterase .	RB , AT NN IN NN BEDZ VBN IN JJ NNS , CC PPS BEDZ VBN CS PPS BEZ VBN IN NN ( CC AT NN VBN IN PPO ) IN NN IN NN .
Selective inhibitors can distinguish the two activities .	JJ NNS MD VB AT CD NNS .
Investigations on the acceleration of human plasma cholinesterase were carried further .	NNS IN AT NN IN JJ NN NN BED VBN RBR .
( E. G. Erdos , L. E. Boggs , C. D. Mackey ) biophysical studies on modified fibrous proteins	( NP NP NP , NP NP NP , NP NP NP ) JJ-HL NNS-HL IN-HL VBN-HL JJ-HL NNS-HL

( R. V. Rice )	( NP NP NP )
A method was devised for extracting and purifying soluble earthworm collagen ( EWC ) .	AT NN BEDZ VBN IN VBG CC VBG JJ NN NN ( NP ) .
It was observed that EWC macromolecules are the same diameter ( 15 a. ) but much longer ( up to several microns ) than vertebrate tropocollagen .	PPS BEDZ VBN CS NN NNS BER AT AP NN ( CD NNS ) CC QL JJR ( RP IN AP NNS ) CS NN NN .
This unusual collagen also was shown to undergo a reversible thermal phase transformation .	DT JJ NN RB BEDZ VBN TO VB AT JJ JJ NN NN .

and enzymes which terminate the action of peptides such as bradykinin and perhaps Substance Z were studied .	CC NNS WDT VB AT NN IN NNS JJ CS FW-NN CC RB NN-TL NP-TL BED VBN .

( E. G. Erdos , C. D. Mackey , A. G. Renfrew , W. B. Severs , E. M. Sloane ) seed proteins	( NP NP NP , NP NP NP , NP NP NP , NP NP NP , NP NP NP ) NN-HL NNS-HL

( E. F. Casassa , H. J. Notarius )	( NP NP NP , NP NP NP )
continuum mechanics and viscoelasticity	NN-HL NN-HL CC-HL NN-HL
theory of non-newtonian fluids	NN-HL IN-HL JJ-HL NNS-HL
-- On the basis of a differentiability assumption in function space , it is possible to prove that , for materials having the property that the stress is given by a functional of the history of the deformation gradients , the classical theory of infinitesimal viscoelasticity is valid when the deformation has been infinitesimal for all times in the past .	-- IN AT NN IN AT NN NN IN NN NN , PPS BEZ JJ TO VB CS , IN NNS HVG AT NN CS AT NN BEZ VBN IN AT NN IN AT NN IN AT NN NNS , AT JJ NN IN JJ NN BEZ JJ WRB AT NN HVZ BEN JJ IN ABN NNS IN AT NN .
By strengthening the differentiability assumption , it has been possible to derive second and higher order theories of viscoelasticity .	IN VBG AT NN NN , PPS HVZ BEN JJ TO VB OD CC JJR NN NNS IN NN .
In the second-order theory , one of the normal stress differences can be calculated from the first-order stress relaxation function .	IN AT NN NN , CD IN AT JJ NN NNS MD BE VBN IN AT NN NN NN NN .
( B. D. Coleman with Walter Noll , Department of Mathematics , Carnegie Institute of Technology ) viscoelastic measurements	( NP NP NP IN NP NP , NN-TL IN-TL NN-TL , NP-TL NN-TL IN-TL NN-TL ) JJ-HL NNS-HL
-- An extensive series of measurements was made on a high-density polyethylene in a torsion pendulum instrument using forced sinusoidal oscillation , free vibration , and creep measurements over the temperature range of Af to 80-degrees-C .	-- AT JJ NN IN NNS BEDZ VBN IN AT NN NN IN AT NN NN NN VBG VBN JJ NN , JJ NN , CC NN NNS IN AT NN NN IN NN IN NNS .
As many as seven decades of the time scale were thus covered isothermally .	QL AP CS CD NNS IN AT NN NN BED RB VBN RB .
The simple time-temperature equivalence valid for many amorphous systems did not hold here .	AT JJ NN NN JJ IN AP JJ NNS DOD * VB RB .
It was possible , however , to decompose the compliance into a sum of a frequency-independent component and two viscoelastic mechanisms , each compatible with the Boltzmann superposition principle and with a consistent set of time-temperature equivalence factors .	PPS BEDZ JJ , RB , TO VB AT NN IN AT NN IN AT JJ NN CC CD JJ NNS , DT JJ IN AT NP NN NN CC IN AT JJ NN IN NN NN NNS .
( Hershel Markovitz , D.J. Plazek , Haruo Nakayasu )	( NP NP , NP NP , NP NP )
geochemistry	NN-HL
trace elements in tektites , meteorites , and related materials	NN-HL NNS-HL IN-HL NNS-HL ,-HL NNS-HL ,-HL CC-HL VBN-HL NNS-HL
-- The results of microanalysis of tektites ( natural glasses of unknown origin ) for gallium and germanium have shown that these glasses are probably produced from terrestrial ( or less likely from lunar ) matter by impact of a celestial body .	-- AT NNS IN NN IN NNS ( JJ NNS IN JJ NN ) IN NN CC NN HV VBN CS DTS NNS BER RB VBN IN JJ ( CC QL JJ IN JJ ) NN IN NN IN AT JJ NN .
The gallium / germanium ratio is higher than that for ordinary igneous , metamorphic , or sedimentary matter as a result of selective volatilization of the components of the tektite .	AT NN IN NN NN BEZ JJR CS DT IN JJ JJ , JJ , CC JJ NN CS AT NN IN JJ NN IN AT NNS IN AT NN .
Gallium oxide is less volatile than silica ( the main constituent of tektites ) and germanium oxide is more volatile .	NN NN BEZ QL JJ CS NN ( AT JJS NN IN NNS ) CC NN NN BEZ QL JJ .
Australites ( tektites from Australia ) give the appearance of a second melting .	NNS ( NNS IN NP ) VB AT NN IN AT OD NN .
In conformity with this conclusion a higher trace gallium content was found in the portion ( flange ) that has undergone a second melting .	IN NN IN DT NN AT JJR NN NN NN BEDZ VBN IN AT NN ( NN ) WPS HVZ VBN AT OD NN .
The silicate fractions of stony meteorites show gallium / germanium ratios similar to those of tektites because they too have undergone melting at some point in their histories .	AT JJ NNS IN JJ NNS VB NN IN NN NNS JJ IN DTS IN NNS CS PPSS RB HV VBN VBG IN DTI NN IN PP$ NNS .
Libyan Desert silica-glass , another natural glass , is composed of nearly pure silica and has the same trace germanium content as sands in the area .	NP-TL NN-TL NN , DT JJ NN , BEZ VBN IN QL JJ NN CC HVZ AT AP NN NN NN CS NNS IN AT NN .
The gallium content , however , has been enhanced five-fold .	AT NN NN , RB , HVZ BEN VBN RB .
This glass is probably formed from Libyan Desert sands by comet or stony-meteorite impact .	DT NN BEZ RB VBN IN NP-TL NN-TL NNS IN NN CC NN NN .
Nickel-iron meteorites with sufficient kinetic energy to produce large terrestrial explosion craters may nevertheless melt only small quantities of material .	NN NNS IN JJ JJ NN TO VB JJ JJ NN NNS MD RB VB AP JJ NNS IN NN .
Most of the impact energy is spent in crushing and fragmentation .	AP IN AT NN NN BEZ VBN IN VBG CC NN .
When rapid quenching follows melting , impact glasses may result .	WRB JJ NN VBZ VBG , NN NNS MD VB .
These always contain metallic inclusions .	DTS RB VB JJ NNS .
Impact glasses not containing elemental nickel-iron may have been produced by stony meteorites or comets .	NN NNS * VBG JJ NN MD HV BEN VBN IN JJ NNS CC NNS .
No meteorites have ever been recovered from paleoexplosion craters , and recent craters containing impact glass have all been produced by metallic meteorites with the exception of Aouelloul crater , Adrar , Western Sahara Desert .	AT NNS HV RB BEN VBN IN NN NNS , CC JJ NNS VBG NN NN HV ABN BEN VBN IN JJ NNS IN AT NN IN NP NN , NP , JJ-TL NP-TL NN-TL .
This crater contains impact glass with no metallic inclusions and no meteoritic material has been recovered .	DT NN VBZ NN NN IN AT JJ NNS CC AT JJ NN HVZ BEN VBN .
( A. J. Cohen , John Anania )	( NP NP NP , NP NP )
inorganic chemistry	JJ-HL NN-HL
Preparation of a coordination compound is often accomplished by the simple method of reacting a metal salt with a ligand in a suitable solvent such as an alcohol .	NN IN AT NN NN BEZ RB VBN IN AT JJ NN IN VBG AT NN NN IN AT NN IN AT JJ NN JJ CS AT NN .
By applying this general principle , a great number of complex compounds of osmium , ruthenium , iridium , and rhenium , with triphenylphosphine , triphenylarsine , and triphenylstibine have been obtained in this laboratory during the past few years .	IN VBG DT JJ NN , AT JJ NN IN JJ NNS IN NN , NN , NN , CC NN , IN NN , NN , CC NN HV BEN VBN IN DT NN IN AT AP AP NNS .
( Lauri Vaska , E. M. Sloane , J. W. DiLuzio ) In the absence of direct evidence to the contrary , decomposition of solvent alcohol and coordination of its fragments to the metal were not considered , following the above heretofore-accepted assumption in preparative coordination chemistry .	( NP NP , NP NP NP , NP NP NP ) IN AT NN IN JJ NN IN AT JJ , NN IN NN NN CC NN IN PP$ NNS IN AT NN BED * VBN , IN AT JJ JJ NN IN JJ NN NN .
Recent work with radiocarbon and deuterated alcohols as solvents , however , has given evidence that metal-hydrido and carbonyl complexes may be readily formed by reaction with alcohol in some of these systems .	JJ NN IN NN CC VBN NNS CS NNS , RB , HVZ VBN NN CS NN CC NN NNS MD BE RB VBN IN NN IN NN IN DTI IN DTS NNS .
Some of the previously reported compounds have thus been reformulated and a series of new hydrido and carbonyl compounds discovered , the more representative examples being Af , Af , Af , Af and Af ( Af ) .	DTI IN AT RB VBN NNS HV RB BEN VBN CC AT NN IN JJ NN CC NN NNS VBN , AT QL JJ NNS BEG NN , NN , NN , NN CC NN ( NN ) .
The coordination complexes formed by transition metals with primary and secondary phosphines and arsines are being investigated ( R. G. Hayter ) .	AT NN NNS VBN IN NN NNS IN JJ CC JJ NNS CC NNS BER BEG VBN ( NP NP NP ) .
Particular interest is directed towards the condensation of these ligands with metal halides to form substituted phosphide or arside complexes .	JJ NN BEZ VBN IN AT NN IN DTS NNS IN NN NNS TO VB VBN NN CC NN NNS .
During the past year , these ligands have yielded some unusual five-coordinate complexes of nickel ( 2 ) and some interesting binuclear phosphorus-bridged complexes of palladium ( 2 ) ( see figure ) , as well as new compounds of the well-known type Af .	IN AT JJ NN , DTS NNS HV VBN DTI JJ JJ NNS IN NN ( CD ) CC DTI JJ JJ JJ NNS IN NN ( CD ) ( VB NN ) , QL RB CS JJ NNS IN AT JJ NN NN .
The structures , properties , and reactions of these compounds are being studied .	AT NNS , NNS , CC NNS IN DTS NNS BER BEG VBN .
In another study chromium-substituted aluminum oxyhydroxides and related species , prepared homogeneously by high-temperature hydrolysis , are being characterized and investigated spectrally in the ultraviolet region with a view to identification and semiquantitative estimation of the phases formed under varying preparative conditions .
