structure and properties of macromolecules	NN-HL CC-HL NNS-HL IN-HL NNS-HL
elasticity of macromolecular networks	NN-HL IN-HL JJ-HL NNS-HL
-- The theory of elasticity of Gaussian networks has been developed on a more general basis and the equations of state relating variables of pressure , volume , temperature , stress and strain have been precisely formulated .	-- AT NN IN NN IN JJ NNS HVZ BEN VBN IN AT QL JJ NN CC AT NNS IN NN VBG NNS IN NN , NN , NN , NN CC NN HV BEN RB VBN .
Simple elongation has been treated in detail .	JJ NN HVZ BEN VBN IN NN .
The various stress-temperature coefficients for constancy of volume and strain , constancy of pressure and strain , and constancy of pressure and length have been interrelated .	AT AP NN NNS IN NN IN NN CC NN , NN IN NN CC NN , CC NN IN NN CC NN HV BEN VBN .
The dilation accompanying elongation and the simultaneously developed anisotropy of compressibility have been related to the elongation .	AT NN VBG NN CC AT RB VBN NN IN NN HV BEN VBN IN AT NN .
In continuation of these theoretical studies , a more precise elucidation of the effects of imperfections in network structure is sought .	IN NN IN DTS JJ NNS , AT QL JJ NN IN AT NNS IN NNS IN NN NN BEZ VBN .
( P. J. Flory , C. A. J. Hoeve ) chain conformations of polymeric chains	( NP NP NP , NP NP NP NP ) NN-HL NNS-HL IN-HL JJ-HL NNS-HL
-- Recent theoretical work to calculate the dimensions of polymeric chains by Volkenstein and Lifson has been extended to include more general types of chains .	-- JJ JJ NN TO VB AT NNS IN JJ NNS IN NP CC NP HVZ BEN VBN TO VB QL JJ NNS IN NNS .
The mean-square end-to-end distance of the polyisobutylene chain has been calculated in reasonable agreement with values deduced from viscosity data .	AT NN JJ NN IN AT NN NN HVZ BEN VBN IN JJ NN IN NNS VBN IN NN NN .
These studies are being extended to different polymers to increase our knowledge about the hindrances to rotation around chain bonds .	DTS NNS BER BEG VBN IN JJ NNS TO VB PP$ NN IN AT NNS IN NN IN NN NNS .
( C. A. J. Hoeve , A. A. Blumberg ) crystallization in polymers and copolymers	( NP NP NP NP , NP NP NP ) NN-HL IN-HL NNS-HL CC-HL NNS-HL
-- The crystallization of copolymers comprising Af units interspersed with a minor percentage of Af is limited by the inability of the crystal lattice characteristic of the former to accommodate the bulky side group of the latter .	-- AT NN IN NNS VBG NN NNS VBN IN AT JJ NN IN NN BEZ VBN IN AT NN IN AT NN NN NN IN AT AP TO VB AT JJ NN NN IN AT AP .
Only uninterrupted sequences of the former are eligible for formation of crystallites .	AP JJ NNS IN AT AP BER JJ IN NN IN NNS .
Limitations on the lengths of these sequences diminish the stability of the comparatively short crystallites which can be formed , and this is reflected in a broadening of the melting range .	NNS IN AT NNS IN DTS NNS VB AT NN IN AT QL JJ NNS WDT MD BE VBN , CC DT BEZ VBN IN AT VBG IN AT VBG NN .
( Robert Chiang , J. B. Jackson , P. J. Flory ) Carefully executed melting studies on this system ( M. J. Richardson ) permit quantitative estimation of the instability engendered by reduced crystallite length .	( NP NP , NP NP NP , NP NP NP ) RB VBN VBG NNS IN DT NN ( NP NP NP ) VB JJ NN IN AT NN VBN IN VBN NN NN .
The complex morphology of polycrystalline homopolymers is necessarily dependent on the same factor .	AT JJ NN IN JJ NNS BEZ RB JJ IN AT AP NN .
Hence , the present studies offer a possible basis for interpretations in the latter field .	RB , AT JJ NNS VB AT JJ NN IN NNS IN AT AP NN .
Contraction of muscle	NN-HL IN-HL NN-HL
-- Glycerinated muscle , in the presence of the physiological agent ( ATP ) responsible for delivering energy to the mechanochemically active proteins of muscle , has been shown to undergo a contraction which is highly sensitive both to temperature and to solvent composition in mixtures of alcohols and water .	-- VBN NN , IN AT NN IN AT JJ NN ( NP ) JJ IN VBG NN IN AT RB JJ NNS IN NN , HVZ BEN VBN TO VB AT NN WDT BEZ QL JJ ABX IN NN CC IN NN NN IN NNS IN NNS CC NN .
Experiments carried out over long periods of time in order to allow establishment of a steady state have shown that the onset of contraction and its completion are confined to an interval of several degrees Centigrade and to a concentration range of only several per cent .	NNS VBN RP IN JJ NNS IN NN IN NN TO VB NN IN AT JJ NN HV VBN CS AT NN IN NN CC PP$ NN BER VBN IN AT NN IN AP NNS NP CC IN AT NN NN IN RB AP IN NN .
The contraction therefore partakes of the character of a phase transition .	AT NN RB VBZ IN AT NN IN AT NN NN .
While ATP appears to be necessary for the occurrence of contraction , its presence and enzymatic hydrolysis of it by the muscle protein myosin are not the only criteria for contraction .	CS NN VBZ TO BE JJ IN AT NN IN NN , PP$ NN CC JJ NN IN PPO IN AT NN NN NN BER * AT AP NNS IN NN .
( C. A. J. Hoeve , P. J. Flory ) anionic Polymerization	( NP NP NP NP , NP NP NP ) JJ-HL NN-HL
-- One of the principal aims of anionic polymerization techniques is the synthesis of polymers of extremely narrow molecular weight distribution .	-- CD IN AT JJS NNS IN JJ NN NNS BEZ AT NN IN NNS IN QL JJ JJ NN NN .
A simple process for the preparation of nearly monodisperse polystyrene of predictable molecular weight has been developed .	AT JJ NN IN AT NN IN QL JJ NN IN JJ JJ NN HVZ BEN VBN .
The preparation of such products is not new , but the systems heretofore employed in polymerizations have commanded considerable experimental skill and starting materials of a high purity .	AT NN IN JJ NNS BEZ * JJ , CC AT NNS RB VBN IN NNS HV VBN JJ JJ NN CC VBG NNS IN AT JJ NN .
In the new process impurities present in the solvent ( benzene ) , the monomer , and in the reaction system which would cause deactivation of propagation centers , are rendered inactive prior to polymerization by gradual addition of initiator , a mixture of butyl-lithium and telomeric styryl-lithium , at a temperature low enough to suppress chain growth .	IN AT JJ NN NNS RB IN AT NN ( NN ) , AT NN , CC IN AT NN NN WDT MD VB NN IN NN NNS , BER VBN JJ RB IN NN IN JJ NN IN NN , AT NN IN NN CC JJ NN , IN AT NN JJ QLP TO VB NN NN .
Upon completion of the purging step , additional initiator appropriate for the molecular weight of the sample desired is added , and the system is then warmed to the polymerization temperature , at which the reaction is allowed to go to completion .	IN NN IN AT VBG NN , JJ NN JJ IN AT JJ NN IN AT NN VBN BEZ VBN , CC AT NN BEZ RB VBN IN AT NN NN , IN WDT AT NN BEZ VBN TO VB IN NN .
The predictability of the molecular weights was found to be within 10% for the polymers prepared , with Af ratios less than 1.1 .	AT NN IN AT JJ NNS BEDZ VBN TO BE IN NN IN AT NNS VBN , IN NN NNS AP IN CD .
Contrary to observations with ethers , no apparent change of the reactivity of the chain ends takes place over considerable periods of time in benzene as solvent .	JJ IN NNS IN NNS , AT JJ NN IN AT NN IN AT NN NNS VBZ NN IN JJ NNS IN NN IN NN CS NN .
Organization :	NN-HL :
In this publication measurements of interfacial angles of crystals are used to classify and identify chemical substances .	IN DT NN NNS IN JJ NNS IN NNS BER VBN TO VB CC VB NN NNS .
T. V. Barker , who developed the classification-angle system , was about to begin the systematic compilation of the index when he died in 1931 .	NP NP NP , WPS VBD AT NN NN , BEDZ RB TO VB AT JJ NN IN AT NN WRB PPS VBD IN CD .
The compilation work was undertaken by a number of interested crystallographers in the Department of Mineralogy of the University Museum at Oxford .	AT NN NN BEDZ VBN IN AT NN IN VBN NNS IN AT NN-TL IN-TL NN-TL IN AT NN-TL NN-TL IN NP .
Since 1948 the working headquarters has been the Department of Geology and Mineralogy .	IN CD AT VBG NN HVZ BEN AT NN-TL IN-TL NN-TL CC-TL NN-TL .
Numerous cooperating individuals in Great Britain , Holland , the United States , and Belgium have contributed editorially or by making calculations .	JJ VBG NNS IN JJ-TL NP-TL , NP , AT VBN-TL NNS-TL , CC NP HV VBN RB CC IN VBG NNS .
Great interest and practical help have been given by the Barker Index Committee .	JJ NN CC JJ NN HV BEN VBN IN AT NP-TL NN-TL NN-TL .
Financial and material help have come from academic , governmental , and industrial organizations in England and Holland .	JJ CC NN NN HV VBN IN JJ , JJ , CC JJ NNS IN NP CC NP .
Editors for Volumes 1 , and 2 , were M. W. Porter and the late R. C. Spiller , both of Oxford University .	NNS IN NNS-TL CD , CC CD , BED NP NP NP CC AT JJ NP NP NP , ABX IN NP-TL NN-TL .
A third volume remains to be published .	AT OD NN VBZ TO BE VBN .
Substances :	NNS-HL :

and Volume 2 , , with about 3500 monoclinic substances .	CC NN-TL CD-TL , , IN RB CD JJ NNS .

Properties :	NNS-HL :
The Barker system is based on the use of the smallest number of interfacial angles necessary for indexing purposes .	AT NP NN BEZ VBN IN AT NN IN AT JJT NN IN JJ NNS JJ IN VBG NNS .
Other morphological , physical , and optical property values are also given .	AP JJ , JJ , CC JJ NN NNS BER RB VBN .

Most of the data used are from Groth's Chemische Krystallographie .	AP IN AT NNS VBN BER IN NP$ FW-JJ-TL FW-NN-TL .

Dana's System Of Mineralogy	NP$ NN-TL IN-TL NN-TL
organization :	NN-TL :
Six editions of James Dwight Dana's System appeared between 1837 and 1892 .	CD NNS IN NP NP NP$ NN-TL VBD IN CD CC CD .
In 1915 Edward S. Dana , editor of the sixth edition , asked W. E. Ford of Yale University to prepare a seventh edition of his father's work .	IN CD NP NP NP , NN IN AT OD NN , VBD NP NP NP IN NP-TL NN-TL TO VB AT OD NN IN PP$ NN$ NN .
A number of people became involved in the preparation but work was slow until 1937 .	AT NN IN NNS VBD VBN IN AT NN CC NN BEDZ JJ IN CD .
In that year a grant was obtained from the Penrose Fund of the Geological Society of America to finance additional full-time workers .	IN DT NN AT NN BEDZ VBN IN AT NP-TL NN-TL IN AT JJ-TL NN-TL IN-TL NP-TL TO VB JJ JJ NNS .
Money was also advanced by the publishers , John Wiley & Sons , Inc. .	NN BEDZ RB VBN IN AT NNS , NP-TL NP-TL CC-TL NNS-TL , VBN-TL .
Volume 1 , was completed in 1941 and published in 1944 .	NN-TL CD-TL , BEDZ VBN IN CD CC VBN IN CD .
The editors of this volume and Volume 2 , were the late Charles Palache , Clifford Frondel , and the late Harry Berman , all of Harvard University .	AT NNS IN DT NN CC NN-TL CD-TL , BED AT JJ NP NP , NP NP , CC AT JJ NP NP , ABN IN NP-TL NN-TL .
Work on Volume 2 , was begun in 1941 , interrupted by the war in 1942 , and resumed in 1945 .	NN IN NN-TL CD-TL , BEDZ VBN IN CD , VBN IN AT NN IN CD , CC VBN IN CD .
The volume was completed in 1950 and published in 1951 .	AT NN BEDZ VBN IN CD CC VBN IN CD .
A supplementary grant from the Geological Society of America helped finance its publication .	AT JJ NN IN AT JJ-TL NN-TL IN-TL NP-TL VBD VB PP$ NN .

W. E. Ford , for example , continued to supply data on the occurrence of minerals until his death in 1939 .	NP NP NP , IN NN , VBD TO VB NNS IN AT NN IN NNS IN PP$ NN IN CD .

The Groth Institute	AT NP-TL NN-TL
organization :	NN-HL :
`` The Groth Institute '' , which was established in 1958 , is a group activity affiliated with the Physics Department of The Pennsylvania State University , University Park , Pa. .	`` AT NP-TL NN-TL '' , WDT BEDZ VBN IN CD , BEZ AT NN NN VBN IN AT NN-TL NN-TL IN AT-TL NP-TL NN-TL NN-TL , NN-TL NN-TL , NP .
Ray Pepinsky is the Director .	NP NP BEZ AT NN-TL .
The Institute derives its name from Paul Von Groth's Chemische Krystallographie , a five-volume work which appeared between 1906 and 1919 .	AT NN-TL VBZ PP$ NN IN NP NP NP$ FW-JJ-TL FW-NN-TL , AT JJ NN WDT VBD IN CD CC CD .
The resident staff is large and consists of professional assistants , graduate students , abstractors , librarian , technical editor , machine operators , secretarial help , and others .	AT JJ NN BEZ JJ CC VBZ IN JJ NNS , NN NNS , NNS , NN , JJ NN , NN NNS , JJ NN , CC NNS .
There are also corresponding members and outside advisory groups .	EX BER RB VBG NNS CC JJ JJ NNS .
The Air Force Office of Scientific Research has provided financial assistance in the early stages of the Institute's program .	AT NN-TL NN-TL NN-TL IN-TL JJ-TL NN-TL HVZ VBN JJ NN IN AT JJ NNS IN AT NN$-TL NN .
Substances :	NNS-HL :
All crystalline substances and other solid-state materials .	ABN JJ NNS CC AP NN NNS .
Properties :	NNS-HL :
The aim is to collect a very broad range of physical , chemical , morphological , and structural data for crystals on an encyclopedic scale and to seek all possible useful and revealing correlations of properties with internal structure .	AT NN BEZ TO VB AT QL JJ NN IN JJ , NN , JJ , CC JJ NNS IN NNS IN AT JJ NN CC TO VB ABN JJ JJ CC VBG NNS IN NNS IN JJ NN .
Sources of data :	NNS-HL IN-HL NNS-HL :
The first stage of operation has centered on the literature imaging of critical or summarizing tabulations such as the Barker Index .	AT OD NN IN NN HVZ VBN IN AT NN NN IN JJ CC VBG NNS JJ CS AT NP-TL NN-TL .
Coverage of primary literature will follow .	NN IN JJ NN MD VB .
Unpublished data will be available to the Groth institute from cooperating groups and individuals .	JJ NNS MD BE JJ IN AT NP NN IN VBG NNS CC NNS .
Criticality :	NN-HL :
Critical evaluation of all data compiled is not a primary aim of this project .	JJ NN IN ABN NNS VBN BEZ * AT JJ NN IN DT NN .
However , the proposed correlation of the many interrelated properties of crystals will reveal discrepancies in the recorded data and suggest areas for reinvestigation .	RB , AT VBN NN IN AT AP VBN NNS IN NNS MD VB NNS IN AT VBN NNS CC VB NNS IN NN .
In addition , the availability of computers will permit recalculation and refinement of much structural information .	IN NN , AT NN IN NNS MD VB NN CC NN IN AP JJ NN .
Use of nomenclature , symbols , units , physical constants :	NN-HL IN-HL NN-HL ,-HL NNS-HL ,-HL NNS-HL ,-HL JJ-HL NNS-HL :
For punched-card or tape storage of information all literature values must be conformed to a common language .	IN NN CC NN NN IN NN ABN NN NNS MD BE VBN IN AT JJ NN .
In this way a degree of unification of nomenclature , symbols , and units will be realized .	IN DT NN AT NN IN NN IN NN , NNS , CC NNS MD BE VBN .
Because individual classes of foods differ in their requirements for preservation , a number of methods have been developed over the years involving one or a combination of procedures such as dehydration , fermentation , salting , chemical treatment , canning , refrigeration , and freezing .	CS JJ NNS IN NNS VB IN PP$ NNS IN NN , AT NN IN NNS HV BEN VBN IN AT NNS VBG CD CC AT NN IN NNS JJ CS NN , NN , VBG , NN NN , VBG , NN , CC VBG .
The basic objectives in each instance are to make available supplies of food during the intervals between harvesting or slaughter , to minimize losses resulting from the action of microorganisms and insects , and to make it possible to transport foods from the area of harvest or production to areas of consumption .	AT JJ NNS IN DT NN BER TO VB JJ NNS IN NN IN AT NNS IN VBG CC NN , TO VB NNS VBG IN AT NN IN NNS CC NNS , CC TO VB PPO JJ TO VB NNS IN AT NN IN NN CC NN IN NNS IN NN .
In earlier years , the preservation of food was essentially related to survival .	IN JJR NNS , AT NN IN NN BEDZ RB VBN IN NN .
In the more sophisticated atmosphere of today's developed nations , food-preservation techniques have sought also to bring variety , peak freshness , and optimum taste and flavor in foods at reasonable cost to the consumer .	IN AT QL JJ NN IN NR$ VBN NNS , NN NNS HV VBN RB TO VB NN , NN NN , CC JJ NN CC NN IN NNS IN JJ NN IN AT NN .
With the development of nuclear technology , isotopic materials , and machine radiation sources in recent years , the possibilities of applying ionizing radiation to the preservation of foods attracted the attention of investigators in the United States and throughout the world .	IN AT NN IN JJ NN , JJ NNS , CC NN NN NNS IN JJ NNS , AT NNS IN VBG VBG NN IN AT NN IN NNS VBD AT NN IN NNS IN AT VBN-TL NNS-TL CC IN AT NN .
An early hope that irradiation might be the ultimate answer to practically all food preservation problems was soon dispelled .	AT JJ NN CS NN MD BE AT JJ NN IN RB ABN NN NN NNS BEDZ RB VBN .
Interest remained , however , in the possibility that it would serve as a useful supplementary method for counteracting spoilage losses and for preserving some foods at lower over-all costs than freezing , or without employing heat or chemicals with their attendant taste alterations .	NN VBD , RB , IN AT NN CS PPS MD VB CS AT JJ JJ NN IN VBG NN NNS CC IN VBG DTI NNS IN JJR JJ NNS CS VBG , CC IN VBG NN CC NNS IN PP$ JJ NN NNS .
Factors responsible for the spoilage of foods	NNS-HL JJ-HL IN-HL AT-HL NN-HL IN-HL NNS-HL
The chief factors responsible for the spoilage of fresh foodstuffs are ( 1 ) microorganisms such as bacteria , molds , and yeasts , ( 2 ) enzymes , ( 3 ) insects , ( 4 ) sprouting , and ( 5 ) chemical reactions .	AT JJS NNS JJ IN AT NN IN JJ NNS BER ( CD ) NNS JJ CS NNS , NNS , CC NNS , ( CD ) NNS , ( CD ) NNS , ( CD ) VBG , CC ( CD ) NN NNS .
Microorganisms are often responsible for the rapid spoilage of foods .	NNS BER RB JJ IN AT JJ NN IN NNS .
Of special concern is the growth of bacteria such as Clostridium botulinum which generate poisonous products .	IN JJ NN BEZ AT NN IN NNS JJ CS NP NP WDT VB JJ NNS .
Enzymatic action in stored food produces changes which can adversely affect the appearance of food or its palatability .	JJ NN IN VBN NN VBZ NNS WDT MD RB VB AT NN IN NN CC PP$ NN .
Spoilage by chemical action results from the reaction of one group of components in the food with others or with its environment , as in corrosion of the walls of metal containers or the reaction of fats with oxygen in the air to produce rancidity .	NN IN NN NN VBZ IN AT NN IN CD NN IN NNS IN AT NN IN NNS CC IN PP$ NN , CS IN NN IN AT NNS IN NN NNS CC AT NN IN NNS IN NN IN AT NN TO VB NN .
Sprouting is a naturally occurring phenomenon in stored potatoes , onions , carrots , beets , and similar root vegetables .	VBG BEZ AT RB VBG NN IN VBN NNS , NNS , NNS , NNS , CC JJ NN NNS .
Insect infestation is a problem of importance chiefly in stored grain .	NN NN BEZ AT NN IN NN RB IN VBN NN .
The presence of parasitic organisms such as Trichinella spiralis in pork introduces another factor which must be dealt with in food processing .	AT NN IN JJ NNS JJ CS NP NP IN NN VBZ DT NN WDT MD BE VBN IN IN NN NN .
To permit the storage of food for long periods of time , a method of preservation must accomplish the destruction of microorganisms and inhibition of enzymatic action .	TO VB AT NN IN NN IN JJ NNS IN NN , AT NN IN NN MD VB AT NN IN NNS CC NN IN JJ NN .
The term `` sterilization '' applies to methods involving essentially complete destruction of all microorganisms .	AT NN `` NN-NC '' VBZ IN NNS VBG QL JJ NN IN ABN NNS .
Food treated in this manner and protected from recontamination by aseptic methods of packaging and containment presumably could be stored for long periods without refrigeration .	NN VBN IN DT NN CC VBN IN NN IN JJ NNS IN VBG CC NN RB MD BE VBN IN JJ NNS IN NN .
The process of `` pasteurization '' involves milder and less prolonged heat treatment which accomplishes the destruction of most , but not all , of the microorganisms .	AT NN IN `` NN '' VBZ JJR CC QL VBN NN NN WDT VBZ AT NN IN AP , CC * ABN , IN AT NNS .
Less severe thermal treatment as by blanching or scalding serves to inactivate enzymes .	QL JJ JJ NN CS IN VBG CC VBG VBZ TO VB NNS .
General effects of ionizing radiation	JJ-HL NNS-HL IN-HL VBG-HL NN-HL
Ionizing radiation can cause the destruction of microorganisms and insects involved in food spoilage or , at lower doses , can inhibit their action .	VBG NN MD VB AT NN IN NNS CC NNS VBN IN NN NN CC , IN JJR NNS , MD VB PP$ NN .
It furnishes a means of destroying insects in stored grain products as well as certain parasitic organisms present in meats .	PPS VBZ AT NN IN VBG NNS IN VBN NN NNS QL RB CS AP JJ NNS RB IN NNS .
Deactivation of enzymes is also possible , although some types require extremely heavy doses of 10 Mrad or more .	NN IN NNS BEZ RB JJ , CS DTI NNS VB QL JJ NNS IN CD NN CC AP .
Because of undesirable flavors , odors , colors , and generally low palatability associated with radiation treatment of this magnitude , the inactivation of enzymes is best accomplished prior to irradiation by the conventional heat-processing methods of blanching .	RB IN JJ NNS , NNS , NNS , CC RB JJ NN VBN IN NN NN IN DT NN , AT NN IN NNS BEZ RBT VBN RB IN NN IN AT JJ JJ NNS IN VBG .
Radiation does not retard the chemical spoilage of food .	NN DOZ * VB AT NN NN IN NN .
It will , however , inhibit the sprouting of potatoes and other root vegetables .	PPS MD , RB , VB AT NN IN NNS CC AP NN NNS .
The radiation doses required for the preservation of foods are in the following ranges : 1 .	AT NN NNS VBN IN AT NN IN NNS BER IN AT VBG NNS : CD-HL .-HL
For radiosterilization , to destroy all organisms for long-term preservation -- about 4.5 Mrad for nonacid foods of low salt content .	IN NN , TO VB ABN NNS IN NN NN -- RB CD NN IN JJ NNS IN JJ NN NN .
2 .	CD-HL .-HL
For radiopasteurization , to partially destroy microorganisms ; ;	IN NN , TO RB VB NNS . .
results vary with types of food , storage conditions , and objectives of treatment -- commonly of the order of 0.2 Mrads but up to about 0.8 Aj .	NNS VB IN NNS IN NN , NN NNS , CC NNS IN NN -- RB IN AT NN IN CD NN CC RP IN RB CD NN .
3 .	CD-HL .-HL
For destruction of insects -- about 25,000 Aj .	IN NN IN NNS -- RB CD NN .
4 .	CD .
For inhibiting the sprouting of root vegetables -- 4,000 to 10,000 Aj .	IN VBG AT NN IN NN NNS -- CD IN CD NN .
Preserving foods with ionizing radiation leads to some undesirable side effects , particularly at the higher radiation dosages .	VBG NNS IN VBG NN VBZ IN DTI JJ NN NNS , RB IN AT JJR NN NNS .
In this respect , the general palatability and individual acceptance of most radiosterilized foods has , to date , been found to be low in comparison with fresh and commercially processed foods .	IN DT NN , AT JJ NN CC JJ NN IN AP VBN NNS HVZ , TO VB , BEN VBN TO BE JJ IN NN IN JJ CC RB VBN NNS .
A number of foods are quite acceptable as regards taste and palatability , however , at dosages substantially less than sterilization levels .	AT NN IN NNS BER QL JJ CS VBZ NN CC NN , RB , IN NNS RB AP CS NN NNS .
Moreover , the nutritive value of irradiated foods apparently undergoes little , if any , change , although some of the fat-soluble vitamins are affected by sterilization doses .	RB , AT JJ NN IN VBN NNS RB VBZ AP , CS DTI , NN , CS DTI IN AT JJ NNS BER VBN IN NN NNS .
Radiation sources	NN-HL NNS-HL
For irradiation of food , the results obtained depend upon the dose rather than the specific type of radiation , and X-ray , gamma , and high-energy electron radiation are suitable .	IN NN IN NN , AT NNS VBN VB IN AT NN RB CS AT JJ NN IN NN , CC NN-TL , NN , CC NN NN NN BER JJ .
Aside from availability and economic considerations , each has certain practical advantages ; ;	RB IN NN CC JJ NNS , DT HVZ AP JJ NNS . .
for example , gamma rays give deeper penetration but cannot be focused or collimated , whereas unidirectional electron beams may be split and directed to both the top and bottom of the food package to be irradiated .	IN NN , NN NNS VB JJR NN CC MD* BE VBN CC VBN , CS JJ NN NNS MD BE VBN CC VBN IN ABX AT NN CC NN IN AT NN NN TO BE VBN .
Selection of a source for commercial irradiation would involve consideration of numerous factors including required dose rate , load factor , throughput , convenience , safety , and most important , costs .	NN IN AT NN IN JJ NN MD VB NN IN JJ NNS IN VBN NN NN , NN NN , NN , NN , NN , CC QL JJ , NNS .
Of the potentially useful sources of ionizing radiations , gamma sources , cobalt-60 , cesium-137 , fission products , or a reactor irradiation loop system using a material such as an indium salt have received most attention for food-preservation systems .	IN AT RB JJ NNS IN VBG NNS , NN NNS , NN , NN , NN NNS , CC AT NN NN NN NN VBG AT NN JJ CS AT NN NN HV VBN AP NN IN NN NNS .
Of the various particle accelerators , the Van De Graff machines , resonant transformers , and linear accelerators are the principal ones available for commercial use .	IN AT AP NN NNS , AT NP NP NP NNS , JJ NNS , CC JJ NNS BER AT JJS NNS JJ IN JJ NN .
Costs of the effective energy produced by these sources is a major obstacle in the development of food-preservation processes .	NNS IN AT JJ NN VBN IN DTS NNS BEZ AT JJ NN IN AT NN IN NN NNS .
Estimated production costs of radiation energy from machine and nuclide sources range from $1 to $10 per Aj .	VBN NN NNS IN NN NN IN NN CC NN NNS VB IN NN IN NNS IN NN .
Conventional energy for processing foods is available in the range of at most a few cents per kwhr for electric power and the equivalent of a few mills per kwhr for process steam .	JJ NN IN VBG NNS BEZ JJ IN AT NN IN IN AP AT AP NNS IN NN IN JJ NN CC AT JJ IN AT AP NNS IN NN IN NN NN .
Radiation , therefore , is at an initial cost disadvantage even though only 1 to 10 per cent as much radiation energy as heat energy is required for radiopasteurization or radiosterilization .	NN , RB , BEZ IN AT JJ NN NN RB CS RB CD IN CD IN NN QL AP NN NN CS NN NN BEZ VBN IN NN CC NN .
What are the possibilities of lowered radiation production costs for the future ? ?	WDT BER AT NNS IN VBN NN NN NNS IN AT NN . .
It has been estimated that for applications on a megawatt scale costs might reach values in the neighborhood of 10 cents per kwhr for large-scale accelerators or for gamma radiation generated in a reactor core .	PPS HVZ BEN VBN CS IN NNS IN AT NN NN NNS MD VB NNS IN AT NN IN CD NNS IN NN IN NN NNS CC IN NN NN VBN IN AT NN NN .
No comparable reductions in the cost of nuclide radiation are foreseen .	AT JJ NNS IN AT NN IN NN NN BER VBN .
Such projections , however , appear highly speculative and the capacities involved are far beyond those foreseen for food-preservation facilities .	JJ NNS , RB , VB QL JJ CC AT NNS VBN BER RB IN DTS VBN IN NN NNS .
Because agricultural activities are seasonal and the areas of production and harvest of many foods are widely scattered geographically , and because of the high cost of transporting bulk food items any substantial distance to a central processing location , the use of large central processing stations , where low-cost radiation facilities approaching the megawatt range might be utilized , is inherently impracticable .	CS JJ NNS BER JJ CC AT NNS IN NN CC NN IN AP NNS BER RB VBN RB , CC RB IN AT JJ NN IN VBG JJ NN NNS DTI JJ NN IN AT JJ VBG NN , AT NN IN JJ JJ NN NNS , WRB NN NN NNS VBG AT NN NN MD BE VBN , BEZ RB JJ .
Present status of irradiation preservation of foods	AP-HL NN-HL IN-HL NN-HL NN-HL IN-HL NNS-HL
The objective of complete sterilization of foods is to produce a wholesome and palatable product capable of being stored without refrigeration for extended periods of time .	AT NN IN JJ NN IN NNS BEZ TO VB AT JJ CC JJ NN JJ IN BEG VBN IN NN IN VBN NNS IN NN .
Chief interest in radiosterilization resides in the military services .	JJS NN IN NN VBZ IN AT JJ NNS .
For them , providing appetizing food under battle or emergency conditions is a paramount consideration .	IN PPO , VBG JJ NN IN NN CC NN NNS BEZ AT JJS NN .
They require completely sterile foods capable of being stored without refrigeration , preferably items already cooked and ready to eat .	PPSS VB QL JJ NNS JJ IN BEG VBN IN NN , RB NNS RB VBN CC JJ TO VB .
High nutritional value , variety , palatability , and appetizing appearance are important for reasons of morale .	JJ JJ NN , NN , NN , CC JJ NN BER JJ IN NNS IN NN .
Foods for rear stations , which require cooking , but no refrigeration , are also of interest .	NNS IN JJ NNS , WDT VB VBG , CC AT NN , BER RB IN NN .
Of primary interest are meats .	IN JJ NN BER NNS .
Radiopasteurization , which produces fewer adverse sensory changes in food products , has potential usefulness in prolonging the keeping qualities of fresh and refrigerated food items .	NN , WDT VBZ AP JJ JJ NNS IN NN NNS , HVZ JJ NN IN VBG AT VBG NNS IN JJ CC VBN NN NNS .
Thus , food so processed might reach more remote markets and permit the consumer to enjoy more produce at peak freshness and palatability .	RB , NN RB VBN MD VB QL JJ NNS CC VB AT NN TO VB AP NN IN NN NN CC NN .
Commercial interest is chiefly in this type of treatment , as is military interest under peacetime conditions .	JJ NN BEZ RB IN DT NN IN NN , CS BEZ JJ NN IN NN NNS .
The present status of food preservation by ionizing radiation is discussed by food classes in the following paragraphs .	AT JJ NN IN NN NN IN VBG NN BEZ VBN IN NN NNS IN AT VBG NNS .
Meats	NNS-HL
The radiation processing of meat has received extensive investigation .	AT NN NN IN NN HVZ VBN JJ NN .
To date , the one meat showing favorable results at sterilization doses is pork .	IN NN , AT CD NN VBG JJ NNS IN NN NNS BEZ NN .
Of particular interest to the military services is the demonstration that roast pork , after radiosterilization , is superior in palatability to available canned pork products .	IN JJ NN IN AT JJ NNS BEZ AT NN CS NN NN , IN NN , BEZ JJ IN NN IN JJ VBN NN NNS .
Tests with beef have been largely unsuccessful because of the development of off-flavors .	NNS IN NN HV BEN RB JJ RB IN AT NN IN NNS .
A prime objective of the Army Quartermaster Corps program is to find the reasons for beef's low palatability and means of overcoming it , since it is a major and desirable dietary item .	AT JJ NN IN AT NN-TL NN-TL NN-TL NN BEZ TO VB AT NNS IN NN$ JJ NN CC NNS IN VBG PPO , CS PPS BEZ AT JJ CC JJ JJ NN .
Partly because low-level heat treatment is needed to inactivate enzymes before radiosterilization , treated fresh meats have the appearance of boiled or canned meat .	RB CS NN NN NN BEZ VBN TO VB NNS IN NN , VBN JJ NNS HV AT NN IN VBN CC VBN NN .
Off-flavor is a less severe problem with the radiopasteurization of meats , but problems of commercial acceptability remain .	NN BEZ AT QL JJ NN IN AT NN IN NNS , CC NNS IN JJ NN VB .
Moderate radiation doses of from 100,000 to 200,000 rads can extend the shelf life ( at 35 F ) of fresh beef from 5 days to 5 or 6 weeks .	JJ NN NNS IN IN CD IN CD NN MD VB AT NN NN ( IN CD NN ) IN JJ NN IN CD NNS IN CD CC CD NNS .
However , the problem of consumer acceptability remains .	RB , AT NN IN NN NN VBZ .
The preradiation blanching process discolors the treated beef and liquid accumulates in prepackaged cuts .	AT NN VBG NN VBZ AT VBN NN CC NN VBZ IN VBN NNS .
Cooked beef irradiated in the absence of oxygen assumes an unnatural pink color .	VBN NN VBN IN AT NN IN NN VBZ AT JJ JJ NN .
When lamb and mutton are irradiated at substerilization doses , the meat becomes dehydrated , the fat becomes chalky , and , again , unnatural changes in color occur .	WRB NN CC NN BER VBN IN JJ NNS , AT NN VBZ VBN , AT NN VBZ JJ , CC , RB , JJ NNS IN NN VB .
Ground meats such as fresh pork sausage and hamburger have a relatively short shelf life under refrigeration , and radiopasteurization might be thought to offer distinctly improved keeping qualities .	VBN NNS JJ CS JJ NN NN CC NN HV AT QL JJ NN NN IN NN , CC NN MD BE VBN TO VB RB VBN VBG NNS .
However , a major problem here is one of scale of processing ; ;	RB , AT JJ NN RB BEZ CD IN NN IN VBG . .
ground meats are usually prepared from scrap meats at the local level , whereas irradiation at economic volumes of production would require central processing and distribution facilities .	VBN NNS BER RB VBN IN NN NNS IN AT JJ NN , CS NN IN JJ NNS IN NN MD VB JJ VBG CC NN NNS .
The problems of color change by blanching and liquid accumulation within the package are the same as for solid cuts .	AT NNS IN NN NN IN VBG CC NN NN IN AT NN BER AT AP CS IN JJ NNS .
Specialty cooked items containing meat portions , as in `` frozen dinners '' might offer a potential use for radiopasteurization .	NN VBN NNS VBG NN NNS , CS IN `` VBN NNS '' MD NN AT JJ NN IN NN .
The principal potential advantage would be that the finished product could be transported and stored at lower cost under refrigeration instead of being frozen .	AT JJS JJ NN MD BE CS AT VBN NN MD BE VBN CC VBN IN JJR NN IN NN RB IN BEG VBN .
A refrigerated item could also be heated and served in less time than is required for frozen foods of the same type .	AT VBN NN MD RB BE VBN CC VBN IN AP NN CS BEZ VBN IN VBN NNS IN AT AP NN .
Competitive processes for preserving meats are by canning and freezing .	JJ NNS IN VBG NNS BER IN VBG CC VBG .
Costs of canning meat are in the range of 0.8 to 5 cents per pound ; ;	NNS IN VBG NN BER IN AT NN IN CD IN CD NNS IN NN . .
costs of freezing are in the area of 2 to 3.5 cents per pound .	NNS IN VBG BER IN AT NN IN CD IN CD NNS IN NN .
The table on page 10 shows costs of canning and freezing meat , and estimated costs for irradiation under certain assumed conditions .	AT NN IN NN CD VBZ NNS IN VBG CC VBG NN , CC VBN NNS IN NN IN AP VBN NNS .

Radiosterilization ( at 3 Mrad ) is more expensive than canning , particularly for the cesium-137 source .	NN ( IN CD NN ) BEZ QL JJ CS VBG , RB IN AT NN NN .

Radiopasteurization by either the electron accelerator or cesium-137 source is in the range of freezing costs .	NN IN CC AT NN NN CC NN NN BEZ IN AT NN IN VBG NNS .

Irradiation using the nuclide source is more expensive than use of an electron accelerator .	NN VBG AT NN NN BEZ QL JJ CS NN IN AT NN NN .
Poultry	NN-HL
Results of irradiation tests with poultry have been quite successful .	NNS IN NN NNS IN NN HV BEN QL JJ .
At sterilizing doses , good palatability results , with a minimum of changes in appearance , taste , and odor .	IN VBG NNS , JJ NN VBZ , IN AT NN IN NNS IN NN , NN , CC NN .
Radiopasteurization has also been successful , and the shelf life of chicken can be extended to a month or more under refrigerated storage as compared with about 10 days for the untreated product .	NN HVZ RB BEN JJ , CC AT NN NN IN NN MD BE VBN IN AT NN CC AP IN VBN NN CS VBN IN RB CD NNS IN AT JJ NN .
Acceptable taste and odor are retained by the irradiated and refrigerated chicken .	JJ NN CC NN BER VBN IN AT VBN CC VBN NN .
Acceptance of radiopasteurization is likely to be delayed , however , for two reasons : ( 1 ) the storage life of fresh chicken under refrigeration is becoming a minimal problem because of constantly improved sanitation and distributing practices , and ( 2 ) treatment by antibiotics , a measure already approved by the Federal Food and Drug Administration , serves to extend the storage life of chicken at a low cost of about 0.5 cents per pound .	NN IN NN BEZ JJ TO BE VBN , RB , IN CD NNS : ( CD ) AT NN NN IN JJ NN IN NN BEZ VBG AT JJ NN RB IN RB VBN NN CC VBG NNS , CC ( CD ) NN IN NNS , AT NN RB VBN IN AT JJ-TL NN-TL CC-TL NN-TL NN-TL , VBZ TO VB AT NN NN IN NN IN AT JJ NN IN RB CD NNS IN NN .
Seafood	NN-HL
Fresh seafood products are extremely perishable .	JJ NN NNS BER QL JJ .
Although refrigeration has served to extend the storage life of these products , substantially increased consumption might be possible if areas remote from the seacoast could be served adequately .	CS NN HVZ VBN TO VB AT NN NN IN DTS NNS , RB VBN NN MD BE JJ CS NNS JJ IN AT NN MD BE VBN RB .
Furthermore , it has made an exact assessment of the removal mechanisms possible .	RB , PPS HVZ VBN AT JJ NN IN AT NN NNS JJ .
The instrument is shown in Fig. 1 and consists essentially of a hard , sharp , tungsten carbide knife which is pushed along the substrate to remove the coating .	AT NN BEZ VBN IN NN-TL CD-TL CC VBZ RB IN AT JJ , JJ , NN NN NN WDT BEZ VBN IN AT NN TO VB AT NN .
The force required to accomplish removal is plotted , by means of an electronic recorder , against distance of removal .	AT NN VBN TO VB NN BEZ VBN , IN NN IN AT JJ NN , IN NN IN NN .
Since the removal force is a function of coating thickness , a differential transformer pickup has been incorporated into the instrument to accurately measure film thickness .	CS AT NN NN BEZ AT NN IN NN NN , AT JJ NN NN HVZ BEN VBN IN AT NN TO RB VB NN NN .
This , too , is recorded against distance by a repeat run over the same track previously cut .	DT , RB , BEZ VBN IN NN IN AT NN NN IN AT AP NN RB VBN .
A number of adjustment features are included in the Hesiometer to facilitate measurement and permit ready removal of coatings deposited on such substrates as iron and other metals , glass , wood , and plastic surfaces .	AT NN IN NN NNS BER VBN IN AT NN-TL TO VB NN CC VB JJ NN IN NNS VBN IN JJ NNS CS NN CC AP NNS , NN , NN , CC NN NNS .
The measurement of topcoats on primers can also readily be carried out .	AT NN IN NNS IN NNS MD RB RB BE VBN RP .
Hesiometer results have been found to compare excellently with manual knife scratching tests .	NN-TL NNS HV BEN VBN TO VB RB IN JJ NN VBG NNS .
The instrumental method , however , is about 100 times more sensitive and yields numerical results which can be accurately repeated at will over a period of time .	AT JJ NN , RB , BEZ RB CD NNS QL JJ CC VBZ JJ NNS WDT MD BE RB VBN IN NN IN AT NN IN NN .
If a wedge-shaped coating of increasing thickness is removed from a substrate by an instrument like the Hesiometer with a knife of constant rake angle , a number of removal mechanisms are often observed which depend upon the thickness of the coating .	CS AT JJ NN IN VBG NN BEZ VBN IN AT NN IN AT NN CS AT NN-TL IN AT NN IN JJ NN NN , AT NN IN NN NNS BER RB VBN WDT VB IN AT NN IN AT NN .
At low thicknesses a cutting ( or shearing ) phenomenon is often encountered .	IN JJ NNS AT VBG ( CC VBG ) NN BEZ RB VBN .
As the coating becomes thicker , the cutting may abruptly change to a cracking type of failure .	CS AT NN VBZ JJR , AT VBG MD RB VB IN AT VBG NN IN NN .
If the coating becomes still thicker , a peeling type failure finally can occur .	CS AT NN VBZ QL JJR , AT VBG NN NN RB MD VB .
The typical appearance of these various mechanisms is illustrated in Figs. 2 , 3 , and 4 , which are single frame enlargements of high speed movies taken during the course of the knife removal process .	AT JJ NN IN DTS AP NNS BEZ VBN IN NNS-TL CD-TL , CD-TL , CC CD , WDT BER AP NN NNS IN JJ NN NNS VBN IN AT NN IN AT NN NN NN .
It can be seen from Fig. 2 that the cutting removal of a coating from its substrate involves pure cohesive failure of the coating .	PPS MD BE VBN IN NN-TL CD-TL CS AT VBG NN IN AT NN IN PP$ NN VBZ JJ JJ NN IN AT NN .
The molecular forces holding the coating to the substrate are obviously greater than the cohesive strength of the coating and failure occurs by shear along a plane starting at the tip of the knife and extending to the coating surface .	AT JJ NNS VBG AT NN IN AT NN BER RB JJR CS AT JJ NN IN AT NN CC NN VBZ IN NN IN AT NN VBG IN AT NN IN AT NN CC VBG IN AT NN NN .
The pictures of Figs. 3 and 4 show the cracking and peeling types of removal where the coating is detached by failure in a region at , or close to , the interface between coating and substrate .	AT NNS IN NNS-TL CD-TL CC CD-TL VB AT VBG CC VBG NNS IN NN WRB AT NN BEZ VBN IN NN IN AT NN IN , CC RB IN , AT NN IN NN CC NN .
If the force required to remove the coatings is plotted against film thickness , a graph as illustrated schematically in Fig. 5 may characteristically result .	CS AT NN VBN TO VB AT NNS BEZ VBN IN NN NN , AT NN CS VBN RB IN NN-TL CD-TL MD RB VB .
Here , H is the coatings removal force measured parallel to the surface of the substrate and T is the film thickness .	RB , NN BEZ AT NNS NN NN VBN RB IN AT NN IN AT NN CC NP BEZ AT NN NN .
It can be seen that the force is characteristic of the removal process and changes abruptly from cutting to cracking to peeling removal .	PPS MD BE VBN CS AT NN BEZ JJ IN AT NN NN CC VBZ RB IN VBG IN VBG IN VBG NN .
Also , it can be readily seen that the cutting and peeling types of failure show a steady state response , while the cracking mechanism is of a dynamic nature .	RB , PPS MD BE RB VBN CS AT VBG CC VBG NNS IN NN VB AT JJ NN NN , CS AT VBG NN BEZ IN AT JJ NN .
It should be recalled that these three mechanisms can occur on the same coating deposited upon the same substrate merely as a function of changes in coatings thickness .	PPS MD BE VBN CS DTS CD NNS MD VB IN AT AP NN VBN IN AT AP NN RB CS AT NN IN NNS IN NNS NN .
Presumably the interfacial bond strength and gross cohesive properties are identical in each case .	RB AT JJ NN NN CC JJ JJ NNS BER JJ IN DT NN .
What then , are the factors that contribute to these phenomena ? ?	WDT RB , BER AT NNS WPS VB IN DTS NNS . .
Why should the `` practical adhesion '' of a coating as assessed by a knife method change , initially increasing rather rapidly and then decreasing stepwise to very low values as the knife is forced through a coating of increasing thickness ? ?	WRB MD AT `` JJ NN '' IN AT NN CS VBN IN AT NN NN VB , RB VBG QL RB CC RB VBG RB IN QL JJ NNS CS AT NN BEZ VBN IN AT NN IN VBG NN . .
Cutting mechanism of cohesive failure	VBG-HL NN-HL IN-HL JJ-HL NN-HL
The cutting ( or shearing ) removal process has been previously described .	AT VBG ( CC VBG ) NN NN HVZ BEN RB VBN .
It was found that the coating is separated from its substrate entirely by cohesive failure .	PPS BEDZ VBN CS AT NN BEZ VBN IN PP$ NN RB IN JJ NN .
The details of the removal process are shown schematically in Fig. 6 .	AT NNS IN AT NN NN BER VBN RB IN NN-TL CD-TL .
The various forces result from the reaction of the removed paint chip against the face of the knife and along the shear plane , which makes an angle **yf with the substrate .	AT AP NNS VB IN AT NN IN AT VBN NN NN IN AT NN IN AT NN CC IN AT NN NN , WDT VBZ AT NN NN IN AT NN .
The action and reaction forces are R and Af , respectively , and are equal and opposite in direction .	AT NN CC NN NNS BER NN CC NN , RB , CC BER JJ CC JJ IN NN .
All the other force vectors are derived from these .	QL AT AP NN NNS BER VBN IN DTS .
Af is the force required to cut a coating of thickness T from the substrate .	NN BEZ AT NN VBN TO VB AT NN IN NN NP IN AT NN .
Af is the shear force along the shear plane ; ;	NN BEZ AT NN NN IN AT NN NN . .
Af and Af are the thrust forces acting against coating and knife , respectively ; ;	NN CC NN BER AT NN NNS VBG IN NN CC NN , RB . .
Af is the normal compressive force acting on the shear plane ; ;	NN BEZ AT JJ JJ NN VBG IN AT NN NN . .
Af is the friction force between chip and knife surfaces , and P is the normal force acting on the face of the knife .	NN BEZ AT NN NN IN NN CC NN NNS , CC NN BEZ AT JJ NN VBG IN AT NN IN AT NN .
**yc is the rake angle of the knife ; ;	NN BEZ AT NN NN IN AT NN . .
**yf is the angle the shear plane makes with the substrate ; ;	NN BEZ AT NN AT NN NN VBZ IN AT NN . .
**yt is the friction angle ; ;	NN BEZ AT NN NN . .
and **yb is the angle the resultants make with the plane of the substrate .	CC NN BEZ AT NN AT NNS VB IN AT NN IN AT NN .
An analysis of the vector relationships shows that the rake angle **yc and the friction angle **yt determine the vector direction Af of the force resultants R and Af .	AT NN IN AT NN NNS VBZ CS AT NN NN NN CC AT NN NN NN VB AT NN NN NN IN AT NN NNS NN CC NN .
Consequently , both the rake angle of the knife as well as the friction occurring between the back of the removed coating and the front of the knife will determine in large part the detailed mechanism of the cutting removal process .	RB , ABX AT NN NN IN AT NN QL RB CS AT NN VBG IN AT NN IN AT VBN NN CC AT NN IN AT NN MD VB IN JJ NN AT VBN NN IN AT VBG NN NN .
It is difficult to measure the direction and magnitude of R directly .	PPS BEZ JJ TO VB AT NN CC NN IN NN RB .
In actual practice , the values most readily amenable to measurement are the cutting force Af and the shear angle Aj .	IN JJ NN , AT NNS QL RB JJ IN NN BER AT VBG NN NN CC AT NN NN NN .
These two values and the rake angle **yc are sufficient to determine the other parameters of these relationships .	DTS CD NNS CC AT NN NN NN BER JJ TO VB AT AP NNS IN DTS NNS .
**yc is defined by the geometry of the knife ; ;	NN BEZ VBN IN AT NN IN AT NN . .
**yf can readily be determined by measuring the thickness of the coating before and after cutting from the substrate ; ;	NN MD RB BE VBN IN VBG AT NN IN AT NN IN CC IN VBG IN AT NN . .
Af is instrumentally determined .	NN BEZ RB VBN .
From Fig. 6 the relationship between these parameters can readily be derived and the cutting force is Af where **yl is the shear strength of the coating and is a parameter of the coatings material , W is the width of the removed coating and T is its thickness .	IN NN-TL CD-TL AT NN IN DTS NNS MD RB BE VBN CC AT VBG NN BEZ NN WRB NN BEZ AT NN NN IN AT NN CC BEZ AT NN IN AT NNS NN , NP BEZ AT NN IN AT VBN NN CC NP BEZ PP$ NN .
If the cutting force , Af , is plotted against film thickness , a straight line should result passing through the origin and having slope Af .	CS AT VBG NN , NN , BEZ VBN IN NN NN , AT JJ NN MD VB VBG IN AT NN CC HVG NN NN .
However , in the actual assessment of the cutting force by instrumental methods for any thickness of coating a number of spurious effects occur which must be taken into account and which make the measured value larger than the true cutting force indicated by eqn. ( 1 ) .	RB , IN AT JJ NN IN AT VBG NN IN JJ NNS IN DTI NN IN NN AT NN IN JJ NNS VB WDT MD BE VBN IN NN CC WDT VB AT VBN NN JJR CS AT JJ VBG NN VBN IN NN ( CD ) .
Blunt knife	JJ-HL NN-HL
One of these is the fact that the knife employed , no matter how well sharpened , will have a slightly rounded cutting edge .	CD IN DTS BEZ AT NN CS AT NN VBN , AT NN WQL RB VBN , MD HV AT RB VBN VBG NN .
This signifies that **yc , the rake angle , is no longer a constant to zero film thickness .	DT VBZ CS NN , AT NN NN , BEZ QL RBR AT JJ IN CD NN NN .
The curvature of this bluntness is , in the case of the Carboloy knife employed in the Hesiometer , determined by the grain sizes of the polished grit and the tungsten carbide crystals cemented together in the knife body and is in the order of 0.1 to 0.2 mil. .	AT NN IN DT NN BEZ , IN AT NN IN AT NP NN VBN IN AT NN-TL , VBN IN AT NN NNS IN AT VBN NN CC AT NN NN NNS VBN RB IN AT NN NN CC BEZ IN AT NN IN CD IN CD NNS .
The force vector concept of Fig. 6 can readily be applied to this condition also .	AT NN NN NN IN NN-TL CD-TL MD RB BE VBN IN DT NN RB .
Because the rake angle Af at the tip of the knife is very much smaller ( or even negative ) when compared to the value of **yc for the major portion of the knife , a very rapid increase in cutting force with thickness will result .	CS AT NN NN NN IN AT NN IN AT NN BEZ QL QL JJR ( CC RB JJ ) WRB VBN IN AT NN IN NN IN AT JJ NN IN AT NN , AT QL JJ NN IN VBG NN IN NN MD VB .
This reduces to the relationship : Af , where Af is the intercept at zero thickness of the extrapolation of the slope indicated in eqn. ( 1 ) , Af is the thickness of the coating equivalent to the rounding off of the knife tip , Af is a straight line first approximation of this roundness , and the other symbols are equivalent to those of eqn. ( 1 ) .	DT VBZ IN AT NN : NN , WRB NN BEZ AT NN IN CD NN IN AT NN IN AT NN VBN IN NN ( CD ) , NN BEZ AT NN IN AT NN JJ IN AT NN RP IN AT NN NN , NN BEZ AT JJ NN OD NN IN DT NN , CC AT AP NNS BER JJ IN DTS IN NN ( CD ) .
It can be seen that Af is a constant , and is determined for the most part by the geometry of the knife .	PPS MD BE VBN DT NN BEZ AT NN , CC BEZ VBN IN AT AP NN IN AT NN IN AT NN .
The blunter the knife , the higher is the value of Af .	AT JJR AT NN , AT JJR BEZ AT NN IN NN .
The importance of a hard , abrasion-resistant knife material like the Carboloy employed in the Hesiometer immediately becomes apparent .	AT NN IN AT JJ , JJ NN NN CS AT NP VBN IN AT NN-TL RB VBZ JJ .
Softer knives would blunt very rapidly , making the value of Af inexact .	JJR NNS MD VB QL RB , VBG AT NN IN NN JJ .
In extreme cases of very soft knives this value may even change during the course of a measurement .	IN JJ NNS IN QL JJ NNS DT NN MD RB VB IN AT NN IN AT NN .
Knife friction	NN-HL NN-HL
A second factor which enters into the practical measurement of the instrumentally determined cutting force is the frictional resistance caused by the bottom of the knife against the substrate .	AT OD NN WDT VBZ IN AT JJ NN IN AT RB VBN VBG NN BEZ AT JJ NN VBN IN AT NN IN AT NN IN AT NN .
This is not a constant value like Af , but varies with the thickness of the coating and the direction and magnitude of the resultants R and Af of Fig. 6 .	DT BEZ * AT JJ NN CS NN , CC VBZ IN AT NN IN AT NN CC AT NN CC NN IN AT NNS NN CC NN IN NN-TL CD-TL .
Under equilibrium conditions of cutting the chip exerts a thrust Af against the knife which tends to push it into the substrate or lift it away from the substrate depending on the vector direction of Af .	IN NN NNS IN VBG AT NN VBZ AT NN NN IN AT NN WDT VBZ TO VB PPO IN AT NN CC VB PPO RB IN AT NN IN IN AT NN NN IN NN .
The resultant friction force , Af is thus directly proportional to Af and consequently also to film thickness .	AT JJ NN NN , NN BEZ RB RB JJ IN NN CC RB RB IN NN NN .
The value of Af can readily be assessed by determining the frictional force exerted on the knife while running over the previously stripped coating track under various external loadings .	AT NN IN NN MD RB BE VBN IN VBG AT JJ NN VBN IN AT NN CS VBG IN AT RB VBN NN NN IN AP JJ NNS .
A straight line relationship is usually observed in a plot of Af against load L , having slope k , and Af .	AT JJ NN NN BEZ RB VBN IN AT NN IN NN IN NN NN , HVG NN NN , CC NN .
Since the load L , under actual cutting conditions is caused by Af , it can be seen that Af	CS AT NN NN , IN JJ VBG NNS BEZ VBN IN NN , PPS MD BE VBN DT NN
.	.
The measured force , H , in cutting removal of coatings from their substrates consequently can be seen to be the sum of that force required to cut the coating , Af , that due to the bluntness of the knife , Af , and that due to the friction between the bottom of the knife and the substrate , Af , or Af .	AT VBD NN , NN , IN VBG NN IN NNS IN PP$ NNS RB MD BE VBN TO BE AT NN IN DT NN VBN TO VB AT NN , NN , DT JJ IN AT NN IN AT NN , NN , CC DT JJ IN AT NN IN AT NN IN AT NN CC AT NN , NN , CC NN .
The first two forces are directly interrelated and depend upon film thickness , whereas Af is independent of these two and is a constant for a given knife/coating combination .	AT RB CD NNS BER RB VBN CC VB IN NN NN , CS NN BEZ JJ IN DTS CD CC BEZ AT NN IN AT VBN NN NN .
These theoretical relationships are more clearly illustrated in Fig. 7 and their sum can be seen to correlate in form with practical measurements made with the Hesiometer as illustrated in the first portion of Fig. 5 for the cutting mechanism .	DTS JJ NNS BER QL RB VBN IN NN-TL CD-TL CC PP$ NN MD BE VBN TO VB IN NN IN JJ NNS VBN IN AT NN-TL CS VBN IN AT OD NN IN NN-TL CD-TL IN AT VBG NN .
Chipping mechanism of cohesive failure	VBG NN IN JJ NN
Although a large number of coatings systems , particularly at low thicknesses fail cohesively by the cutting mechanism , frequently a second type of cohesive failure may also take place .	CS AT JJ NN IN NNS NNS , RB IN JJ NNS VB RB IN AT VBG NN , RB AT OD NN IN JJ NN MD RB VB NN .
This is a chipping , dynamic type failure encountered with very brittle coatings resins or very highly pigmented films .	DT BEZ AT VBG , JJ NN NN VBN IN QL JJ NNS NNS CC QL QL JJ NNS .
This is shown in the photomicrograph of Fig. 8 .	DT BEZ VBN IN AT NN IN NN-TL CD-TL .
The basic difference between the continuous cutting mechanism and that of the chipping mechanism is that instead of shear occurring in the coating ahead of the knife continuously without fracture , rupture intermittently occurs along the shear plane .	AT JJ NN IN AT JJ VBG NN CC DT IN AT VBG NN BEZ CS RB IN NN VBG IN AT NN RB IN AT NN RB IN NN , NN RB VBZ IN AT NN NN .
The detailed mechanisms of this type of failure have been studied extensively by Merchant for metal cutting , and the principles found can be directly applied to coatings .	AT VBN NNS IN DT NN IN NN HV BEN VBN RB IN NP IN NN NN , CC AT NNS VBN MD BE RB VBN IN NNS .
By studying high speed movies made of this type of failure , the sequence of relationships as schematically illustrated in Fig. 9 could be observed .	IN VBG JJ NN NNS VBN IN DT NN IN NN , AT NN IN NNS CS RB VBN IN NN-TL CD-TL MD BE VBN .
In the first picture ( 9a ) the knife is just beginning to advance into the inclined surface which was left from the previous chip formation .	IN AT OD NN ( CD ) AT NN BEZ RB VBG TO VB IN AT VBN NN WDT BEDZ VBN IN AT AP NN NN .
In the next , the shear plane angle is high , and extends to the inclined work surface .	IN AT AP , AT NN NN NN BEZ JJ , CC VBZ IN AT VBN NN NN .
With increasing advance of the knife into the coating the shear plane extends to the coatings surface and the shear angle rapidly decreases .	IN VBG NN IN AT NN IN AT NN AT NN NN VBZ IN AT NNS NN CC AT NN NN RB VBZ .
Eventually , rupture occurs along the shear plane ( 9e ) , and the cycle repeats itself .	RB , NN VBZ IN AT NN NN ( CD ) , CC AT NN VBZ PPL .
Merchant has found that the same basic relationships which describe the geometry and force systems in the case of the cutting mechanism can also be applied to the discontinuous chip formation provided the proper values of instantaneous shear angle and instantaneous chip thickness or cross-sectional area are used .	NP HVZ VBN CS AT AP JJ NNS WDT VB AT NN CC NN NNS IN AT NN IN AT VBG NN MD RB BE VBN IN AT JJ NN NN VBN AT JJ NNS IN JJ NN NN CC JJ NN NN CC JJ NN BER VBN .
Consequently , if the shear angle **yf is replaced by the rupture angle Af , the relationships as described in eqns. ( 1 ) , ( 2 ) , ( 4 ) , and ( 6 ) will directly apply .	RB , CS AT NN NN NN BEZ VBN IN AT NN NN NN , AT NNS CS VBN IN NNS ( CD ) , ( CD ) , ( CD ) , CC ( CD ) MD RB VB .
The cracking mechanism	AT-HL VBG-HL NN-HL
Under equilibrium cutting conditions , the chip exerts a force Af against the coating and an equal opposite force Af against the knife in the plane of the substrate as shown in Fig. 6 .	IN NN VBG NNS , AT NN VBZ AT NN NN IN AT NN CC AT JJ JJ NN NN IN AT NN IN AT NN IN AT NN CS VBN IN NN-TL CD-TL .
If the rake angle **yc of the knife is high enough and the friction angle **yt between the front of the knife and the back of the chip is low enough to give a positive value for Af , the resultant vector R will lie above the plane of the substrate .	CS AT NN NN NN IN AT NN BEZ JJ QLP CC AT NN NN NN IN AT NN IN AT NN CC AT NN IN AT NN BEZ JJ QLP TO VB AT JJ NN IN NN , AT JJ NN NN MD VB IN AT NN IN AT NN .
Within only a few years , foamed plastics materials have managed to grow into an integral , and important , phase of the plastics industry -- and the end is still not yet in sight .	IN RB AT AP NNS , VBN NNS NNS HV VBN TO VB IN AT JJ , CC JJ , NN IN AT NNS NN -- CC AT NN BEZ RB * RB IN NN .
Urethane foam , as only one example , was only introduced commercially in this country in 1955 .	NN NN , CS RB CD NN , BEDZ RB VBN RB IN DT NN IN CD .
Yet last year's volume probably topped 100 million lb. and expectations are for a market of 275 million lb. by 1964 .	CC AP NN$ NN RB VBD CD CD NNS CC NNS BER IN AT NN IN CD CD NNS IN CD .
Many of the other foamed plastics , particularly the styrenes , show similar growth potential .	AP IN AT AP VBN NNS , RB AT NNS , VB JJ NN NN .
And there are even newer foamed plastics that are yet to be evaluated .	CC EX BER RB JJR VBN NNS WPS BER RB TO BE VBN .
As this issue goes to press , for example , one manufacturer has announced an epoxy foam with outstanding buoyancy and impact strength ; ;	CS DT NN VBZ IN NN , IN NN , CD NN HVZ VBN AT NN NN IN JJ NN CC NN NN . .
another reports that a cellular polypropylene , primarily for use in wire coating applications , is being investigated .	DT VBZ CS AT JJ NN , RB IN NN IN NN NN NNS , BEZ BEG VBN .
On the following pages , each of the major commercial foamed plastics is described in detail , as to properties , applications , and methods of processing .	IN AT VBG NNS , DT IN AT JJ JJ VBN NNS BEZ VBN IN NN , IN IN NNS , NNS , CC NNS IN VBG .
It might be well to point out , however , some of the newer developments that have taken place within the past few months which might have a bearing on the future of the various foamed plastics involved .	PPS MD BE JJ TO VB RP , RB , DTI IN AT JJR NNS WPS HV VBN NN IN AT AP AP NNS WDT MD HV AT NN IN AT NN IN AT AP VBN NNS VBN .
In urethane foams , for example , there has been a definite trend toward the polyether-type materials ( which are now available in two-component rigid foam systems ) and the emphasis is definitely on one-shot molding .	IN NN NNS , IN NN , EX HVZ BEN AT JJ NN IN AT JJ NNS ( WDT BER RB JJ IN JJ JJ NN NNS ) CC AT NN BEZ RB IN JJ VBG .
Most manufacturers also seem to be concentrating on formulating fire-resistant or self-extinguishing grades of urethane foam that are aimed specifically at the burgeoning building markets .	AP NNS RB VB TO BE VBG IN VBG JJ CC JJ NNS IN NN NN WPS BER VBN RB IN AT VBG VBG NNS .
Urethane foam as an insulator is also coming in for a good deal of attention .	NN NN CS AT NN BEZ RB VBG RP IN AT JJ NN IN NN .
In one outstanding example , Whirlpool Corp. found that by switching to urethane foam insulation , they could increase the storage capacity of gas refrigerators to make them competitive with electric models .	IN CD JJ NN , NP-TL NN-TL VBD CS IN VBG IN NN NN NN , PPSS MD VB AT NN NN IN NN NNS TO VB PPO JJ IN JJ NNS .
Much interest has also been expressed in new techniques for processing the urethane foams , including spraying , frothing , and molding ( see article , p. 391 for details ) .	AP NN HVZ RB BEN VBN IN JJ NNS IN VBG AT NN NNS , IN VBG , VBG , CC VBG ( VB NN , NN CD IN NNS ) .
And in meeting the demands for urethane foam as a garment interlining , new adhesives and new methods of laminating foam to a substrate have been developed .	CC IN VBG AT NNS IN NN NN CS AT NN NN , JJ NNS CC JJ NNS IN VBG NN IN AT NN HV BEN VBN .
New techniques for automatic molding of expandable styrene beads have helped boost that particular material into a number of new consumer applications , including picnic chests , beverage coolers , flower pots , and flotation-type swimming toys .	JJ NNS IN JJ NN IN JJ NN NNS HV VBN VB DT AP NN IN AT NN IN JJ NN NNS , IN NN NNS , NN NNS , NN NNS , CC JJ VBG NNS .
Two other end-use areas which contributed to expandable styrene's growth during the year were packaging ( molded inserts replacing complicated cardboard units ) and foamed-core building panels .	CD AP JJ NNS WDT VBD IN JJ NN$ NN IN AT NN BED VBG ( VBN NNS VBG VBN NN NNS ) CC NN VBG NNS .
Extruded expandable styrene film or sheet -- claimed to be competitive price-wise with paper -- also showed much potential , particularly for packaging .	VBN JJ NN NN CC NN -- VBN TO BE JJ RB IN NN -- RB VBD AP NN , RB IN VBG .
Sandwich panels for building utility shelters that consist of kraft paper skins and rigid styrene foam cores also aroused interest in the construction field .	NN NNS IN VBG NN NNS WPS VB IN NN NN NNS CC JJ NN NN NNS RB VBD NN IN AT NN NN .
In vinyl foam , the big news was the development of techniques for coating fabrics with the material ( for details , see P. 395 ) .	IN NN NN , AT JJ NN BEDZ AT NN IN NNS IN VBG NNS IN AT NN ( IN NNS , VB NN-TL CD-TL ) .
Better `` hand '' , a more luxurious feel , and better insulating properties were claimed to be the result .	JJR `` NN '' , AT QL JJ NN , CC JJR VBG NNS BED VBN TO BE AT NN .
Several companies also saw possibilities in using the technique for extruding or molding vinyl products with a slight cellular core that would reduce costs yet would not affect physical properties of the end product to any great extent .
